column7: Wee do confesse and knowledge the resurrection, but the merites thereof, we doo cleane take awaye, and condemne.
column8: we do confess and knowledge the resurrection, but the merits thereof, we do clean take away, and condemn.

column7: Howe so? Throughe trustinge in workes, to the whyche wee ascribe ryghteousnes. <NOTE> And therefore yf thou wylte goe the highe waye, and pull nothinge frome the merites of Christ, thou must beleue not alonly that Christ dyed and rose agayne, but that hee dyed and rose for the (for the I saye) and all synners dyd hee pleasure and seruice therewith.
column8: Howe so? Through trusting in works, to the which we ascribe righteousness. And Therefore if thou wilt go the high Way, and pull nothing from the merits of christ, thou must believe not alonely that christ died and rose again, but that he died and rose for the (for the I say) and all Sinners did he pleasure and service therewith.

column7: For through hys deathe he tooke away thy sinnes, and by his resurrection he hath iustified the.

column8: As the father sent me, even so send I you also.

column7: And when he had sayd those words, he breathed on them, and sayd vnto the:
column8: And when he had said those words, he breathed on them, and said unto thee:

column7: Because the holy ghost. Whose so euer synnes ye remitte, they are remitted vnto the.
column8: Because the holy ghost. Whose so ever Sins you remit, they Are remitted unto thee.

column7: And whose soeuers sinnes ye retayne, they are retayned. THE EXPOSITION.
column8: And whose soevers Sins you retain, they Are retained. THE EXPOSITION.

column7: <NOTE> F Yrste of all, here we maye marke and se an exaumple of incredulitie in the apostles, and howe meekely Christ suffereth their imbecility and weakenes, and dothe not straight wayes caste them of.
column8: First First of all, Here we may mark and see an Exampl of incredulity in the Apostles, and how meekly christ suffers their imbecility and weakness, and doth not straight ways cast them of.

column7: The women shewed them that Christ was risen from death, and that it was shewed and tolde them by the aungel,
column8: The women showed them that christ was risen from death, and that it was showed and told them by the angel,

column7: <NOTE> but (as S.
column8: but (as S.

column7: Luke witnesseth) they toke their wordes for a iest, and dyd not beleue them.
column8: Lycia Witnesseth) they took their words for a jest, and did not believe them.

column7: Yet this notwithstanding, at the hearyng of it, they were gathered togither.
column8: Yet this notwithstanding, At the hearing of it, they were gathered together.

column7: But howe? Very priuely, and with the dores shutte.
column8: But how? Very privily, and with the doors shut.

column7: Why so? For fear of the Iewes.
column8: Why so? For Fear of the Jews.

column7: <NOTE> Lo, behold and marke, here ye haue excellently set forth the power and myghte of the fleshe.
column8: Lo, behold and mark, Here you have excellently Set forth the power and might of the Flesh.

column7: For the Apostles, thoughe the women hadde shewed theym, yet dyd not they beleue, that Christ was risen from death.
column8: For the Apostles, though the women had showed them, yet did not they believe, that christ was risen from death.

column7: Moreouer they were stryken with so great feare, that they gathered togither priuely, and ther abode with the dores shut to theim.
column8: Moreover they were stricken with so great Fear, that they gathered together privily, and there Abided with the doors shut to them.

column7: Whoe dare nowe be so bolde, as to saye, that the fleshe can do any thinge, in thinges pertayning to our iustifiyng?
column8: Who Dare now be so bold, as to say, that the Flesh can do any thing, in things pertaining to our justifying?

column7: They that be after the flesh, are fleshly minded,
column8: They that be After the Flesh, Are fleshly minded,

column7: <NOTE> as Paule witnesseth.
column8: as Paul Witnesseth.

column7: Nowe if a fleshly man be fleshly minded, he can not lyghtly beleue in Christ, which rose from death,
column8: Now if a fleshly man be fleshly minded, he can not lightly believe in christ, which rose from death,

column7: & was the first of the dead that rose, as the same S.
column8: & was the First of the dead that rose, as the same S.

column7: Paule likewise declareth in the actes of the Apostles.
column8: Paul likewise Declareth in the acts of the Apostles.

column7: <NOTE> And in this poynt must the holy ghost worke.
column8: And in this point must the holy ghost work.

column7: For when he thorough the word is giuen vs,
column8: For when he through the word is given us,

column7: & hath made vs newe creatures, then shall we no more feare men as the apostles here do, but we shall feare god, not as a seruaut feareth his maister, but as ye welbeloued son, whiche diligently will take heede and beware, that he doth not that thing, that shal prouoke his father that is in heauen to angre.
column8: & hath made us new creatures, then shall we not more Fear men as the Apostles Here do, but we shall Fear god, not as a seruaut fears his master, but as you well-beloved son, which diligently will take heed and beware, that he does not that thing, that shall provoke his father that is in heaven to anger.

column7: Such feare doth Christ teache vs, saiyng:
column8: Such Fear does christ teach us, saying:

column7: <NOTE> Feare not theim that kylle the body, but rathet feare him that hath power to kyll both body and sowle for euer. <NOTE> Surely all they that be lightened with ye holy spirite, ar bold,
column8: fear not them that kill the body, but rathet Fear him that hath power to kill both body and soul for ever. Surely all they that be lightened with you holy Spirit, Are bold,

column7: & do wtout any feare persist and perseuere in the knowledging of the trewth and the gospell.
column8: & do without any Fear persist and persevere in the knowledging of the truth and the gospel.

column7: Yea very then, when they suffre and are rebuked for the truth of the gospelles sake, as the Apostels did:
column8: Yea very then, when they suffer and Are rebuked for the truth of the gospels sake, as the Apostles did:

column7: as the actes of the Apostels witnesseth:
column8: as the acts of the Apostles Witnesseth:

column7: They departed from the presence of the counsaile, reioysing, that they were worthye to suffre rebuke for his names sake.
column8: They departed from the presence of the counsel, rejoicing, that they were worthy to suffer rebuke for his names sake.

column7: Nowe bycause that the apostles had not so greate strengthe and faith,
column8: Now Because that the Apostles had not so great strength and faith,

column7: Christe cometh and appeareth, commending and announcynge his peace vnto them.
column8: Christ comes and appears, commending and announcynge his peace unto them.

column7: And also giueth them his holy ghoste, which afterwarde vppon Witsondaye, shulde be confirmed in theyr hartes, that nothinge shulde be lefte behinde, wher throughe theyr faythe myghte bee increased.
column8: And also gives them his holy ghost, which afterward upon Whitsunday, should be confirmed in their hearts, that nothing should be left behind, where through their faith might be increased.

column7: <NOTE> Here wee muste needes bringe in saincte Thomas wyth his incredulitie, which wolde not beleue, vnto suche tyme he saw and felte.
column8: Here we must needs bring in saint Thomas with his incredulity, which would not believe, unto such time he saw and felt.

column7: How goodly I pray you did he take heed vnto Christs wordes,
column8: How goodly I pray you did he take heed unto Christ words,

column7: & kepe in remembrance yt Christ had said, namely yt he shuld be delyuered vnto the Gentiles,
column8: & keep in remembrance that christ had said, namely that he should be Delivered unto the Gentiles,

column7: <NOTE> & they shuld mock him,
column8: & they should mock him,

column7: & put him to death,
column8: & put him to death,

column7: & that the third day he shuld rise?
column8: & that the third day he should rise?

column7: Yet neuertheles Christ did him lyke seruice, as he did the other. For eight daies after he came & saide vnto Thomas:
column8: Yet nevertheless christ did him like service, as he did the other. For eight days After he Come & said unto Thomas:

column7: <NOTE> Reache hither thy hand, and put it in my syde, and be not vnfaithfull, but beleue.
column8: Reach hither thy hand, and put it in my side, and be not unfaithful, but believe.

column7: Here is the hart of Thomas opened, so that he crieth out and saith:
column8: Here is the heart of Thomas opened, so that he cries out and Says:

column7: My lord, my god.
column8: My lord, my god.

column7: Out of all these thingis it must needs folow,
column8: Out of all these things it must needs follow,

column7: <NOTE> that we (concernig our nature and kind) ar euell and very mischieuous, and euer prone to incredulitie and misbeliefe, and that wee cannot with our owne power attaine vnto faith, except through the word of god, the holy ghoste be geuen vs, and that he lykewise as Christe serued the Apostels, maye serue and asiste vs also.
column8: that we (Concerning our nature and kind) Are evil and very mischievous, and ever prove to incredulity and misbelief, and that we cannot with our own power attain unto faith, except through the word of god, the holy ghost be given us, and that he likewise as Christ served the Apostles, may serve and asiste us also.

column7: <NOTE> Secondarily, we haue in this gospel the frute & commoditie of the resurrection, that is to say, peace and tranquility of our consciences, which is he^ thre times pronouced to ye Apostels.
column8: Secondarily, we have in this gospel the fruit & commodity of the resurrection, that is to say, peace and tranquillity of our Consciences, which is he^ Three times pronounced to you Apostles.

column7: To haue peace <NOTE> with god is no other thing, then to beleue ye Christe died for vs, and rose from death for our iustificacio in so much that nowe sin can neither accuse vs, nor condemne vs.
column8: To have peace with god is no other thing, then to believe you Christ died for us, and rose from death for our iustificacio in so much that now since can neither accuse us, nor condemn us

column7: But who giueth suche peace?
column8: But who gives such peace?

column7: Christ oure lorde. Whereby?
column8: christ our lord. Whereby?

column7: By his worde, in the which the merite of his passion and resurrection is freely offred & gyuen vnto vs.
column8: By his word, in the which the merit of his passion and resurrection is freely offered & given unto us

column7: Likewise in the same word the holly ghoste is giuen vnto vs, which worketh faith in vs, whiche faith comprehendeth the mercy of god in Christ, and to Christ shee casteth vp hyr eyen, in hym shee putteth hyr truste and confydence, and finallye, shee knoweth all her synnes to be forgyuen by Christe.
column8: Likewise in the same word the holly ghost is given unto us, which works faith in us, which faith comprehendeth the mercy of god in christ, and to christ she Cast up her eyes, in him she putteth her trust and confidence, and finally, she Knoweth all her Sins to be forgiven by Christ.

column7: Wherefore then shulde not the conscience haue peace?
column8: Wherefore then should not the conscience have peace?

column7: If she knewe and tooke God firste for a straight iudge, now she knoweth him and taketh him for a louing and mercifull father, that mercifully wyll defende and saue her, and that by Christ.
column8: If she knew and took God First for a straight judge, now she Knoweth him and Takes him for a loving and merciful father, that mercifully will defend and save her, and that by christ.

column7: This peace doth S. Paul praise and wisheth to all christian menne, when he writeth in his epistles:
column8: This peace does S. Paul praise and wishes to all christian men, when he Writeth in his Epistles:

column7: <NOTE> Grace and peace from God the father, and frome oure lorde Iesu Christe.
column8: Grace and peace from God the father, and from our lord Jesu Christ.

column7: By grace (yf we do beleue) we obteine remissio of sines, whom the peace aforesaide foloweth.
column8: By grace (if we do believe) we obtain Remission of sines, whom the peace aforesaid Followeth.

column7: Where oute marke, that they that intende to obteine remission with their workes, haue not this peace, as witnesseth scripture:
column8: Where out mark, that they that intend to obtain remission with their works, have not this peace, as Witnesseth scripture:

column7: The wicked me haue no peace,
column8: The wicked me have no peace,

column7: <NOTE> saith the lorde:
column8: Says the lord:

column7: But how maye this be?
column8: But how may this be?

column7: Bicause they go aboute to obteine remission & peace with God, thorow deseruing of workes, which is vnpossible.
column8: Because they go about to obtain remission & peace with God, thorough deserving of works, which is unpossible.

column7: So longe as no man can do so muche as he is bounde for to do, so long must he needs doubte & be vncertayne, whether he please & be acceptable vnto God or no.
column8: So long as no man can do so much as he is bound for to do, so long must he needs doubt & be uncertain, whither he please & be acceptable unto God or no.

column7: And in so doubtyng, I pray the,
column8: And in so doubting, I pray thee,

column7: <NOTE> how can thy harte and conscience be pacefied and at reste, when thou arte doubtefull, whether thy sinnes be forgiuen the or no?
column8: how can thy heart and conscience be pacified and At rest, when thou art doubtful, whither thy Sins be forgiven the or no?

column7: Wherefore it is faithe that getteth this peace, whiche cleaueth and hangeth to the resurrection of Christe, and not to deseruing of workes.
column8: Wherefore it is faith that gets this peace, which cleaveth and hangs to the resurrection of Christ, and not to deserving of works.

column7: Thirdely and last of all, here we may se and cosidre, in what manner of wise the apostels were sent forth to preache the gospell.
column8: Thirdly and last of all, Here we may see and Consider, in what manner of wise the Apostles were sent forth to preach the gospel.

column7: As the father sente me (saith Christe) so doo I sende you.
column8: As the father sent me (Says Christ) so do I send you.

column7: But howe was Christ sente?
column8: But how was christ sent?

column7: That he shulde preach repentaunce & remission of sinne.
column8: That he should preach Repentance & remission of sin.

column7: That selfe same preachinge (for as much as it is contrari to our reaso and capacity which alwayes trusteth in the deseruinge of oure workes) did so stirre vp against Christe all Ierusalem and Iewry, that they named not him all only a false deceiuer of the people, and possessed with a diuell, but also after so greate benefites doone vnto theym, moste dispitefully crucified him, and put him to deathe.
column8: That self same preaching (for as much as it is contrari to our reason and capacity which always Trusteth in the deserving of our works) did so stir up against Christ all Jerusalem and Jewry, that they nam not him all only a false deceiver of the people, and possessed with a Devil, but also After so great benefits done unto them, most despitefully Crucified him, and put him to death.

column7: Neuertheles yet muste we confesse, that this poore, dispised, scourged, and crucifyed Christe, had auctoritie and power of the father, to forgiue sinne.
column8: Nevertheless yet must we confess, that this poor, despised, scourged, and Crucified Christ, had Authority and power of the father, to forgive sin.

column7: <NOTE> After this manner wise also are the apostles sent forth that in the name of Christ they shulde preach repentaunce and remission of sinnes to all people,
column8: After this manner wise also Are the Apostles sent forth that in the name of christ they should preach Repentance and remission of Sins to all people,

column7: <NOTE> beginnyng at Ierusalem.
column8: beginning At Jerusalem.

column7: &c. Further more that they shulde haue lykewise power also as Christe had:
column8: etc. Further more that they should have likewise power also as Christ had:

column7: That is to saye, power throughe the word to forgiue and retayne sinnes.
column8: That is to say, power through the word to forgive and retain Sins.

column7: Also, as Christ was dispised & persecuted, that they euen so shuld of the worlde be dispised and persecuted.
column8: Also, as christ was despised & persecuted, that they even so should of the world be despised and persecuted.

column7: But thou wilte saye. Can the priest torgiue sinne?
column8: But thou wilt say. Can the priest torgiue sin?

column7: Doeth not that al only pertayn vnto god?
column8: Doth not that all only pertain unto god?

column7: I aunswere: Truth it is, that through Christ we haue remission of sinne yet notwithstanding, ther must ministers be in this busines, by whome this precious treasure must be published, opened and distributed.
column8: I answer: Truth it is, that through christ we have remission of sin yet notwithstanding, there must Ministers be in this business, by whom this precious treasure must be published, opened and distributed.

column7: The minister of the gospell (as concernynge his owne power) doth not forgiue sinne, but through the commission and worde of Christe.
column8: The minister of the gospel (as Concerning his own power) does not forgive sin, but through the commission and word of Christ.

column7: <NOTE> Therefore when thou heareste the gospell out of the mouthe of the preacher, and beleuest the worde, whether it be openly or priuately ministred, thy sinnes be forgiuen the.
column8: Therefore when thou Hearst the gospel out of the Mouth of the preacher, and Believest the word, whither it be openly or privately ministered, thy Sins be forgiven the.

column7: And thou hast not here respect vnto the persone that denounseth the remission of sinnes, but vnto the commaundement and word of Christ. <NOTE>
column8: And thou hast not Here respect unto the person that denounseth the remission of Sins, but unto the Commandment and word of christ.

column7: And thou doest not here receyue and heare the preacher, but Christ himselfe as he saith:
column8: And thou dost not Here receive and hear the preacher, but christ himself as he Says:

column7: He that receiueth you, receaueth me.
column8: He that receiveth you, receiveth me.

column7: And although ye precher be he ye aloly wt the mouth absolueth the,
column8: And although you preacher be he the aloly with the Mouth absolveth thee,

column7: & declareth and promiseth the remission of sinnes through the worde, yet Christe is he that fulfilleth it, which hath committed this thing to the minister here to be done with his word.
column8: & Declareth and promises the remission of Sins through the word, yet Christ is he that fulfilleth it, which hath committed this thing to the minister Here to be done with his word.

column7: Here to pertaineth that Christe faithe:
column8: Here to pertaineth that Christ faith:

column7: Whose sinnes so euer you remitte, they are remitted vnto them:
column8: Whose Sins so ever you remit, they Are remitted unto them:

column7: And whose sinnes so euer ye retaine, they are retayned With the which wordes he declareth him selfe, how & in what maner shuld be vnderstande the promise made vnto Peter.
column8: And whose Sins so ever you retain, they Are retained With the which words he Declareth him self, how & in what manner should be understand the promise made unto Peter.

column7: <NOTE> Peter in the perso & steed of all ye apostels saide:
column8: Peter in the Person & steed of all you Apostles said:

column7: Thou arte Christe the sonne of the liuinge God:
column8: Thou art Christ the son of the living God:

column7: Lykewise in the persone of Peter was gyuen power to all the Apostelles, to open and shutte heauen, which thinge so to bee, is here by this gospell manifest and playne.
column8: Likewise in the person of Peter was given power to all the Apostles, to open and shut heaven, which thing so to be, is Here by this gospel manifest and plain.

column7: Fynally, the Apostelles are sence to preache repentaunce, and to forgyue synnes, and that not of theym selues, but by the power of Christe, and by his worde.
column8: Finally, the Apostles Are sense to preach Repentance, and to forgive Sins, and that not of them selves, but by the power of Christ, and by his word.

column7: The seconde sonday after Easter. Iohn, 10.
column8: The seconde Sunday After Easter. John, 10.

column7: I Am the good shepehard.
column8: I Am the good shepehard.

column7: A good shepeherd geueth his lyfe for the sheepe.
column8: A good shepherd Giveth his life for the sheep.

column7: An hyred seruaunte, and he which is not the shepeharde, neyther the sheepe are hys owne, seeth the wolfe commynge, and leaueth the sheepe, and flyeth, and the wolfe catcheth and scattereth the shepe.
column8: an hired servant, and he which is not the shepeharde, neither the sheep Are his own, sees the wolf coming, and Leaveth the sheep, and flies, and the wolf Catches and Scattereth the sheep.

column7: The hired seruaunt flieth, bicause he is an hyred seruaunt and careth not for the sheepe I am the good sheeph^rd and knowe my sheepe, and am knowen of myne.
column8: The hired servant flies, Because he is an hired servant and Careth not for the sheep I am the good sheeph^rd and know my sheep, and am known of mine.

column7: As my father knoweth me, euen so knowe I also my father.
column8: As my father Knoweth me, even so know I also my father.

column7: And <NOTE> I geue my lyfe for the sheep.
column8: And I give my life for the sheep.

column7: And other sheepe I haue, whych are not of this folde, them also muste I bringe and they shall heare my voice, and there shalbe one folde and one shepeharde. THE EXPOSITION. <NOTE> IN this similitude firste of all, a good shepeherd and a hyred seruaunte be compared, and the nature and propertie of both be described.
column8: And other sheep I have, which Are not of this fold, them also must I bring and they shall hear my voice, and there shall one fold and one shepeharde. THE EXPOSITION. IN this similitude First of all, a good shepherd and a hired servant be compared, and the nature and property of both be described.

column7: But this is to be noted, that this present gospel is part of the similitude, which Christe in the 10. chapt. of Iohn, put forth to the Phariseis, of the dore, the sheepefolde, the shepharde and the porter.
column8: But this is to be noted, that this present gospel is part of the similitude, which Christ in the 10. Chapter. of John, put forth to the Pharisees, of the door, the sheepefolde, the shepharde and the porter.

column7: For the Phariseis herde and taught the lawe, but they vnderstod not Moyses, which did not all only require of them the outeward workes, but rather the affection of the harte.
column8: For the Pharisees herd and taught the law, but they understood not Moses, which did not all only require of them the outward works, but rather the affection of the heart.

column7: Wherof it came, that they coulde not teache the rightousnes of faith, that was accepted before god, nor yet could print it rightly in peoples hartes.
column8: Whereof it Come, that they could not teach the righteousness of faith, that was accepted before god, nor yet could print it rightly in peoples hearts.

column7: Then for as muche as in the steede of this righteousnes, they taughte the righteousnes of workes, and soughte saluacion by an other meane, then by the seede of Abraham, promised vnto theim, willing other also to seke the same.
column8: Then for as much as in the steed of this righteousness, they taught the righteousness of works, and sought salvation by an other mean, then by the seed of Abraham, promised unto them, willing other also to seek the same.

column7: Therfore Christ sayd not withoute a cause in the beginning of this similitude, that they entred not in at the dore, but that they were theues & murtherers.
column8: Therefore christ said not without a cause in the beginning of this similitude, that they entered not in At the door, but that they were thieves & murderers.

column7: For there cannot be begonne or raysed vppe in the church greater mischiefe or murther, then to teache to trust in workes.
column8: For there cannot be begun or raised up in the Church greater mischief or murder, then to teach to trust in works.

column7: <NOTE> Of the which doctoures Paule speketh, when he saith:
column8: Of the which Doctors Paul Speaketh, when he Says:

column7: Beware of dogges, beware of euel workers.
column8: Beware of Dogs, beware of evil workers.

column7: He calleth the false prophetes dogges,
column8: He calls the false Prophets Dogs,

column7: that for theyr owne lucre and aduauntage, wil not teache the people the righteousnes of faithe, but the righteousnes of workes, against the wholsome doctrine of Christe.
column8: that for their own lucre and advantage, will not teach the people the righteousness of faith, but the righteousness of works, against the wholesome Doctrine of Christ.

column7: And Christe called theim hyred seruauntes.
column8: And Christ called them hired Servants.

column7: Wherefore? Forbycause they care not for the sheepe. bycause they regarde not the helth and saluacion of the sheepe, neyther wyll daunger them selues therfore.
column8: Wherefore? Forbycause they care not for the sheep. Because they regard not the health and salvation of the sheep, neither will danger them selves Therefore.

column7: And so it is written in the prophete:
column8: And so it is written in the Prophet:

column7: <NOTE> Her prophetes are lyghte persones &c.
column8: Her Prophets Are Light Persons etc.

column7: For the hyred seruaunt tarieth while he findeth aduauntage, but when he perceyueth none aduautage, he flyeth awaye, ye thoughe the wolfe shuld eate vp all his sheepe.
column8: For the hired servant tarrieth while he finds advantage, but when he perceiveth none aduautage, he flies away, you though the wolf should eat up all his sheep.

column7: But Christ doth not so, for he saith:
column8: But christ does not so, for he Says:

column7: I am a good shepehard.
column8: I am a good shepehard.

column7: &c. Surely all only Christ is the good shepeharde, for he hath got and obteyned for his sheepe through his death, the pasture and feeding of euerlastinge lyfe.
column8: etc. Surely all only christ is the good shepeharde, for he hath god and obtained for his sheep through his death, the pasture and feeding of everlasting life.

column7: Out of this office of Christ, we may knowe, what mynde Christ beareth toward vs.
column8: Out of this office of christ, we may know, what mind christ bears towards us

column7: For he beareth vs such affection, that he will saue vs, and not destroye vs.
column8: For he bears us such affection, that he will save us, and not destroy us

column7: Howe doth he confirme that vnto vs?
column8: How does he confirm that unto us?

column7: In feedinge, & dyinge.
column8: In feeding, & dying.

column7: Feedyng is in the scripture a common terme,
column8: Feeding is in the scripture a Common term,

column7: <NOTE> and is as much to saye, as to teache goddes word rightly, without mingling therwith false doctrine. as thou seeste in the laste chapiter of Iohn, where Christe saithe:
column8: and is as much to say, as to teach God's word rightly, without mingling therewith false Doctrine. as thou See in the laste chapter of John, where Christ Saith:

column7: Peter feede my sheepe. And in the actes of the apostels:
column8: Peter feed my sheep. And in the acts of the Apostles:

column7: <NOTE> The holye ghoste hath sette you to be bysshoppes, to feede the congregation of god.
column8: The holy ghost hath Set you to be Bishops, to feed the congregation of god.

column7: With this feedinge, with this doctrine, hathe god fyrste serued his sheepe, and afterwarde, with his death and shedinge of his precious blode that they being saued for euer, shulde not be a praye to the wolues.
column8: With this feeding, with this Doctrine, hath god First served his sheep, and afterward, with his death and shedding of his precious blood that they being saved for ever, should not be a pray to the wolves.

column7: Who to dye, wolde not beleue suche a shepharde?
column8: Who to die, would not believe such a shepharde?

column7: Who wolde desire other feeding?
column8: Who would desire other feeding?

column7: Now compare Christ and the hiered seruaunte togyther.
column8: Now compare christ and the hired servant together.

column7: Christe seeketh the commoditie and profyte of the sheepe:
column8: Christ seeks the commodity and profit of the sheep:

column7: Secondarily, wee haue here in this gospell a meruailous cofortable saying, in that, that Christe repeteth that he is the good shepeharde &c.

column7: And that wee shulde vndoubtedly bee suer, that he careth for his sheepe, he ioyneth and addeth, that he knoweth vs none otherwise, then the father acknowledgeth him, and hee the father.
column8: And that we should undoubtedly be sure, that he Careth for his sheep, he Joineth and adds, that he Knoweth us none otherwise, then the father acknowledgeth him, and he the father.

column8: For Christ and the father be one substance undivided, so that christ can not be separated from the father, nor the father from christ.

column7: For if Christe coulde be seperated from the father, then coulde there not be one god.

column7: And ye now therefore haue sorowe, but I wyll se you agayne, and your hartes shall reioyse, and your ioye shall no man take frome you. THE EXPOSITION. <NOTE> IN this gospell diligently we shall note foure thinges.
column8: And you now Therefore have sorrow, but I will see you again, and your hearts shall rejoice, and your joy shall no man take from you. THE EXPOSITION. IN this gospel diligently we shall note foure things.

column7: First, how Christ shewed before vnto his disciples his passion and resurrection.

column7: This sermon and teaching muste needes be verye necessary, whe Christ so oftentimes and with so many wordes repeteth it, and sheweth yt his disciples.
column8: This sermon and teaching must needs be very necessary, when christ so oftentimes and with so many words repeateth it, and shows that his Disciples.

column7: Yea truly it is very needful, considering the infirmitie of our flesh, and the hard vnderstandynge of these articles.
column8: Yea truly it is very needful, considering the infirmity of our Flesh, and the hard understanding of these Articles.

column7: Wherefore Christe, after the manner of a faithfull maister and instructours, ceasseth not contynuallye to inculcate and driue into the apostles hartes suche artycles, that in all poyntes he mighte trulye and iustelye execute hys office.
column8: Wherefore Christ, After the manner of a faithful master and instructors, ceaseth not continually to inculcate and driven into the Apostles hearts such Articles, that in all points he might truly and Justly execute his office.

column7: And this is the exposition and meanynge thereof.
column8: And this is the exposition and meaning thereof.

column8: The Kingdom of Christ lies herein:

column7: That Christe hath ouercomme sinne, deathe, hell, and the dyuell, and hathe all the auctorytye and power of the father, in heauen and in earthe, that hereafter he beinge ordeined the moste mighty kinge vppon the hollye hyll of Sion,

column7: The Apostles knewe yet but little of the spirituall kingedome, and thought it shulde haue been temporall, vntill suche time that they receiued the holy ghost, which opened their eyes, and instructed them, what manner of kingedome it shulde be,
column8: The Apostles knew yet but little of the spiritual Kingdom, and Thought it should have been temporal, until such time that they received the holy ghost, which opened their eyes, and instructed them, what manner of Kingdom it should be,

column7: & how we shulde come vnto it, and abide in it.
column8: & how we should come unto it, and abide in it.

column7: And if we desyre to enter into this kingedome, and wyl ouercome synne, death, the diuell and hell, it is moste conuenient & necessarye, that we know Christe oure Lorde and sauioure, oure kinge and bysshoppe, and that by his bloode wee are reconcyled to the euerlastinge father.
column8: And if we desire to enter into this Kingdom, and will overcome sin, death, the Devil and hell, it is most convenient & necessary, that we know Christ our Lord and Saviour, our King and bishop, and that by his blood we Are reconciled to the everlasting father.

column7: Secondarily, here is layde before vs in the apostles, an exaumple of our ignoraunce. <NOTE> For as the apostels coulde not vnderstand and perceaue the mistery of the gospell without the holy ghost, so lykewise we can not attaine or get vs iustificacion and saluacion of our owne power, or free will Note and perceiue now this ignorance of the apostels, out of the text.
column8: Secondarily, Here is laid before us in the Apostles, an Exampl of our ignorance. For as the Apostles could not understand and perceive the mystery of the gospel without the holy ghost, so likewise we can not attain or get us justification and salvation of our own power, or free will Note and perceive now this ignorance of the Apostles, out of the text.

column7: Wherfore I greatly meruaile, what those creatures think that so sharpely and earnestly defend our free wyl, and the power of our fleshe, seynge that they haue bothe reade and heard in this texte (and suche other lyke) of the ignoraunce of the apostles.
column8: Wherefore I greatly marvel, what those creatures think that so sharply and earnestly defend our free will, and the power of our Flesh, sing that they have both read and herd in this text (and such other like) of the ignorance of the Apostles.

column7: I think that they must haue wonderfull gloses, to healpe theym withall.

column7: But rather I thinke that they are in lyke case with the apostles here, that they cannot tell what they saye, euen as S.

column7: Therfore lyke as Christ here sheweth before to his disciples, that he shuld be put to death, and shuld suffre, and that they shuld morne and lamente, euen so^t came to passe and chaunced.
column8: Therefore like as christ Here shows before to his Disciples, that he should be put to death, and should suffer, and that they should morn and lament, even so^t Come to pass and chanced.

column7: Supposest thou, that his passion was easye or a triflinge matter, when Christ hanging vppon the crosse, muste he are the Iewes iestinge and scourning him, saiyng:
column8: Supposest thou, that his passion was easy or a trifling matter, when christ hanging upon the cross, must he Are the Jews jesting and scourning him, saying:

column7: He trusted in god, <NOTE> lette him deliuer him nowe, if he will?
column8: He trusted in god, let him deliver him now, if he will?

column7: I resite not here wherof he coplaineth in the psal. saiyng:
column8: I resite not Here whereof he coplaineth in the Psalm. saying:

column7: <NOTE> But as for me,
column8: But as for me,

column7: I am a worme and no man:
column8: I am a worm and no man:

column7: the scorne of men, and the outcast of the people.
column8: the scorn of men, and the outcast of the people.

column7: All they that se me, laugh me to scorne.
column8: All they that see me, laugh me to scorn.

column7: &c. I think that the apostels wer stricken with great heuines, seing this shame and despysinge of Christe.
column8: etc. I think that the Apostles were stricken with great heaviness, sing this shame and despising of Christ.

column7: Nowe althoughe Christe chiefelye speakethe here of the tyme of his passion, whiche shulde bee a greate cause of sorowe and heauines to the disciples, yet notwithstanding here he sheweth what fortune and chaunce all faithfull menne shall haue in this worlde.
column8: Now although Christ chiefly Speaketh Here of the time of his passion, which should be a great cause of sorrow and heaviness to the Disciples, yet notwithstanding Here he shows what fortune and chance all faithful men shall have in this world.

column7: For christiane men shall suffre persecution, and the wicked shall haue good dayes and prospere.
column8: For christian men shall suffer persecution, and the wicked shall have good days and prosper.

column7: <NOTE> Therefore the wise man saieth:
column8: Therefore the wise man Saith:

column7: My chylde, despise not the chasteninge of the lorde, neyther faynte when thou arte rebuked of him.
column8: My child, despise not the chastening of the lord, neither faint when thou art rebuked of him.

column7: Is not this a ientle teachinge of the apostels?
column8: Is not this a ientle teaching of the Apostles?

column7: Now further, that thing that Christe doth to his apostels, he wyll haue it doone lykewise dailye to vs, thoroughe his worde and spirite, requirynge only of vs, that wee suffre patientely to be warned and taughte.
column8: Now further, that thing that Christ does to his Apostles, he will have it done likewise daily to us, thorough his word and Spirit, requiring only of us, that we suffer patientely to be warned and taught.

column7: <NOTE>

Fourhely, here is to be noted, that though Christ shewed before to his disciples, howe they shulde haue sorowe and anguishe throughe his passion, yet bicause they shulde not be lefte withoute comforte, he sayde:
column8: Fourthly, Here is to be noted, that though christ showed before to his Disciples, how they should have sorrow and anguish through his passion, yet Because they should not be left without Comfort, he said:

column7: Your mournynge shalbe tourned into ioye and gladnes.
column8: Your mourning shall turned into joy and gladness.

column7: That is. The worlde wyll thinke, when they haue put me to deathe, they haue wonne all, and that my dayes bee paste.
column8: That is. The world will think, when they have put me to death, they have won all, and that my days be past.

column7: But yet on the thirde daye,
column8: But yet on the Third day,

column7: I wyll rise agayne, & come and comforte you in your greate heauines.
column8: I will rise again, & come and Comfort you in your great heaviness.

column7: And though hereafter ye shall chaunce to suffre slaundre and rebuke for my gospel, yet that passion and sorow shal be shorte, and not endure longe.
column8: And though hereafter you shall chance to suffer slaundre and rebuke for my gospel, yet that passion and sorrow shall be short, and not endure long.

column7: But the ioye that shall folowe the same heauines, shalbe euerlasting.
column8: But the joy that shall follow the same heaviness, shall everlasting.

column7: Take here an exaumple of this thinge.
column8: Take Here an Exampl of this thing.

column7: A woman when she trauayleth hath sorowe, for hyr hour is come:
column8: A woman when she Travaileth hath sorrow, for her hour is come:

column7: but when shee is delyuered of the childe, shee thinketh no more of the anguisshe, for ioye that a manne is borne into the worlde.
column8: but when she is Delivered of the child, she Thinketh no more of the anguish, for joy that a man is born into the world.

column7: So lykewyse yee bee nowe full of sorowe, but I wyll see you agayne, and your hartes shall reioyse, and that same your reioysynge no man shall take frome you.
column8: So likewise ye be now full of sorrow, but I will see you again, and your hearts shall rejoice, and that same your rejoicing no man shall take from you.

column7: This similitude put forth of Christ, is verye full of greate comforte and consolacion.
column8: This similitude put forth of christ, is very full of great Comfort and consolation.

column7: Fyrste yt declarethe, that the professoures of Christe, so suerly shall suffre persecucion, as it is suer, that a trauailyng woman shall not be delyuered withoute payne.
column8: First that Declareth, that the professors of Christ, so surely shall suffer persecution, as it is sure, that a travailing woman shall not be Delivered without pain.

column7: How be it, in that pointe the worde of God shall be a greate comforte to euerye Christian man.
column8: How be it, in that point the word of God shall be a great Comfort to every Christian man.

column7: Furthermore note, <NOTE> that this persecution shal be for a tyme, and not euerlasting.
column8: Furthermore note, that this persecution shall be for a time, and not everlasting.

column7: And finallye, that the reioysynge of this worlde dothe not continue longe, as Christe saith in an other place:
column8: And finally, that the rejoicing of this world doth not continue long, as Christ Says in an other place:

column7: <NOTE> Wo vnto you that laughe here, for yee shall weepe and wayle.
column8: Woe unto you that laugh Here, for ye shall weep and wail.

column7: Howe be it, in the meane whyle, a christian man shall not bee withoute ioye.
column8: Howe be it, in the mean while, a christian man shall not be without joy.

column7: But what ioye shall it be?
column8: But what joy shall it be?

column7: I wyll (saith Christe) visite you againe, and your hartes shall reioise,
column8: I will (Says Christ) visit you again, and your hearts shall rejoice,

column7: & that reioysinge shall no man take frome you.
column8: & that rejoicing shall no man take from you.

column7: <NOTE> This is the verye ioye, and this is the quietnes of conscience, to knowe that God by Christe is mercifull, and will reserue vs to euerlastinge lyfe.
column8: This is the very joy, and this is the quietness of conscience, to know that God by Christ is merciful, and will reserve us to everlasting life.

column7: The fowerth sonday after Easter. Ioh. 16.
column8: The fowerth Sunday After Easter. John 16.

column7: B Vt nowe I go my waye to hym that sent me, and none of you aske me whether I go.
column8: But But now I go my Way to him that sent me, and none of you ask me whither I go.

column7: But bycause I haue sayd suche thynges vnto you, youre hartes are full of sorowe.
column8: But Because I have said such things unto you, your hearts Are full of sorrow.

column7: Neuertheles I tell you the trewth, it is expediente for you that I go awaye.
column8: Nevertheless I tell you the truth, it is expedient for you that I go away.

column7: For yf I go not away, that comforter wyll not come vnto you.
column8: For if I go not away, that comforter will not come unto you.

column7: But yf I departe, <NOTE> I wyll sende hym vnto you.
column8: But if I depart, I will send him unto you.

column7: And when he is come, he will rebuke the worlde of sinne, and of righteousnes, and of iugement.
column8: And when he is come, he will rebuke the world of sin, and of righteousness, and of judgement.

column7: Of sinne, bicause they beleue not on me,
column8: Of sin, Because they believe not on me,

column7: Of righteousnes, bycause I go to my father, and ye shall se me no more.
column8: Of righteousness, Because I go to my father, and you shall see me no more.

column7: Of iudgemente, bycause <NOTE> the prince of this worlde is iudged allreadye.
column8: Of judgement, Because the Prince of this world is judged already.

column7: I haue yet many thinges to saye vnto you, but ye can not beare them awaye nowe.
column8: I have yet many things to say unto you, but you can not bear them away now.

column7: Howebeit, when he is come, which is the spyrite of trewth, he wyll leade you into all trewth.
column8: Howbeit, when he is come, which is the Spirit of truth, he will lead you into all truth.

column7: He shall not speak of hym selfe, but whatsoeuer he shall heare, that shall he speak, and he wyll shewe you thinges to come.
column8: He shall not speak of him self, but whatsoever he shall hear, that shall he speak, and he will show you things to come.

column7: He shall glorify me for he shal receyue of myne, and shal shew vnto you <NOTE> Al thinges that the father hath, ar myne Therefore sayd I vnto you, that he shall take of mine, and shewe vnto you. THE EXPOSITION.
column8: He shall Glorify me for he shall receive of mine, and shall show unto you All things that the father hath, Are mine Therefore said I unto you, that he shall take of mine, and show unto you. THE EXPOSITION.

column7: IN this present golspel, <NOTE> we are admonished of thre thinges.
column8: IN this present golspel, we Are admonished of Three things.

column7: Firste, we haue here of the promise of the holy ghoste, which Christe going to the father, shulde sende vnto his disciples,
column8: First, we have Here of the promise of the holy ghost, which Christ going to the father, should send unto his Disciples,

column7: Moreouer, what he shulde do and bringe to passe when he came.
column8: Moreover, what he should do and bring to pass when he Come.

column7: It is nowe oure parte, to note well this promise, whiche pertayneth as well to vs, as to the Apostles.
column8: It is now our part, to note well this promise, which pertaineth as well to us, as to the Apostles.

column7: Faythe cowlde not be confirmed in the apostles without the vertue of the holy ghoste.
column8: Faith cowlde not be confirmed in the Apostles without the virtue of the holy ghost.

column7: So lykewise, the holy ghoste coulde not be sente, yf Christe hadde not gonne to the father. <NOTE> Here lerne that oure fleshe canne do nothing but sinne, if it be not lightened through the holy ghost, and that yt is nothinge but hypocrisy, though we do outwardly neuer so manye good workes,
column8: So likewise, the holy ghost could not be sent, if Christ had not gone to the father. Here Learn that our Flesh can do nothing but sin, if it be not lightened through the holy ghost, and that that is nothing but hypocrisy, though we do outwardly never so many good works,

column7: <NOTE> as we maye see in the Pharisye, which thanked God that he was not lyke other men.
column8: as we may see in the Pharisee, which thanked God that he was not like other men.

column7: Item, All they that saye vnto me:
column8: Item, All they that say unto me:

column7: <NOTE> Lorde, lorde, shall not entre into the kingedome of heauen, but they ye fulfil my fathers wyl.
column8: Lord, lord, shall not enter into the Kingdom of heaven, but they the fulfil my Father's will.

column7: Likewise learne this, that we cannot receiue this spirite by oure good workes, but by the merites of Christ, as Christe sayeth here:
column8: Likewise Learn this, that we cannot receive this Spirit by our good works, but by the merits of christ, as Christ Saith Here:

column7: It is better for you that I go:
column8: It is better for you that I go:

column7: for yf I go not awaye, the comforter cometh not vnto you. as thoughe he wolde saye: <NOTE> If the infirmity of your fleshe shalbe chaunged into the strenthe of the faith, the holye ghoste muste needes bring that to passe in you.
column8: for if I go not away, the comforter comes not unto you. as though he would say: If the infirmity of your Flesh shall changed into the strengthen of the faith, the holy ghost must needs bring that to pass in you.

column7: Nowe if this holye ghost shalbe geuen vnto you, so muste I needes promote you ther unto, and obtaine it through my deserte and benefite.
column8: Now if this holy ghost shall given unto you, so must I needs promote you there unto, and obtain it through my desert and benefit.

column7: Wherefore it is very necessary, that I suffre & dye, and that after my resurrection,
column8: Wherefore it is very necessary, that I suffer & die, and that After my resurrection,

column7: I ascend vp in to heauen, that the holy ghost may visite you, lighten you, and leade you into all trewthe:
column8: I ascend up in to heaven, that the holy ghost may visit you, lighten you, and lead you into all truth:

column7: Than the same spirite shall worke and bringe to passe in you and through you, that thinge that he was sent for.
column8: Than the same Spirit shall work and bring to pass in you and through you, that thing that he was sent for.

column7: Will you knowe what that is?
column8: Will you know what that is?

column7: <NOTE> harken to.
column8: harken to.

column7: He shall rebuke the worlde.
column8: He shall rebuke the world.

column7: Here is the glorye of the fleshe, the liberty of fre wyll, and what so euer is mannes wisedome, vtterly caste in the duste.
column8: Here is the glory of the Flesh, the liberty of from will, and what so ever is Man's Wisdom, utterly cast in the dust.

column7: Why shuld the holye ghoste rebuke vs, yf we were not worthye of rebuke?
column8: Why should the holy ghost rebuke us, if we were not worthy of rebuke?

column7: They are all gon out of the waye:
column8: They Are all gone out of the Way:

column7: they be all togither become vnprofitable:
column8: they be all together become unprofitable:

column7: ther is none that doth good, no not one.
column8: there is none that does good, no not one.

column7: Ye & as S. Iohn the baptist saide:
column8: You & as S. John the baptist said:

column7: <NOTE> All fleshe, is as haye, and all his glorye, as the flowre of the medowe.
column8: All Flesh, is as hay, and all his glory, as the flower of the meadow.

column7: This semed to be rigorously inoughe (and more then inoughe spoken) to the bysshopes and to those gloryfiers in workes at Ierusalem, and also to the papistry of oure tyme, if the holye ghoste didde feare theim.
column8: This seemed to be rigorously enough (and more then enough spoken) to the Bishops and to those gloryfiers in works At Jerusalem, and also to the papistry of our time, if the holy ghost did Fear them.

column7: But he setteth nothing at all for our angre.
column8: But he sets nothing At all for our anger.

column7: For he was sente to rebuke, whiche also hee doth busily.
column8: For he was sent to rebuke, which also he does busily.

column7: And blessed is he, that is rebuked of him, that by that meanes he may learne to knowe his sinnes:
column8: And blessed is he, that is rebuked of him, that by that means he may Learn to know his Sins:

column7: For that done, the holi ghost leadeth vs further into the faith and knowledg of god, so that we being deliuered frome sin, through the deseruing and merits of Christ, are made the children and heires of god.
column8: For that done, the holy ghost leads us further into the faith and knowledge of god, so that we being Delivered from since, through the deserving and merits of christ, Are made the children and Heirs of god.

column7: <NOTE>
Secondarily, we maye note here, wherfore & for what cause the holy ghoste will rebuke the worlde:
column8: Secondarily, we may note Here, Wherefore & for what cause the holy ghost will rebuke the world:

column7: Truly for sinne. But you will saye:
column8: Truly for sin. But you will say:

column7: Is the worlde ignoraunt, that adultrye, murdre, thefte, and suche lyke trespasses are sinne?
column8: Is the world ignorant, that adultrye, murder, theft, and such like Trespasses Are sin?

column7: No. But they are ignoraunte,
column8: No. But they Are ignorant,

column7: that good workes without faith are sinne, and that allonly vnbeliefe, is the occasion of their damnacion.
column8: that good works without faith Are sin, and that allonly unbelief, is the occasion of their damnation.

column7: Wherefore it is necessarye and needefull, that the holy ghost come, that he maye fullye learne and teache vs, what sinne is.
column8: Wherefore it is necessary and needful, that the holy ghost come, that he may Fully Learn and teach us, what sin is.

column7: Wherfore let vs considre what Christe calleth sinne. <NOTE> For they do not beleue in me (saieth he).
column8: Wherefore let us Consider what Christ calls sin. For they do not believe in me (Saith he).

column7: Here thou hearest, that the greatest sinne vnder heauen is, that wee do not beleue in Christ.
column8: Here thou Hearst, that the greatest sin under heaven is, that we do not believe in christ.

column7: If incredulity be the greatest syn vpo earth, then must it needes folow, ye faith is the most glorious & highest thing vpo earth, which no ma can deny.
column8: If incredulity be the greatest sin upon earth, then must it needs follow, you faith is the most glorious & highest thing upon earth, which no ma can deny.

column7: Faith hangeth on Christ, & as a faith ful man knoweth yt he is saued by Christ, so surely doth he good works which are accepted before god for his faith, as saith ye prophet:
column8: Faith hangs on christ, & as a faith full man Knoweth that he is saved by christ, so surely does he good works which Are accepted before god for his faith, as Says you Prophet:

column7: Thou o lord, <NOTE> lokest aloly vpo faith.
column8: Thou oh lord, lokest aloly upon faith.

column7: But incredulity trusteth in his workes.
column8: But incredulity Trusteth in his works.

column7: Wherfore what so euer goodnes an vnfaithful ma doth outwardli, it is not accepted before god, for it cometh not of faith.
column8: Wherefore what so ever Goodness an unfaithful ma does outwardli, it is not accepted before god, for it comes not of faith.

column7: For Christ saith: He that beleueth not, is all ready iudged.
column8: For christ Says: He that Believeth not, is all ready judged.

column7: The worlde, <NOTE> nature, fleshe, or reason, doth not receaue nor vnderstande this. wherefore it is needefull that the holye ghost come to rebuke and teache.
column8: The world, nature, Flesh, or reason, does not receive nor understand this. Wherefore it is needful that the holy ghost come to rebuke and teach.

column7: Moreouer the holy ghost shall rebuke the world of righteousnes.
column8: Moreover the holy ghost shall rebuke the world of righteousness.

column7: How shall we vnderstande that?
column8: How shall we understand that?

column7: The worlde and reason adscribeth righteousnes to oure workes, and both thinke and iudge, that righteousnes cometh of mennes workes outewardelye done, as the Pharisie boasted himselfe to bee righteous.
column8: The world and reason adscribeth righteousness to our works, and both think and judge, that righteousness comes of men's works outewardelye done, as the Pharisee boasted himself to be righteous.

column7: But euer this chaunseth so,
column8: But ever this chaunseth so,

column7: <NOTE> that they that wyll mayntaine theyre owne righteousnes,
column8: that they that will maintain their own righteousness,

column7: <NOTE> bee not subiecte vnto the righteousnes of God.
column8: be not Subject unto the righteousness of God.

column7: Therefore yt is necessarye, that the holy ghoste teache & shew vs, what manner of iustice that is, that pleaseth god.
column8: Therefore that is necessary, that the holy ghost teach & show us, what manner of Justice that is, that Pleases god.

column7: <NOTE> The iustice that pleaseth god procedeth hereoute:
column8: The Justice that Pleases god Proceedeth Hereout:

column7: that I beleue that Christe wente to the Father. that is as muche to saye:
column8: that I believe that Christ went to the Father. that is as much to say:

column7: That I beleue that he died for me, that he rose and ascended vnto heauen, for to send me and all his elect his holy ghost, to open vs the filthines of our workes, and to instructe vs in the knowledge of god.
column8: That I believe that he died for me, that he rose and ascended unto heaven, for to send me and all his elect his holy ghost, to open us the filthiness of our works, and to instruct us in the knowledge of god.

column7: Beholde, thus ye holy ghost shal learn vs ye rightousnes of faith.
column8: Behold, thus you holy ghost shall Learn us the righteousness of faith.

column7: Furthermore, <NOTE> the holy ghost shal rebuke ye worlde of iudgement:
column8: Furthermore, the holy ghost shall rebuke you world of judgement:

column7: for as much as they iudge not right in thinges pertaininge to righteousnes and saluacion.
column8: for as much as they judge not right in things pertaining to righteousness and salvation.

column7: Which thou shalte vnderstande on this wise.
column8: Which thou shalt understand on this wise.

column7: The diuell, sinne, deathe, hell, are constrained to giue place vnto Christe and his worde, for by hym they be ouercome.
column8: The Devil, sin, death, hell, Are constrained to give place unto Christ and his word, for by him they be overcome.

column7: But how doth the world knowe this?
column8: But how does the world know this?

column7: Truly the world euer regardeth workes, and euer suffereth the diuell to blinde them, so that thei know not, nor yet can deuide nor separate the righteousnes of faith, from the worldes righteousnes.
column8: Truly the world ever Regardeth works, and ever suffers the Devil to blind them, so that they know not, nor yet can divide nor separate the righteousness of faith, from the world's righteousness.

column7: And so remaineth Christ the stone that menne shall stumble at,
column8: And so remains christ the stone that men shall Stumble At,

column7: <NOTE> and a signe which shalbe spoke against.
column8: and a Signen which shall spoke against.

column7: For the thing which we shuld adscribe vnto Christ, that is to saye, whereas we shulde confesse, that the prince of this world is iudged through Christ and his worde, we adscribe yt vnto our righteousnes.
column8: For the thing which we should adscribe unto christ, that is to say, whereas we should confess, that the Prince of this world is judged through christ and his word, we adscribe that unto our righteousness.

column7: For the whych cause, yt is needefull that the holye ghost do rebuke vs, wherby we may learne to iudg right.
column8: For the which cause, that is needful that the holy ghost do rebuke us, whereby we may Learn to judge right.

column7: And here hast thou nowe the righte cause, why the holy ghoste shall rebuke the worlde.
column8: And Here hast thou now the right cause, why the holy ghost shall rebuke the world.

column7: Thirdly here is to be noted, that Christ sheweth vs here the infirmitie of the apostles, saying:
column8: Thirdly Here is to be noted, that christ shows us hear the infirmity of the Apostles, saying:

column7: <NOTE> I haue yet muche to saye vnto you, but yee can not nowe beare it awaye.
column8: I have yet much to say unto you, but ye can not now bear it away.

column7: That is as muche to saye.
column8: That is as much to say.

column7: Yf I shuld make many words with you of incredulity, of righteousnes and of iudgement, and of my spirituall kingdome, that after my resurrection I shall entre into, you colde not vnderstande it, nor comprehend it, for bicause you are yet carnall and fleshly, and my spirite is not as yet, confirmed in you.
column8: If I should make many words with you of incredulity, of righteousness and of judgement, and of my spiritual Kingdom, that After my resurrection I shall enter into, you cold not understand it, nor comprehend it, for Because you Are yet carnal and fleshly, and my Spirit is not as yet, confirmed in you.

column7: For they that shall vnderstand and geue fayth and credence vnto my doctrine, the spirite must worke inwardly in the, with ye outward word yt shall be expressed with the mouth,
column8: For they that shall understand and give faith and credence unto my Doctrine, the Spirit must work inwardly in thee, with the outward word that shall be expressed with the Mouth,

column7: <NOTE> or els that sede shall not fal vpon a fruictefull grounde, or so that yt shalbe other troden of men, or else deuoured and eaten of the birdes of the ayer.
column8: or Else that seed shall not fall upon a fruictefull ground, or so that that shall other trodden of men, or Else devoured and eaten of the Birds of the air.

column7: Wherfore it is needefull that the holy ghoste come. and when he cometh, he shall leade you into all trewthe. <NOTE>
column8: Wherefore it is needful that the holy ghost come. and when he comes, he shall lead you into all truth.

column7: The gospell is a doctrine of Christe, whole and sounde, which doth not alloly teache the outward honesty, but sheweth also the righteousnes of the harte inwardly:
column8: The gospel is a Doctrine of Christ, Whole and sound, which does not alloly teach the outward honesty, but shows also the righteousness of the heart inwardly:

column7: wherefore it is called in the scripture the trewth: <NOTE> And contrary wise, the doctrine of men, teacheth hypocrisy, fynallye, neither vnderstandeth nor teacheth any thing of the righteousnes of the hart.
column8: Wherefore it is called in the scripture the truth: And contrary wise, the Doctrine of men, Teaches hypocrisy, finally, neither understandeth nor Teaches any thing of the righteousness of the heart.

column7: Wherfore this doctrine, and also the doctoures and teachers thereof, are called, false, and lyars, as yt is written in the Psalme:
column8: Wherefore this Doctrine, and also the Doctors and Teachers thereof, Are called, false, and liars, as that is written in the Psalm:

column7: Ther is no truth in the their mouth.
column8: There is no truth in thee their Mouth.

column7: <NOTE> that is, ther is no suer and certaine thing amongst theim.
column8: that is, there is no sure and certain thing among them.

column7: And againe, thou shalt lose and destroye all those that speake lies.
column8: And again, thou shalt loose and destroy all those that speak lies.

column7: Now seing that ye holy ghost shall leade vs into all truth, and not into lyes,
column8: Now sing that you holy ghost shall lead us into all truth, and not into lies,

column7: Let euery christian man gesse in his mynd, whether the fathers and the counsels haue had the holy ghost, whose ordinaunuces and lawes,
column8: Let every christian man guess in his mind, whither the Father's and the Counsels have had the holy ghost, whose ordinaunuces and laws,
