column7: Yet should they not haue knowen him by these signes, if he hadde not opened theyr eyes, whiche in dede was done, when Christe gaue thankes and brake the bread.
column8: Yet should they not have known him by these Signs, if he had not opened their eyes, which in deed was done, when Christ gave thanks and brake the bred.

column7: Here muste we first learne,
column8: Here must we First Learn,

column7: <NOTE> to giue thankes euer to god, for all his benefites giuen to vs, both corporall and spirituall.
column8: to give thanks ever to god, for all his benefits given to us, both corporal and spiritual.

column7: For I praye you, what haste thou, but thou receyuedst it of god?
column8: For I pray you, what haste thou, but thou Received it of god?

column7: Nowe yf god hathe giuen it to the, of mere grace, withoute anye merite of thyne,
column8: Now if god hath given it to thee, of mere grace, without any merit of thine,

column7: I beseche the, why wylte thou not euer giue him thanks for it?
column8: I beseech thee, why wilt thou not ever give him thanks for it?

column7: Verily Saynct Paul (in the fyrst epistle to Timothe in the fourth chap. where hee teacheth of the libertye of meates and drinkes) willeth that christians shulde receiue all thinges with thankes gyuynge. <NOTE> and euen so exhorteth he vs to do in the epistle to the Thessalonians.
column8: Verily Saint Paul (in the fyrst epistle to Timothy in the fourth chap. where he Teaches of the liberty of Meats and drinks) wills that Christians should receive all things with thanks gyving. and even so exhorteth he us to do in the epistle to the Thessalonians.

column7: Secondly also note, <NOTE> that Christe opened hys disciples eyes, and brouhht theym into the knoweledge of hymselfe.
column8: Secondly also note, that Christ opened his Disciples eyes, and brouhht them into the knowledge of himself.

column7: For euen as these disciples could not come to suche knowledge of theym selues, tyll theyr eyes were opened, no more can wee beleue as wee ought to beleue, tell Christe lyghten our eyes, and bringe vs vnto the trewe faithe, by his worde, and holy spirite.
column8: For even as these Disciples could not come to such knowledge of them selves, till their eyes were opened, no more can we believe as we ought to believe, tell Christ lighten our eyes, and bring us unto the true faith, by his word, and holy Spirit.

column7: Fourthly, this gospel sheweth,
column8: Fourthly, this gospel shows,

column7: <NOTE> that whe through Christes word & spirit our eyes ar opened to know God, then that our faith shal not be vaine in vs,
column8: that when through Christ's word & Spirit our eyes Are opened to know God, then that our faith shall not be vain in us,

column7: & yt we kepe not this ioye, only to our selues, but yt we shal comunicat it vnto many,
column8: & that we keep not this joy, only to our selves, but that we shall comunicat it unto many,

column7: & freely confesse our ioye, euen as S.
column8: & freely confess our joy, even as S.

column7: Paul saith: <NOTE> With the hearte wee beleue vnto righteousnes & with the mouth we confesse the same beleue vnto health.
column8: Paul Says: With the heart we believe unto righteousness & with the Mouth we confess the same believe unto health.

column7: And Dauid saith: I beleued, and therfore I spake.
column8: And David Says: I believed, and Therefore I spoke.

column7: <NOTE> The preachynge of the passion, and resurrection of Christ, is no such treasure, that when a man hath founde it, he shuld hyde it, and kepe it secrete from other, let no manne thynke so, but it would bee distributed and imparted to many other,
column8: The preaching of the passion, and resurrection of christ, is no such treasure, that when a man hath found it, he should hide it, and keep it secret from other, let no man think so, but it would be distributed and imparted to many other,

column8: like as christ said:

column8: And so doth the Disciples Here.

column8: For As soon as they had seen and known christ, they by and by arise and returned unto Jerusalem, where they found the xi. gatheeed,

column7: And so ought euery christian man to do, when he knoweth Christe, and by his worde and spirite is come vnto the fayth, he should geue all men parte of that treasure, and to endeuor himselfe, that all men maye come to that knowlege and righteousnes of fayth, that is in Iesu Christe our Lord,
column8: And so ought every christian man to do, when he Knoweth Christ, and by his word and Spirit is come unto the faith, he should give all men part of that treasure, and to endeavour himself, that all men may come to that knowledge and righteousness of faith, that is in Jesu Christ our Lord,

column7: To whome with the father and the holy ghost be all honor and glorye for euer & euer.
column8: To whom with the father and the holy ghost be all honour and glory for ever & ever.

column8: Peace be unto you (it is I, Fear not.) But they were abashed and afraid, and supposed that they had seen a Spirit.

column8: And he said unto them:

column8: Why Are you troubled, and why do thoughts arise in your hearts?

column8: Behold my hands and my feet, that it is even I my self,

column8: Handle me and see, for a Spirit hath not Flesh and bones as you see me have.

column8: And when he had thus spoken, he showed them his hades & his feet.

column8: Have you Here any meat?

column8: These Are the words I spoke unto you, while I was yet with you, that all must needs be fulfilled, which were written of me, in the law of Moses, and in the prophets, and in the Psalms.

column8: Thus is it written, and thus it behooved christ to suffer, and to rise again from death the Third day, and that Repentance and remission of Sins should be preached in his name among all Nations. THE EXPOSITION.

column7: O Vr sauiour Christ, to the intent that this article of his resurrection, might be perfectly inculcate and beaten into the hertes of his disciples, sheweth himselfe opely vnto them.
column8: Our Our Saviour christ, to the intent that this article of his resurrection, might be perfectly inculcate and beaten into the herts of his Disciples, shows himself opely unto them.

column8: Suche a peace is it, that christ calls his peace, as a peace that the world can not give,

column7: <NOTE> when hee saide:
column8: when he said:

column7: I leaue you peace, my peace I giue to you.
column8: I leave you peace, my peace I give to you.

column7: Hear you not now that Christe maketh a very plaine distinction or difference from the worldly peace, callynge this peace his, his I saye, his peace.
column8: Hear you not now that Christ makes a very plain distinction or difference from the worldly peace, calling this peace his, his I say, his peace.

column7: For doubtelesse, this peace canne not stande, where as fayth is not.
column8: For doubtless, this peace can not stand, where as faith is not.

column7: <NOTE> For as Saynte Paule teacheth, thys peace springeth and floweth oute of fayth.
column8: For as Faint Paul Teaches, this peace springs and flows out of faith.

column7: And therefore yf wee wyll attayne vnto thys peace, wee muste with greate and contynuall diligence applye the woorde, preache, teache, heare and receiue it.
column8: And Therefore if we will attain unto this peace, we must with great and continual diligence apply the word, preach, teach, hear and receive it.

column7: For of the woorde commeth faithe, by faythe wee beynge iustified, we are at peace wyth God. Rom. v.
column8: For of the word comes faith, by faith we being justified, we Are At peace with God. Rom. v.

column7: Furthermore, this peace is neuer to any other, the to christians, which haue apprehended the gospell by faythe, and haue by the same conceiued a consydence and suer hope, that in tyme commynge, no synne canne accuse or condemne them.
column8: Furthermore, this peace is never to any other, the to Christians, which have apprehended the gospel by faith, and have by the same conceived a consydence and sure hope, that in time coming, no sin can accuse or condemn them.

column7: The world doubteles is verye ignoraunte of this peace.
column8: The world doubtless is very ignorant of this peace.

column7: For the worlde knoweth none other peace, but that whiche liueth in ydelnes, and bringeth the vayne voluptuous plasures and ioyes of thys lyfe, neyther hath it any persecution or tribulation intermedled with it,
column8: For the world Knoweth none other peace, but that which lives in idleness, and brings the vain voluptuous pleasures and Joys of this life, neither hath it any persecution or tribulation intermedled with it,

column7: <NOTE> as this peace which we cal the peace of god hathe,
column8: as this peace which we call the peace of god hath,

column7: But yet is this peace of god a peace that standeth sure, and indeed the true peace, yea though all the worlde be enemye vnto it,
column8: But yet is this peace of god a peace that Stands sure, and indeed the true peace, yea though all the world be enemy unto it,

column7: Lyke as Christe testifieth, saying:
column8: Like as Christ Testifieth, saying:

column7: Yee shall haue persecutions in the worlde, but in me you shall haue peace.
column8: Ye shall have persecutions in the world, but in me you shall have peace.

column7: Secondarilye, Christe confirmeth fayth in the Apostels, when heere hee sheweth theym his handes and feete, and also eateth with theym as anye other man did.
column8: Secondarily, Christ confirmeth faith in the Apostles, when Here he shows them his hands and feet, and also Eateth with them as any other man did.

column7: Surely, <NOTE> incredulity muste needes bee an horrible thinge, seinge that Christe taketh suche greate paynes to deliuer the Apostels from it.
column8: Surely, incredulity must needs be an horrible thing, sing that Christ Takes such great pains to deliver the Apostles from it.

column7: A lytle before they confessed that Christe had truely rysed, and appeared vnto Simon:
column8: A little before they confessed that Christ had truly rised, and appeared unto Simon:

column7: they hadde hearde also that hee hadde talked wyth the twoo dysciples in Emans, and gyuynge thankes hee hadde broken the breade vnto theym, yet this notwithstandynge, when hee came vnto theym, salutynge theym so peaceablye, yet they were astonished, doubtynge whether they myghte thinke it Christe, or a ghoste, suche as men saye walke^^ after men bee deade.
column8: they had heard also that he had talked with the twoo Disciples in Emman's, and gyving thanks he had broken the bread unto them, yet this notwithstanding, when he Come unto them, saluting them so peaceably, yet they were astonished, doubting whither they might think it Christ, or a ghost, such as men say walke^^ After men be dead.

column7: But what dydde Christe to this?
column8: But what did Christ to this?

column7: Casteth hee theym of, <NOTE> bycause of this their infirmytie?
column8: Cast he them of, Because of this their infirmytie?

column7: Naye truely. But becommeth a seruante vnto theym, seruynge theym bothe wyth woordes and deedes, yea and also with hys holye ghost, to bring them vnto faith and saue them.
column8: Nay truly. But becomes a servant unto them, serving them both with words and Deeds, yea and also with his holy ghost, to bring them unto faith and save them.

column7: For it is euident by the gospell of S.
column8: For it is evident by the gospel of S.

column7: Iohn, that euen then, he gaue to theim his holye ghost, whom also after in the Witsonday he stablished in them.
column8: John, that even then, he gave to them his holy ghost, whom also After in the Whitsunday he established in them.

column7: Now how indurate and blinded, yea obsessed with al the feendes of hell are those heartes, that wyll not beleue this, our so friendly, gentle and mercifull lord god?
column8: Now how indurate and blinded, yea obsessed with all the fiends of hell Are those hearts, that will not believe this, our so friendly, gentle and merciful lord god?

column7: What greater thing, or what more could hee do for his disciples?
column8: What greater thing, or what more could he do for his Disciples?

column7: Fyrste he rebuketh their incredulitie with wordes, saying:
column8: First he Rebuketh their incredulity with words, saying:

column7: Why are ye troubled, and wherefore doo cogitacions ascende into your heartes?
column8: Why Are you troubled, and Wherefore do cogitations ascend into your hearts?

column7: But for as much as they yet beleued not, hee shewed to them his handes and feete, sayinge:
column8: But for as much as they yet believed not, he showed to them his hands and feet, saying:

column7: I am euen hee. Touche me on euerye parte, and looke vppon me, for spirites haue not fleshe and bone as you see me haue.
column8: I am even he. Touche me on every part, and look upon me, for spirits have not Flesh and bone as you see me have.

column7: They yet not beeleuynge and wonderynge for ioye, he asketh them, sayinge:
column8: They yet not beeleuynge and wondering for joy, he asks them, saying:

column7: Haue yee anye thynge to eate?
column8: Have ye any thing to eat?

column7: And hee dydde eate beefore theym parte of a fyshe, and an honye combe, that at the laste they myghte by this see, hee was no deade ghoste, nor spiryte, but he hadde truely rysen from the deathe.
column8: And he did eat before them part of a Fish, and an honey comb, that At the laste they might by this see, he was no dead ghost, nor Spirit, but he had truly risen from the death.

column7: Surely this it is, to beare the weakenes of theym that be weake.
column8: Surely this it is, to bear the weakness of them that be weak.

column7: <NOTE> Now that man whom this so great goodnes of Christe moueth not to faith, wheresoeuer it be preached, doubteles there is nothinge that euer shall moue him.
column8: Now that man whom this so great Goodness of Christ moves not to faith, wheresoever it be preached, doubtless there is nothing that ever shall move him.

column7: <NOTE> Thyrdely,
column8: Thirdly,

column7: Christe teacheth his disciples oute of the holy scriptures, sayinge:
column8: Christ Teaches his Disciples out of the holy Scriptures, saying:

column7: These are the wordes that I haue spoken vnto you, when I was yet with you, that all thinges muste needes bee fulfylled, that are written in the lawe of Moyses, in the prophetes and Psalmes of me.
column8: These Are the words that I have spoken unto you, when I was yet with you, that all things must needs be fulfilled, that Are written in the law of Moses, in the Prophets and Psalms of me.

column7: Furthermore he opened theyr mynde, that they should vnderstand the scriptures.
column8: Furthermore he opened their mind, that they should understand the Scriptures.

column7: &c. O howe gloriouslye goeth this preachynge of Christe forthe?
column8: etc. Oh how gloriously Goes this preaching of Christ forth?

column7: Christe instructeth these plaine men and vnlearned with the holy scripture,
column8: Christ Instructeth these plain men and unlearned with the holy scripture,

column7: taken out of the law, the prophetes and the psalmes.
column8: taken out of the law, the Prophets and the psalms.

column7: But as the epistle to the Hebrues, sayeth:
column8: But as the epistle to the Hebrews, Saith:

column7: <NOTE> Preachinge is but vaine, if it bee not adioyned to faithe. therefore Christe also openeth the eyes and vnderstandynge of theyr mynde, so that not onlye they maye heare hys woorde, but also they maye vnderstande it.
column8: Preaching is but vain, if it be not adjoined to faith. Therefore Christ also Openeth the eyes and understanding of their mind, so that not only they may hear his word, but also they may understand it.

column7: Oh good preacher: O gentle lorde Christe, that thus faithfully teacheth his disciple, and bringeth them to the knowledge of hys truth,
column8: O good preacher: Oh gentle lord Christ, that thus faithfully Teaches his disciple, and brings them to the knowledge of his truth,

column7: The moste best and greatest lorde, our god, graunt vs this grace,
column8: The most best and greatest lord, our god, grant us this grace,

column7: <NOTE> that the same manner maye be among vs in the offire of preching. that is, that we may with much seueritie and great diligence, inculcate thy worde, and that Christ may also as dililigentely, teache the same worde inwardely by his holy spirite.
column8: that the same manner may be among us in the offire of preaching. that is, that we may with much severity and great diligence, inculcate thy word, and that christ may also as dililigentely, teach the same word inwardly by his holy Spirit.

column7: For suerly it is he that hath the key of Dauid, wherwith he shutteth, and no man openeth hee openeth, and no man shutteth.
column8: For surely it is he that hath the key of David, wherewith he shutteth, and no man Openeth he Openeth, and no man shutteth.

column7: And verelye all preaching is vain, except Christ do inwardly teach by his holy spirite.
column8: And verily all preaching is vain, except christ do inwardly teach by his holy Spirit.

column7: Nowithstanding I wold no ma should esteeme as a light thinge, the dignity of the vocall worde, or the word pronounced and spoken, takinge occasion of these my woordes so to doo:
column8: Notwithstanding I would no ma should esteem as a Light thing, the dignity of the vocal word, or the word pronounced and spoken, taking occasion of these my words so to do:

column7: for thys is myne opinion, that bothe the woorde and spirite of god, muste be ioyned togyther.
column8: for this is mine opinion, that both the word and Spirit of god, must be joined together.

column7: And who shall dare tontemne the woorde that Christe heere ordayneth and commaundeth, and also committeth the same to his beeloued Apostels?
column8: And who shall Dare tontemne the word that Christ Here ordaineth and commandeth, and also Committeth the same to his beeloued Apostles?

column7: For thus he sayeth furthormore:
column8: For thus he Saith furthormore:

column7: Thus it is written, and thus muste Christe suffre, and ryse again from the deade the third day,
column8: Thus it is written, and thus must Christ suffer, and rise again from the dead the third day,

column7: & to preach in his name, penance & forgiuenes of synnes, among al nacios.
column8: & to preach in his name, penance & forgiveness of Sins, among all nacios.

column8: etc. In the gospel of saint John, this Commandment and office of preaching is more euidetly described.

column7: For in the same place the Euangelist sayth thus.
column8: For in the same place the Evangelist say thus.

column8: And jesus said to them:

column7: & after that he brethed vpon them, saiyng:
column8: & After that he breathed upon them, saying:

column8: Receive you the holy ghost.

column7: Whose synnes soeuer ye shal forgeue, they are forgeuen,
column8: Whose Sins soever you shall forgive, they Are forgiven,

column7: & whosesoeuer synnes ye shal retayne, they are retayned.
column8: & whosesoever Sins you shall retain, they Are retained.

column7: <NOTE> Of these wordes it is euident that,
column8: Of these words it is evident that,

column7: Christ commytted to them ye office or administracion to teache his worde ouer all the vniuersal worlde.
column8: christ committed to them the office or administration to teach his word over all the universal world.

column7: Nowe if wee adioyne this place of S.
column8: Now if we adjoin this place of S.

column7: Ihon with these wordes of Christ recyted in this gospel, euery ma of vnderstandyng may easely perceyue, howe this forgeuyng of synnes is done,
column8: John with these words of christ recited in this gospel, every ma of understanding may Easily perceive, how this forgeuyng of Sins is done,

column7: <NOTE> That is thus.
column8: That is thus.

column7: Fyrst must penance be preached, that is, men must be brought by the knowlege of the lawe of God, to cofesse, hate and abhorre their synne.
column8: Fyrst must penance be preached, that is, men must be brought by the knowledge of the law of God, to cofesse, hate and abhor their sin.

column7: <NOTE> For this is it, that the deuine scriptures call doyng of penance, as wee may see in the Prophete Esaie.
column8: For this is it, that the divine Scriptures call doing of penance, as we may see in the Prophet Isaiah.

column7: <NOTE> Let ye vngodly (sayth he) forsake his euil way, and the vnrightwise man his ymaginacions, and let him returne vnto the Lord, and he wyll haue mercy vpo him:
column8: Let you ungodly (say he) forsake his evil Way, and the unrightwise man his Imaginations, and let him return unto the Lord, and he will have mercy upon him:

column7: Returne I say to our God, for he is very ready to forgeue.
column8: Return I say to our God, for he is very ready to forgive.

column7: And sainct Paule also, <NOTE> describeth it saiyng:
column8: And saint Paul also, Describeth it saying:

column7: He that did steale, let him steale no more &c.
column8: He that did steal, let him steal no more etc.

column7: Nowe after that men are brought vnto the knowlege of their synnes,
column8: Now After that men Are brought unto the knowledge of their Sins,

column7: & also to hate them, then must be preached vnto them and set before their eyes, the merytes of Iesu Christ.
column8: & also to hate them, then must be preached unto them and Set before their eyes, the merits of Jesu christ.

column7: For to preache remission of synnes in his name,
column8: For to preach remission of Sins in his name,

column7: <NOTE> is to ascribe the remission of synnes vnto his passion, death and merites.
column8: is to ascribe the remission of Sins unto his passion, death and merits.

column7: And when this is appreheded and beleued, there is forgeuenes of synnes, not by him, or for his sake that preacheth & declareth this, but by him and his merytes, that hath geuen that commaundement and comission to preache remyssion of synnes in his name.
column8: And when this is appreheded and believed, there is forgiveness of Sins, not by him, or for his sake that Preacheth & Declareth this, but by him and his merits, that hath given that Commandment and commission to preach remission of Sins in his name.

column7: To whom bee honor and prayse, for euer and euer. Amen.
column8: To whom be honour and praise, for ever and ever. Amen.

column7: A Nd he said vnto hys dyscyples:
column8: ANd ANd he said unto his Disciples:

column7: Let not your hert be troubled, ye beleue in God, beleue also in me.
column8: Let not your heart be troubled, you believe in God, believe also in me.

column7: In my fathers house are many mansions.
column8: In my Father's house Are many mansions.

column7: If it wer not so,
column8: If it were not so,

column7: I would haue tolde you:
column8: I would have told you:

column7: I go to prepare a place for you.
column8: I go to prepare a place for you.

column7: And if I go to prepare a place for you,
column8: And if I go to prepare a place for you,

column7: I wyll come again, and receiue you euen vnto my selfe, that <NOTE> where I am, there may ye bee also.
column8: I will come again, and receive you even unto my self, that where I am, there may you be also.

column7: And whether I go ye knowe,
column8: And whither I go you know,

column7: & the way ye knowe.
column8: & the Way you know.

column7: Thomas sayth vnto him: Lord we knowe not whether thou goest.
column8: Thomas say unto him: Lord we know not whither thou goest.

column7: And howe is it possible for vs, to knowe the waye?
column8: And how is it possible for us, to know the Way?

column7: Iesus sayth vnto him: <NOTE> I am the way and the trueth, and the life.
column8: jesus say unto him: I am the Way and the truth, and the life.

column7: No man commeth vnto the father, but by me.
column8: No man comes unto the father, but by me.

column7: If ye had knowen me ye had knowen my father also.
column8: If you had known me you had known my father also.

column7: And nowe ye knowe him, & haue seen him.
column8: And now you know him, & have seen him.

column7: Phylyp sayth vnto him: Lord, shewe vs the father,
column8: Philip say unto him: Lord, show us the father,

column7: & it suffiseth vs: Iesus sayth vnto him:
column8: & it Suffices us: jesus say unto him:

column7: Haue I been so long tyme with you,
column8: Have I been so long time with you,

column7: & yet hast thou not knowe me?
column8: & yet hast thou not know me?

column7: Phylyp, he that hath seen me, hath seen the father.
column8: Philip, he that hath seen me, hath seen the father.

column7: And howe sayest thou then:
column8: And how Sayest thou then:

column7: shewe vs the father? Beleuest thou not that <NOTE>
column8: show us the father? Believest thou not that

column7: I am in ye father, and the father in me?
column8: I am in you father, and the father in me?

column7: The woordes that I speake vnto you,
column8: The words that I speak unto you,

column7: I speake not of my selfe, but the father that dwelleth in me is he that doth the workes.
column8: I speak not of my self, but the father that dwells in me is he that does the works.

column7: Beleue me that I am in the father, and <NOTE> the father in me.
column8: Believe me that I am in the father, and the father in me.

column7: Or tis beleue me for the workes sake.
column8: Or this believe me for the works sake.

column7: Verely verely I saye vnto you:
column8: Verily verily I say unto you:

column7: he that beleueth on me, the workes that I do, the same shall he do also, and greater workes then these shal he do, because I go to my father:
column8: he that Believeth on me, the works that I do, the same shall he do also, and greater works then these shall he do, Because I go to my father:

column7: <NOTE> And whatsouer ye aske in my name that wyll I do, that the father may be glorifyed by the sonne, if ye shall aske any thyng in my name,
column8: And whatsoever you ask in my name that will I do, that the father may be glorified by the son, if you shall ask any thing in my name,

column7: I wyll do it. THE EXPOSITION.
column8: I will do it. THE EXPOSITION.

column7: <NOTE> O Ur Lorde Iesus Christe in that most excellent sermon made vnto his disciples at his last supper among all other his moste godly exhortacions, this he principally endeuored himselfe vnto, to conserue his disciples fro the slaunder of the crosse, and to prepare & comfort them against ye aduersaries of it, that were commyng.
column8: OUr OUr Lord jesus Christ in that most excellent sermon made unto his Disciples At his last supper among all other his most godly exhortations, this he principally endeavoured himself unto, to conserve his Disciples from the slander of the cross, and to prepare & Comfort them against the Adversaries of it, that were coming.

column7: For he knewe right well the imbecilitee and weakenes, not only of his disciples, but also of all men, in whom his holy gost and spirit is not yet confirmed.
column8: For he knew right well the imbecility and weakness, not only of his Disciples, but also of all men, in whom his holy ghost and Spirit is not yet confirmed.

column7: And now the tyme was present at hand, when Christ by his death should glorify the father, and returne into his glorye.
column8: And now the time was present At hand, when christ by his death should Glorify the father, and return into his glory.

column7: Nowe forasmuche as the Apostles so sore abhorred the crosse,
column8: Now forasmuch as the Apostles so soar abhorred the cross,

column7: & rather would that Christe should after the maner of Kynges and prynces of this worlde, begynne his kyngdome in Iewry, wherein they might as great Lordes and Dukes, rule with him, therefore Christe would lead them away from suche imaginacions & thoughtes, vnto the meditacion of eternal glorye, wherevnto there is no entraunce, but by the crosse.
column8: & rather would that Christ should After the manner of Kings and Princes of this world, begin his Kingdom in Jewry, wherein they might as great lords and Dukes, Rule with him, Therefore Christ would led them away from such Imaginations & thoughts, unto the meditation of Eternal glory, whereunto there is no Entrance, but by the cross.

column7: <NOTE> And thus he sayth:
column8: And thus he say:

column7: Let not your heart be troubled, nor be abashed, needes must I suffre,
column8: Let not your heart be troubled, nor be abashed, needs must I suffer,

column7: & the scripture must needes bee fulfylled, whiche testifyeth of my death and passion, that by it,
column8: & the scripture must needs be fulfilled, which Testifieth of my death and passion, that by it,

column7: I shal delyuer all men from eternall death.
column8: I shall deliver all men from Eternal death.

column7: I praye you then, why should your heartes be troubled?
column8: I pray you then, why should your hearts be troubled?

column7: You beleue in God, well, beleue also in me. for though it shal so come to passe that I shalbe betrayed to the Iewes,
column8: You believe in God, well, believe also in me. for though it shall so come to pass that I shall betrayed to the Jews,

column7: I shal suffre, be crucifyed and dye, yea and furthermore, it shal be nedeful that my deuine nature, my strength and power, be for a tyme hyd secrete vnder the crosse, yet neuerthelesse,
column8: I shall suffer, be Crucified and die, yea and furthermore, it shall be needful that my divine nature, my strength and power, be for a time hid secret under the cross, yet nevertheless,

column7: I am in deede God, of on and the sam substance with the father, wherfore let neuer suche perturbacion in any wyse bee heard of among you:
column8: I am in deed God, of on and the same substance with the father, Wherefore let never such perturbation in any wise be herd of among you:

column7: for why, my crosse shall not come, but to the great aduantage and welfare, both of you, and also of all the worlde.
column8: for why, my cross shall not come, but to the great advantage and welfare, both of you, and also of all the world.

column7: For doubtles this is a truth,
column8: For doubtless this is a truth,

column7: <NOTE> that in my fathers house there are many mansions, wher into he wyl receiue his seruauntes, kepe theim,
column8: that in my Father's house there Are many mansions, where into he will receive his Servants, keep them,

column7: & also be glorifyed in them.
column8: & also be glorified in them.

column7: Furthermore, both you and all the lecte, are already predestinate vnto those mansions, yt is, vnto eternall life.
column8: Furthermore, both you and all the lecte, Are already predestinate unto those mansions, that is, unto Eternal life.

column7: Notwithstadig, as yet those mansios are not perfect nor prepared as they must bee.
column8: Notwithstadig, as yet those mansios Are not perfect nor prepared as they must be.

column7: But if you wyll knowe howe they must bee prepared and made ready.
column8: But if you will know how they must be prepared and made ready.

column7: Marke my saiyng. It is necessary, that by my passion and my death,
column8: Mark my saying. It is necessary, that by my passion and my death,

column7: I should fyrst abolishe and take away the kyngdome of death and synne.
column8: I should fyrst Abolah and take away the Kingdom of death and sin.

column7: Then, that I should go vnto my father, and receyue that my kyngdome, whiche shall contynue for euer, euen for this cause, that I may ye more better gouerne, mayntayne and defend in that my kyngdome, all that are my disciples.
column8: Then, that I should go unto my father, and receive that my Kingdom, which shall continue for ever, even for this cause, that I may you more better govern, maintain and defend in that my Kingdom, all that Are my Disciples.

column7: Neither thinke you that I shal take this kyngdom to myne owne commodite onely, for truely I wyll returne vnto you by my woorde and holy spirit, and I wyl take you vnto my selfe, that where I am, you also may bee.
column8: Neither think you that I shall take this Kingdom to mine own commodity only, for truly I will return unto you by my word and holy Spirit, and I will take you unto my self, that where I am, you also may be.

column7: <NOTE> I wyll not leaue you Orphalynges,
column8: I will not leave you Orphans,

column7: I loue you more dearlyer, then to leaue you among so many Wolfes, persecutyng you for my woorde sake:
column8: I love you more dearlyer, then to leave you among so many Wolves, persecuting you for my word sake:

column7: onely bee you of a good comfort,
column8: only be you of a good Comfort,

column7: & be nothyng afrayde. Neither let this my passion yt shal chance, seme so great a meruayle vnto you.
column8: & be nothing afraid. Neither let this my passion that shall chance, seem so great a marvel unto you.

column7: Yea, if ye wyl be my disciples, knowe you assuredly, that you must abyde lyke chance and fortune with me, as I abyde.
column8: Yea, if you will be my Disciples, know you assuredly, that you must abide like chance and fortune with me, as I abide.

column7: Now what nedeth many wordes. <NOTE> You haue alredy hearde whether I must go, that is, vnto my father, to receyue there my kyngdome.
column8: Now what needeth many words. You have already heard whither I must go, that is, unto my father, to receive there my Kingdom.

column7: You also know the way vnto my father, so that in this matter there nedeth not many woordes.
column8: You also know the Way unto my father, so that in this matter there needeth not many words.

column7: Beholde, after this maner Christ comforteth his Apostles, against ye slaunder of the crosse that shuld come, and stablysheth them, tellyng that his death and passion shuld be the perfect preparyng of those dwellyng places, wherinto they should be receiued, yea, and also that all their saluacion ought to be fyxed in the same his mooste blessed death and passion.
column8: Behold, After this manner christ comforts his Apostles, against the slander of the cross that should come, and stablisheth them, telling that his death and passion should be the perfect preparing of those Dwelling places, whereinto they should be received, yea, and also that all their salvation ought to be fixed in the same his most blessed death and passion.

column7: <NOTE> Secondarily, here are set out two examples, that is, of the ignorance and weakenes of the Apostles.
column8: Secondarily, Here Are Set out two Examples, that is, of the ignorance and weakness of the Apostles.

column7: For when Christe had sayd:
column8: For when Christ had said:

column7: Whether I go you knowe, and you knowe the way,
column8: Whither I go you know, and you know the Way,

column7: Sainct Thomas by and by sayd:
column8: Saint Thomas by and by said:

column7: Lorde, we knowe not whether thou goest, and howe may we knowe the way?
column8: Lord, we know not whither thou goest, and how may we know the Way?

column7: But if one of these muste bee a lyer, truely Thomas shalbe the lyer, and not Christ.
column8: But if one of these must be a liar, truly Thomas shall the liar, and not christ.

column7: For had they not heard Christ often tymes say:
column8: For had they not herd christ often times say:

column7: <NOTE> The sonne of man shalbe betrayed to the princes of the priestes and Scribes, and they shal codempne him to death, and deliuer him to the Heathen to be scorned, scourged and crucified,
column8: The son of man shall betrayed to the Princes of the Priests and Scribes, and they shall codempne him to death, and deliver him to the Heathen to be scorned, scourged and Crucified,

column7: & the thyrd day he shall ryse againe?
column8: & the Third day he shall rise again?

column7: Furthermore, were they vtterly ignoraunt of these thynges & without knowlege when they sayd:
column8: Furthermore, were they utterly ignorant of these things & without knowledge when they said:

column7: Lorde, <NOTE> vnto who shal we go, thou hast the woordes of eternal life, and wee do beleue and we haue knowen, that thou art the same Christ, the sonne of the liuyng God?
column8: Lord, unto who shall we go, thou hast the words of Eternal life, and we do believe and we have known, that thou art the same christ, the son of the living God?

column7: Doubtles wee fynde here in theim a fayth, but yet it hath this vnperfectnes, that this faith as yet was not cofirmed by the holy ghost, nor yet tryed by any persecucion.
column8: Doubtless we find Here in them a faith, but yet it hath this unperfectness, that this faith as yet was not cofirmed by the holy ghost, nor yet tried by any persecution.

column7: Euen so doth Philip also, when Christ sayd:
column8: Eve so does Philip also, when christ said:

column7: If you knewe me, doubtles you should knowe my father also &c.
column8: If you knew me, doubtless you should know my father also etc.

column7: Philip sayd: Lord, shewe vs the father, and it suffiseth to vs.
column8: Philip said: Lord, show us the father, and it Suffices to us

column7: What meaneth this? Would Philyp also then see the father with his corporall eyes, or would he none otherwyse holde himselfe contented?
column8: What means this? Would Philip also then see the father with his corporal eyes, or would he none otherwise hold himself contented?

column7: Suffiseth it not that Christ had sayd before vnto him:
column8: Suffices it not that christ had said before unto him:

column7: If you had knowen me, surely you should haue knowe my father also?
column8: If you had known me, surely you should have know my father also?

column7: Verely in this matter appertainyng to the knowledge of God, al men haue one affection, neither can they do any other wyse.
column8: Verily in this matter aPPERTAINING to the knowledge of God, all men have one affection, neither can they do any other wise.

column7: Verely wee are blynde in this cause touchyng God <NOTE> and his honor, except we be lightned by ye holy gost, and coforted in fayth,
column8: Verily we Are blind in this cause touching God and his honour, except we be lightened by you holy ghost, and coforted in faith,

column7: & approued by the crosse.
column8: & approved by the cross.

column7: For that whiche is borne of the fleshe, it is fleshe, and it hath annexed and knyt to it selfe, incredulitee and ignoraunce, as examples through the scripture do euidently proue, and as in this gospel also we may see it playnely set furth in thse Apostles.
column8: For that which is born of the Flesh, it is Flesh, and it hath annexed and knit to it self, incredulity and ignorance, as Examples through the scripture do evidently prove, and as in this gospel also we may see it plainly Set forth in thse Apostles.

column7: Thyrdly, wee shal nowe come to the answere geuen vnto the Apostle sainct Thomas:
column8: Thirdly, we shall now come to the answer given unto the Apostle saint Thomas:

column7: whiche also we wyll wey & diligetly consider, for in it is propouded vnto vs, ye excedyng great goodnes & mercy of Christ.
column8: which also we will weigh & diligetly Consider, for in it is propouded unto us, you exceeding great Goodness & mercy of christ.

column7: For though as yet thei wer rude & ignorant in the matter of fayth, yet Christ forsoke them not, but in this his godly and most excellent answere, so intreateth them, that it may very well be perceiued that he desyred nothing so much as to procure their helth,
column8: For though as yet they were rude & ignorant in the matter of faith, yet christ forsook them not, but in this his godly and most excellent answer, so intreateth them, that it may very well be perceived that he desired nothing so much as to procure their health,

column7: & to bryng them vnto the knowlege of fayth.
column8: & to bring them unto the knowledge of faith.

column7: Nowe what answere gaue he to them?
column8: Now what answer gave he to them?

column7: <NOTE> I am ye way, the truth and the life.
column8: I am the Way, the truth and the life.

column7: O worthy and excellent sentence, worthy to be written eue with golden letters, in the heartes of all men.
column8: O worthy and excellent sentence, worthy to be written eve with golden letters, in the hearts of all men.

column7: But it is to be lamented that it hath so long tyme lyen despysed & neglected, and that so fewe haue in heartes apprehended and vnderstande it.
column8: But it is to be lamented that it hath so long time lyen despised & neglected, and that so few have in hearts apprehended and understand it.

column7: <NOTE> I pray you, howe many wayes before tymes hath theyr been, whereby we haue interprysed to obtayne eternal lyfe?
column8: I pray you, how many ways before times hath their been, whereby we have enterprise to obtain Eternal life?

column7: Surely, I thynke in numerable.
column8: Surely, I think in numerable.

column7: For loke howe many heades, so many wayes were inuented of our awne braynes to come vnto iustice & eternal lyfe.
column8: For look how many Heads, so many ways were invented of our awn brains to come unto Justice & Eternal life.

column7: But these wayes in dede if they were conferred and iudged by the woorde of God, were nothyng els but wrong pathes and false wayes out of the true waye, whiche led vs not vnto eternal lyfe, but to perpetuall condempnacion of death, not vnto heauen, but vnto hell in dede.
column8: But these ways in deed if they were conferred and judged by the word of God, were nothing Else but wrong paths and false ways out of the true Way, which led us not unto Eternal life, but to perpetual condemnation of death, not unto heaven, but unto hell in deed.

column7: And these are the wayes that the Wyse man spake of, saiyng:
column8: And these Are the ways that the Wise man spoke of, saying:

column7: <NOTE> The waye of a foole is straight in his owne eyes.
column8: The Way of a fool is straight in his own eyes.

column7: But what sayth Christ to this?
column8: But what say christ to this?

column7: Forsoth he sayth, that he onely is the waye, as he is in very deede and without doubt.
column8: Forsooth he say, that he only is the Way, as he is in very deed and without doubt.

column7: For by him we haue remission of sinnes, righteousnes and eternal health, and a free entraunce in vnto the father.
column8: For by him we have remission of Sins, righteousness and Eternal health, and a free Entrance in unto the father.

column7: Neither is any man admytted vnto the fathers presence by any other mediatour or meane, but by this Christe onely.
column8: Neither is any man admitted unto the Father's presence by any other Mediator or mean, but by this Christ only.

column7: And he that wyll not beleue this, lette him knowe it assuredly, that he shall neuer comme vnto the father, neither be partaker of eternal life.
column8: And he that will not believe this, let him know it assuredly, that he shall never comme unto the father, neither be partaker of Eternal life.

column7: <NOTE> And I beseche you, how shal he comme vnto the father, that seketh other meanes to comme to him, then by Christe?
column8: And I beseech you, how shall he comme unto the father, that seeketh other means to comme to him, then by Christ?

column7: Besydes that, he rather geueth credence vnto false liyng, then to the truth, euen that trueth whereof Christe here testifyeth of, affirmyng him selfe to be the trueth.
column8: Besides that, he rather Giveth credence unto false lying, then to the truth, even that truth whereof Christ Here Testifieth of, affirming him self to be the truth.

column7: For I pray you, <NOTE> what are all menne, all mennes doctrynes, all the studyes and counsels of menne, if they bee conferred to Christe and his woordes?
column8: For I pray you, what Are all men, all men's doctrines, all the studies and Counsels of men, if they be conferred to Christ and his words?

column7: Truely all lyers, and mere lyes are all those thynges that are spoken without the woorde of God, as the scripture testifyeth.
column8: Truly all liars, and mere lies Are all those things that Are spoken without the word of God, as the scripture Testifieth.

column7: <NOTE> Psalme Cxv. Euery manne is a lyar.
column8: Psalm Cxv. Every man is a liar.

column7: But of the woorde of God the scripture sayth: Thy woorde is trueth.
column8: But of the word of God the scripture say: Thy word is truth.

column7: Nowe if the woorde of God onely bee trueth,
column8: Now if the word of God only be truth,

column7: <NOTE> then it necessarily muste folowe, that whatsoeuer menne haue inuented without the worde of God, it is lyes & mere deceyuable iuglyng.
column8: then it necessarily must follow, that whatsoever men have invented without the word of God, it is lies & mere deceivable juggling.

column7: Howe can it be but truth, seyng ye to those that beleue in it,
column8: Howe can it be but truth, sing you to those that believe in it,

column7: <NOTE> it is the power of God vnto saluacion and eternal health?
column8: it is the power of God unto salvation and Eternal health?

column7: For to beleue ye word of God, is euen thesame as to beleue Christ.
column8: For to believe you word of God, is even The same as to believe christ.

column7: For Christ is the same woorde, and the woorde was made fleshe.
column8: For christ is the same word, and the word was made Flesh.

column7: <NOTE> And to beleue Christe, is so excellente and noble a thyng, that it taketh away synnes and eternal death, and for them geueth righteousnes and eternal life.
column8: And to believe Christ, is so excellent and noble a thing, that it Takes away Sins and Eternal death, and for them Giveth righteousness and Eternal life.

column7: And thus it abydeth true that Christ sayd in this place:
column8: And thus it Abideth true that christ said in this place:

column7: I am the waye, the truth and the life.
column8: I am the Way, the truth and the life.

column7: Fourthly, consider also what Christe-sayd vnto Philip, neither would Christ refuse him because of his imbecilitee or weakenes, but rather instructeth him thus:
column8: Fourthly, Consider also what Christ-said unto Philip, neither would christ refuse him Because of his imbecility or weakness, but rather Instructeth him thus:

column7: Philip, he that seeth me, seeth my father.
column8: Philip, he that sees me, sees my father.

column7: Philip would see ye father,
column8: Philip would see you father,

column7: <NOTE> but Christ would graue it, not only in Philippes heart, but also in all other his disciples heartes, that he is one thyng and substaunce with the father, one God equal with the father in maiestie and glory, of a like strength & wysedome with him.
column8: but christ would graven it, not only in Philippians heart, but also in all other his Disciples hearts, that he is one thing and substance with the father, one God equal with the father in majesty and glory, of a like strength & Wisdom with him.

column7: This onely excepte, that Christ for our infirmitees sakes, to redeme vs was made ma, and therefore, asmuche as pertayneth to that, he is made lesse then ye father, as it is wrytten in the viii.
column8: This only except, that christ for our infirmitees sakes, to Redeem us was made ma, and Therefore, asmuch as pertaineth to that, he is made less then you father, as it is written in the viii.

column7: Psalme: <NOTE> Thou hast made him a lytle lesse, vnder the dignitee of angels &c.
column8: Psalm: Thou hast made him a little less, under the dignity of Angels etc.

column7: Philip (sayth Christe) he that seeth me, seeth my father.
column8: Philip (say Christ) he that sees me, sees my father.

column7: And furthermore I dwel in the father, and the father in me.
column8: And furthermore I dwell in the father, and the father in me.

column7: Beholde howe earnestly Christ recyteth and bet eth into his disciples his deuine nature and essence with the father,
column8: Behold how earnestly christ reciteth and bet eth into his Disciples his divine nature and essence with the father,

column7: & also requireth, that thei shuld no lesse beleue on him:
column8: & also requires, that they should no less believe on him:

column7: Verely (sayth he) al that I do or speak,
column8: Verily (say he) all that I do or speak,

column7: I do it not or speake it of my selfe, but the father yt dwelleth in me, he dothe those workes.
column8: I do it not or speak it of my self, but the father that dwells in me, he doth those works.

column7: Therfore for the workes sake, at the lest beleue me, that I am in the father, and the father is in me.
column8: Therefore for the works sake, At the lest believe me, that I am in the father, and the father is in me.

column7: Furthermore, Christ highly prayseth this fayth, as he most earnestly requyreth it,
column8: Furthermore, christ highly Praiseth this faith, as he most earnestly requireth it,

column7: & sayth. Verely, I say vnto you:
column8: & say. Verily, I say unto you:

column7: He that beleueth in me, the woorkes that I do, he also shall do them,
column8: He that Believeth in me, the works that I do, he also shall do them,

column7: & greatter thynges then these shall he do.
column8: & greater things then these shall he do.

column7: He shall do greatter thynges then these, especially seyng that Christ goeth to the father to receyue his kyngdome, and to sende the holy ghost.
column8: He shall do greater things then these, especially sing that christ Goes to the father to receive his Kingdom, and to send the holy ghost.

column7: <NOTE> I beseche you nowe, who date bee so impudent a beast, or so styffe necked, that he shall dare any thyng at all derogate or minishe ye dignitee of fayth, seyng that to the beleuer there are made such excellent promises?
column8: I beseech you now, who date be so impudent a beast, or so stiff necked, that he shall Dare any thing At all derogate or minish you dignity of faith, sing that to the believer there Are made such excellent promises?

column7: Yea and furthermore here is made a comfortable and excellent promise vnto fayth, that is to say, that whatsoeuer she wyl aske in the name of Christ, shalbe geue her.
column8: Yea and furthermore Here is made a comfortable and excellent promise unto faith, that is to say, that whatsoever she will ask in the name of christ, shall give her.

column7: Wherfore shal it be geue?
column8: Wherefore shall it be give?

column7: Doubtles yt the father may be glorifyed through the sone.
column8: Doubtless that the father may be glorified through the soon.

column7: And to speake briefely. We must thus beleue of Christ, yt he is of the same essece, of the same power & wysedome with the father, so that he that beleueth not in Christ, that man I say, shal neuer come at the father, nor at his knowlege.
column8: And to speak briefly. We must thus believe of christ, that he is of the same essence, of the same power & Wisdom with the father, so that he that Believeth not in christ, that man I say, shall never come At the father, nor At his knowledge.

column7: For Christ is the way, the truth and the life.
column8: For christ is the Way, the truth and the life.

column7: And also noman cometh to ye father, but by Christ, as our sauiour Iesus Christe hath testified in many places of his gospel.
column8: And also Roman comes to you father, but by christ, as our Saviour jesus Christ hath testified in many places of his gospel.

column7: Wherfore that we may come to the knowlege of ye father, dearly beloued of the Lord, let vs diligently apply oure selues to heare the worde of God, whereby the true knowlege of Christ is geue vnto vs.
column8: Wherefore that we may come to the knowledge of the father, dearly Beloved of the Lord, let us diligently apply our selves to hear the word of God, whereby the true knowledge of christ is give unto us

column7: Who knowen and apprehended by faith, we may be made parteners and obtayne eternal life.
column8: Who known and apprehended by faith, we may be made partners and obtain Eternal life.

column7: Amen. The gospel on the Ascencion of our Lord Iesu Christ day. Marke. 16.
column8: Amen. The gospel on the Ascension of our Lord Jesu christ day. Mark. 16.

column7: A Fterwarde he appeared vnto the eleuen as they fat at meate, and cast in their teth their vnbeleife and hardnes of heart, because they beleued not theim whiche had seen that he was rysen agayne from the dead.
column8: Afterward Afterward he appeared unto the eleuen as they fat At meat, and cast in their teth their unbelief and hardness of heart, Because they believed not them which had seen that he was risen again from the dead.

column7: And he sayd vnto them:
column8: And he said unto them:

column7: <NOTE> Go ye into all the worlde, and preache the gospell to all creatures, he that beleueth and is baptised, shalbe saued.
column8: Go you into all the world, and preach the gospel to all creatures, he that Believeth and is baptised, shall saved.

column7: But he that beleueth not, shalbe dampned.
column8: But he that Believeth not, shall dampened.

column7: And those tokens shal folow them that beleue:
column8: And those tokens shall follow them that believe:

column7: <NOTE> In my name they shall cast out deuils, they <NOTE> shall speake with newe tongues, they shal <NOTE> dryue awaye serpentes.
column8: In my name they shall cast out Devils, they shall speak with new tongues, they shall drive away Serpents.

column7: And if they drynke any deadly thyng, it shal not hurt them.
column8: And if they drink any deadly thing, it shall not hurt them.

column7: They shall lay theyr handes on the sycke, and they shal recouer.
column8: They shall lay their hands on the sick, and they shall recover.

column7: So then, when the Lorde had spoken vnto them <NOTE> he was receiued into heauen, and is on the right hande of God.
column8: So then, when the Lord had spoken unto them he was received into heaven, and is on the right hand of God.

column7: And they went furth, and preached euery where:
column8: And they went forth, and preached every where:

column7: the Lord workyng with them <NOTE> and confirmyng the worde with myracles folowyng. THE EXPOSITION.
column8: the Lord working with them and confirming the word with Miracles following. THE EXPOSITION.

column7: S Eyng that al thynges in the deuine scriptures ought well to be considered & wayed, this may not be ouerpassed, but must diligently be noted and considered, that the Euangelist S.
column8: Sing Sing that all things in the divine Scriptures ought well to be considered & weighed, this may not be overpassed, but must diligently be noted and considered, that the Evangelist S.

column7: Marke in this place, where he descrybeth the ascecion of our Lord Iesu Christ (wherein also lyke at in his passion and resurrection consysteth our whole iustificacion) maketh mencion of that synne, for the which our Lord Iesus Christe so often before he ascended into heauen,
column8: Mark in this place, where he Describeth the Ascension of our Lord Jesu christ (wherein also like At in his passion and resurrection Consisteth our Whole justification) makes mention of that sin, for the which our Lord jesus Christ so often before he ascended into heaven,

column7: rebuked his disciples, namely of theyr incredulitee and vnbelief.
column8: rebuked his Disciples, namely of their incredulity and unbelief.

column7: Surely it must needes be, that this is an heauye and great synne, yea, it is to bee estemed and thought a verye spryng, welle & fountayn of all mischiefe, seyng that our sauiour Christ, euen nowe, when he would departe & go to his heauenly father, rebuketh it so earnestly in his Apostles.
column8: Surely it must needs be, that this is an heavy and great sin, yea, it is to be esteemed and Thought a very spring, well & fountain of all mischief, sing that our Saviour christ, even now, when he would depart & go to his heavenly father, Rebuketh it so earnestly in his Apostles.

column7: For thus sayth the Euangelist:
column8: For thus say the Evangelist:

column7: At the last as the eleuen sat at the table, he shewed himselfe vnto theim, and rebuked their vnbeleife and hardnes of heart, because they beleued not them whiche had seen him rysen.
column8: At the last as the eleuen sat At the table, he showed himself unto them, and rebuked their unbelief and hardness of heart, Because they believed not them which had seen him risen.

column7: Here you heare what synne this was, namely Incredulitee.
column8: Here you hear what sin this was, namely Incredulity.

column7: And I pray you, <NOTE> who is so shamelesse to deny that vnbeleif is the fountayn of all euil, especially if he compare fayth whereof scripture speaketh, with her effectes, with incredulitee and her frutes?
column8: And I pray you, who is so shameless to deny that unbelief is the fountain of all evil, especially if he compare faith whereof scripture speaks, with her effects, with incredulity and her fruits?

column7: For so comparyng them, it shal be an easy thyng to perceyue, howe good and what a great thyng fayth is, and howe excedyng an euil vnbeliefe is.
column8: For so comparing them, it shall be an easy thing to perceive, how good and what a great thing faith is, and how exceeding an evil unbelief is.

column7: The scripture euery where testifieth this of fayth, and doubtles suche is the nature of it that it vtterly dispayreth of all the workes that ma other dothe or can do, nor putteth no trust or confidence in none of them, but alonely seketh at Christ, that righteousnes that is of value afore God, of mere grace and mercy, without any merytes or deseruynges of woorkes.
column8: The scripture every where Testifieth this of faith, and doubtless such is the nature of it that it utterly dispayreth of all the works that ma other doth or can do, nor putteth no trust or confidence in none of them, but alonely seeketh At christ, that righteousness that is of valve afore God, of mere grace and mercy, without any merits or deservings of works.

column7: And this fayth is of suche power, that when it is true and right, it obtayneth also by Christe remission of synnes, righteousnes and eternall health, yea, of the chyldren of the deuyl, it maketh the sonnes and heyres of God, as S.
column8: And this faith is of such power, that when it is true and right, it obtaineth also by Christ remission of Sins, righteousness and Eternal health, yea, of the children of the Devil, it makes the Sons and Heirs of God, as S.

column7: Paule wryteth in the Epistle to the Romaynes,
column8: Paul writes in the Epistle to the Romans,

column7: saiyng: <NOTE> Surely, whosoeuer are led by the spirite of God, these are the children of God.
column8: saying: Surely, whosoever Are led by the Spirit of God, these Are the children of God.

column7: For ye haue not receiued the spirit of bondage agayne to feare, but ye haue receyued the spirit of adopcion, by who wee cry, abba father.
column8: For you have not received the Spirit of bondage again to Fear, but you have received the Spirit of adoption, by who we cry, abba father.

column7: Thesame spirit testifyeth together with our spirit, that we are the sonnes of God.
column8: The same Spirit Testifieth together with our Spirit, that we Are the Sons of God.

column7: If wee bee chyldren, then are wee heyres also.
column8: If we be children, then Are we Heirs also.

column7: Namely heyres of God, and annexed heyres of Christ &c.
column8: Namely Heirs of God, and annexed Heirs of christ etc.

column7: And doubtles thus it is with true fayth.
column8: And doubtless thus it is with true faith.

column7: Contrary, vnbelief hath his peculyar nature, and suche is his condicion, that it determyneth his owne righteousnes and eternall lyfe, to come of his owne woorkes, and not of the meryte of Christ, whiche can not bee but to the great iniury of the passion of oure Lorde Iesus Christe, by whose meryte onely the heauenly father is pacifyed.
column8: Contrary, unbelief hath his peculiar nature, and such is his condition, that it determyneth his own righteousness and Eternal life, to come of his own works, and not of the merit of christ, which can not be but to the great injury of the passion of our Lord jesus Christ, by whose merit only the heavenly father is pacified.

column7: <NOTE> And what greater contumely and blasphemy may be done vnto our Lord Christ, then to dispoyle him of his honour, and to ascribe vnto our woorkes that thyng, whiche iustly ought to be attributed onely vnto his merite & grace?
column8: And what greater contumely and blasphemy may be done unto our Lord christ, then to despoil him of his honour, and to ascribe unto our works that thing, which justly ought to be attributed only unto his merit & grace?

column7: For dothe not the scripture say:
column8: For doth not the scripture say:

column7: He is the obtainyng of grace or propiciacion for oure synnes?
column8: He is the obtaining of grace or propiciacion for our Sins?

column7: Agayne in ye fyrst Epistle to the Corinthians:
column8: Again in you fyrst Epistle to the Corinthians:

column7: Christe is made vnto vs (sayth sainct Paule) wysedome from God and righteousnes, and sanctifiyng, and redempcio.
column8: Christ is made unto us (say saint Paul) Wisdom from God and righteousness, and sanctifying, and redempcio.

column7: Those then that agayne say the merytes of Christ, and with woordes crye out against it,
column8: Those then that again say the merits of christ, and with words cry out against it,

column7: & asmuche as in them lyeth, go about to suppresse it, they do with al theyr study seke righteousnes & eternal helth by ye merites of their own workes.
column8: & asmuch as in them lies, go about to suppress it, they do with all their study seek righteousness & Eternal health by you merits of their own works.

column7: And those wtout dout are false christians, eue thesame ye Christ speketh on in Mat. that thei shuld come vnder his name & sai:
column8: And those without doubt Are false Christians, eve The same the christ Speaketh on in Mathew that they should come under his name & sai:

column7: <NOTE> Lo heree is Christe.
column8: Lo heree is Christ.

column7: &c. And thus shall it chaunce to the, that they shal neuer haue the righteousnes eternall health, and inheritaunce of the sonnes of god, but a vaine prayse and a deceyuable glorye, that onlye shall they obtayne.
column8: etc. And thus shall it chance to thee, that they shall never have the righteousness Eternal health, and inheritance of the Sons of god, but a vain praise and a deceivable glory, that only shall they obtain.

column7: And why? For in all theyr workes they sought nothing els, then the phariseis did, whome Christe blameth in the gospell of Mathew, and saith,
column8: And why? For in all their works they sought nothing Else, then the Pharisees did, whom Christ blameth in the gospel of Matthew, and Says,

column7: <NOTE> that they did their workes for this intent, that they might be glorified of menne.
column8: that they did their works for this intent, that they might be glorified of men.

column7: And S. Paule saith: <NOTE> They beynge ignoraunte of the righteousnes that is alowed and giuen of god, and seekinge to set vppe a righteousnesse of theyr owne, they were not subiect to the righteousnes of god.
column8: And S. Paul Says: They being ignorant of the righteousness that is aloud and given of god, and seeking to Set up a righteousness of their own, they were not Subject to the righteousness of god.

column7: To this pertaineth also the promise of the holy ghost, wher Christe saithe:
column8: To this pertaineth also the promise of the holy ghost, where Christ Saith:

column7: <NOTE> When the holy ghost shall come, he shall rebuke the world of sin, bicause they beleued not in me.
column8: When the holy ghost shall come, he shall rebuke the world of since, Because they believed not in me.

column7: &c. In this place wee heare again, that vnbeliefe is so great a sinne, that needs muste the holy ghost be giuen frome heauen, to rebuke men of their vnbeliefe.
column8: etc. In this place we hear again, that unbelief is so great a sin, that needs must the holy ghost be given from heaven, to rebuke men of their unbelief.

column7: Who can now think it meruail, though Christe often times so sore blamed & rebuked vnbelief in his disciples,
column8: Who can now think it marvel, though Christ often times so soar blamed & rebuked unbelief in his Disciples,

column7: & again in so highlye praised and avaunced faith?
column8: & again in so highly praised and advanced faith?

column7: It is therfore dearlye beloued our part, studiously to avoide vnbelief, and by al means to embrace the true faith of Christ that by it we may be iustified before god, and haue eternall lyfe.
column8: It is Therefore dearly Beloved our part, studiously to avoid unbelief, and by all means to embrace the true faith of christ that by it we may be justified before god, and have Eternal life.

column7: Secondarily, <NOTE> in this gospell ys committed vnto the apostels, the offyce to preache the worde of god, and accordynge to the same worde, the administration of Baptisme.
column8: Secondarily, in this gospel is committed unto the Apostles, the office to preach the word of god, and according to the same word, the administration of Baptism.

column7: And suerly this commaundemet of Christ highly setteth out, praiseth and extolleth the vocation of the Apostels and also the ministers of the worde, which euery christian man ought diligently to consyder,
column8: And surely this Commandment of christ highly sets out, Praiseth and extolleth the vocation of the Apostles and also the Ministers of the word, which every christian man ought diligently to Consider,

column7: & pythely to root it in his heart.
column8: & pythely to root it in his heart.

column7: For where men are assured, that the Apostels and ministers of the worde come not forth vncommaunded, nor do not headilye of their owne autoritye vsurpe this office of teaching, bu are sent to preache and baptise frome the Lorde oure God, there without doubt the office of preaching and administration of the sacramentes shalbe esteemed accordinglye in highe honoure and dignitie.
column8: For where men Are assured, that the Apostles and Ministers of the word come not forth uncommanded, nor do not headilye of their own Authority usurp this office of teaching, but Are sent to preach and baptise from the Lord our God, there without doubt the office of preaching and administration of the Sacraments shall esteemed accordingly in high honour and dignity.

column7: Therefore, doubteles it is very necessary for euery christian diligently to obserue, marke and learne this gospell, as wherin we ar taught, that highe honour ought to be giuen to the administracion of the worde and sacraments, as to thinges that Christ himselfe the only begotten sonne of god, so earnestly commaunded to his beloued Apostles, and also adourned these thinges with his owne worde.
column8: Therefore, doubtless it is very necessary for every christian diligently to observe, mark and Learn this gospel, as wherein we Are taught, that high honour ought to be given to the administration of the word and Sacraments, as to things that christ himself the only begotten son of god, so earnestly commanded to his Beloved Apostles, and also adjourned these things with his own word.

column7: But lette vs now heare what wordes Christe spake to his disciples.
column8: But let us now hear what words Christ spoke to his Disciples.

column7: Go (said he) into the whole world, and preach the gospell to euery creature.
column8: Go (said he) into the Whole world, and preach the gospel to every creature.

column7: Who so beleueth & is baptized, shalbe saued:
column8: Who so Believeth & is baptised, shall saved:

column7: but who so beleueth not, shal be damned.
column8: but who so Believeth not, shall be damned.

column7: In this text there are two thinges especially comaunded the Apostles, that is, to teach the gospel, and to baptise.
column8: In this text there Are two things especially commanded the Apostles, that is, to teach the gospel, and to baptise.

column7: As it is also more euidently & plainly declared by the euangelist Math. where Christ saith thus to his apostels:
column8: As it is also more evidently & plainly declared by the evangelist Math. where christ Says thus to his Apostles:

column7: <NOTE> Go ye your waye therefore, and teache all nacions, and baptise them in the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of holy Ghost.
column8: Go you your Way Therefore, and teach all Nations, and baptise them in the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of holy Ghost.

column7: And teache them to keepe all thinges,
column8: And teach them to keep all things,

column7: whatsoeuer I haue comaunded you.
column8: whatsoever I have commanded you.

column7: In these wordes againe we perceiue, that these two thynges are comaunded chiefly to the Apostles, that is, to teache and to baptise.
column8: In these words again we perceive, that these two things Are commanded chiefly to the Apostles, that is, to teach and to baptise.

column7: Nowe it is nedeful that we with al diligence marke this comaundement, as a thyng yt Christ so studiously and earnestly, yea as euidently as was possible, expresseth & beateth it into his disciples memorye, and that for none other cause, but to declare that he specially taketh cure and regardeth the administracion of his holy worde and the sacrametes:
column8: Now it is needful that we with all diligence mark this Commandment, as a thing that christ so studiously and earnestly, yea as evidently as was possible, Expresses & beats it into his Disciples memory, and that for none other cause, but to declare that he specially Takes cure and Regardeth the administration of his holy word and the sacrametes:

column7: and to admonishe vs, yt we also beare & attribute vnto these his ordinances their right honor,
column8: and to admonish us, that we also bear & attribute unto these his ordinances their right honour,

column7: & geue vnto them their due glory.
column8: & give unto them their due glory.

column7: But amog al men the ministers of this word ought well to consider & take diliget hede vnto this comaundemet of Christ For seyng that ye office to teache, is the ordinance & comaundement of the most best & most mighty god, therfore ye ministers part is, in this office & comaundement of God so to behaue him selfe,
column8: But Among all men the Ministers of this word ought well to Consider & take diliget heed unto this comaundemet of christ For sing that you office to teach, is the Ordinance & Commandment of the most best & most mighty god, Therefore you Ministers part is, in this office & Commandment of God so to behave him self,

column7: & to order all his doctrin & life after suche maner, yt by his grauitee & diligece,
column8: & to order all his Doctrine & life After such manner, that by his gravity & diligence,

column7: & blamelesse & irreprehensible liuyng the worde of ye gospel may be set forward & magnified, as sainct Paule also saith:
column8: & blameless & irreprehensible living the word of the gospel may be Set forward & magnified, as saint Paul also Says:

column7: <NOTE> This is required of stewardes of the mysteries of God, yt they be found faythful.
column8: This is required of Stewards of the Mysteres of God, that they be found faithful.

column7: And on ye other part, ye hearer cosidering yt this ministery is instituted of God, he ought not only to heare & receiue & worde wt al humilitee & reuerence, but also well to esteme & honorably to entertayn the minister for his names sake that instituted the administracion, lest it chaunce vnto vs, as it did to ye Iewes, to who Christ sayd:
column8: And on you other part, you hearer considering that this Ministry is instituted of God, he ought not only to hear & receive & word with all humility & Reverence, but also well to esteem & honorably to entertain the minister for his names sake that instituted the administration, lest it chance unto us, as it did to you Jews, to who christ said:

column7: I do glorify my father,
column8: I do Glorify my father,

column7: & you do dishonor me.
column8: & you do dishonour me.

column7: And sainct Paule saith: Those that rule well and faithfully with the word, they are worthye double honour.
column8: And saint Paul Says: Those that Rule well and faithfully with the word, they Are worthy double honour.

column7: And the same testimonies also gyueth hee to the Galathians, that they receyued him as an aungell of god, yea and yf it had beene possible, they wolde haue digged oute theyr eyes to haue giuen to him. <NOTE> And in like maner ought yt ministery of baptism to be estemed as a precyous & godly gyfte, for why, we se here it is not the inuencion or imagynacion of ma, but it is the instytution and comaundement of the lord god himself.
column8: And the same testimonies also gyveth he to the Galatians, that they received him as an angel of god, yea and if it had been possible, they would have dug out their eyes to have given to him. And in like manner ought that Ministry of Baptism to be esteemed as a precious & godly gift, for why, we see Here it is not the invention or imagynacion of ma, but it is the instytution and Commandment of the lord god himself.

column7: Furthermore this is wel to be noted, that the mystery of the worde and baptisme, ought to bee communicate vnto all men.
column8: Furthermore this is well to be noted, that the mystery of the word and Baptism, ought to be communicate unto all men.

column7: And I pray you, who may here with good coscience exclude the infantes,
column8: And I pray you, who may Here with good conscience exclude the Infants,

column7: <NOTE> who Christ excluded not?
column8: who christ excluded not?

column7: Wee must preach to al men, al men must be baptyzed, neither ought the infantes by any meanes to be restrained from baptisme.
column8: we must preach to all men, all men must be baptized, neither ought the Infants by any means to be restrained from Baptism.

column7: For although as yet they are not apte to heare the outwarde worde, yet is god able to teach them inwardly by hys spyrite, tyll they maye growe and ware able to hear and receyue the vocall and externe outwarde woorde, preached to theim.
column8: For although as yet they Are not apt to hear the outward word, yet is god able to teach them inwardly by his Spirit, till they may grow and beware able to hear and receive the vocal and extern outward word, preached to them.

column7: <NOTE> Thyrdely, when Christe hath committed to his apostels & preachers the ministery of the word, hee also sheweth what maner of word it is yt they muste preach & teach to the people, that is, yt most cofortable tidigs of holy gospel.
column8: Thirdly, when Christ hath committed to his Apostles & Preachers the Ministry of the word, he also shows what manner of word it is that they must preach & teach to the people, that is, that most cofortable tidigs of holy gospel.

column7: Go forth (saith he) preach the gospel to al creatures.
column8: Go forth (Says he) preach the gospel to all creatures.

column7: <NOTE> But what is ye gospel.
column8: But what is the gospel.

column7: It is a glad tidigs, wherin ys offered & giue to vs, for Christes merites, without any deseruing vpon our behalfe, but of mere grace, remission of sinnes, righteousnes, and eternall lyfe.
column8: It is a glad tidigs, wherein is offered & give to us, for Christ's merits, without any deserving upon our behalf, but of mere grace, remission of Sins, righteousness, and Eternal life.

column7: And this preachyng must he that is come to the knowlege of his sins, by the preachyng of the law, receiue wt faith, nether mai he doubt of this promise if it shal do him any profite.
column8: And this preaching must he that is come to the knowledge of his Sins, by the preaching of the law, receive with faith, neither mai he doubt of this promise if it shall do him any profit.

column7: In like maner saith S. Paule:
column8: In like manner Says S. Paul:

column7: The gospel is the power of God vnto saluacion, to euery ma yt beleueth it.
column8: The gospel is the power of God unto salvation, to every ma that Believeth it.

column7: Here you hear that ye gospel is ye power of God, not wtstanding it must be receiued by fayth.
column8: Here you hear that you gospel is the power of God, not withstanding it must be received by faith.

column7: In the woorde is the power of God, of this you may not doubte but beleue, if any fayth be in thyne heart.
column8: In the word is the power of God, of this you may not doubt but believe, if any faith be in thine heart.

column7: Christes promyse shall here in no wyse deceiue vs, if our fayth be perfect, like as Christ also here requireth fayth, saiyng:
column8: Christ's promise shall Here in no wise deceive us, if our faith be perfect, like as christ also Here requires faith, saying:

column7: <NOTE> Whoso beleueth and is baptized, shalbe saued:
column8: Whoso Believeth and is baptised, shall saved:

column7: But he that beleueth not, shalbe codempned.
column8: But he that Believeth not, shall codempned.

column7: We must here note two thynges.
column8: We must Here note two things.

column7: Fyrst, that Christ gaue commaundement to his Apostles to preache onely his worde & gospel.
column8: Fyrst, that christ gave Commandment to his Apostles to preach only his word & gospel.

column7: Where this is well considered & pondered in the mynde, there shortly vanisheth away and are abolished tradicions, dreames,
column8: Where this is well considered & pondered in the mind, there shortly Vanishes away and Are abolished traditions, dreams,

column7: & doctrynes of men. I praye you, howe agreeth this, that in the causes pertainyng to our iustificacion, any other doctryne should be admitted, but the only worde of God?
column8: & doctrines of men. I pray you, how agreeth this, that in the Causes pertaining to our justification, any other Doctrine should be admitted, but the only word of God?

column7: In ceremoies & excercises because of youth, ther might be obserued tradicions and costitucions of menne, but in this matter of iustifycacion, the woorde of God onely is to be admitted.
column8: In ceremoies & exercises Because of youth, there might be observed traditions and costitucions of men, but in this matter of justification, the word of God only is to be admitted.

column7: The second note is, <NOTE> that Christe ioyneth together the ministerye of the worde, and baptisme.
column8: The second note is, that Christ Joineth together the Ministry of the word, and Baptism.

column7: For this wyll he teache in it, that baptisme and the sacrametes haue their power of the woorde, and can by no meanes bee disseuered from the worde.
column8: For this will he teach in it, that Baptism and the sacrametes have their power of the word, and can by no means be dissevered from the word.

column7: For as concernyng baptisme, what authoritee could it haue, if ye worde were not ioyned with it?
column8: For as Concerning Baptism, what Authority could it have, if you word were not joined with it?

column7: Doubtles the water shuld be nothyng, but styll remayne water.
column8: Doubtless the water should be nothing, but still remain water.
