column7: But ioyne the worde to it, and consider well the commaundement annexed to it, then shall not the water be simple water, but as S.
column8: But join the word to it, and Consider well the Commandment annexed to it, then shall not the water be simple water, but as S.

column7: Paule calleth it, it is a washyng of regentracion & of newe byrthe, and renewyng of the holy gost.
column8: Paul calls it, it is a washing of regentracion & of new birth, and renewing of the holy ghost.

column7: And therfore is it that Christ sayth in this gospel:
column8: And Therefore is it that christ say in this gospel:

column7: Who so beleueth and is baptized, he shalbe saued.
column8: Who so Believeth and is baptised, he shall saved.

column7: <NOTE> Fourthly, Christ sheweth here what tokens shal folowe vpon them that beleue.
column8: Fourthly, christ shows Here what tokens shall follow upon them that believe.

column7: In my name (sayth Christe) they shall cast out deuils, they shall speake with newe tongues, take away serpentes &c.
column8: In my name (say Christ) they shall cast out Devils, they shall speak with new tongues, take away Serpents etc.

column7: As he would say: My worde is before the world a dispised worde, neither haue you whiche must preache it, as yet obtayned any authoritee afore men, so that they may receiue your preachyng and doctryne without myracles & signes, wherfore this wyll I do:
column8: As he would say: My word is before the world a despised word, neither have you which must preach it, as yet obtained any Authority afore men, so that they may receive your preaching and Doctrine without Miracles & Signs, Wherefore this will I do:

column7: I wyll geue you power to dryue out deuils, to speake with newe tonges, to heale the sycke &c.
column8: I will give you power to drive out Devils, to speak with new tongues, to heal the sick etc.

column7: And whosoeuer (that after your worde and doctrine shalbe by those tokens and sygnes confyrmed) wyll beleue you and be baptized, certaynly he shall obtayne remission of synnes, and life eternal.
column8: And whosoever (that After your word and Doctrine shall by those tokens and Signs confirmed) will believe you and be baptised, Certainly he shall obtain remission of Sins, and life Eternal.

column7: But whoso beleueth not, all excuses set a part, shal be damned.
column8: But whoso Believeth not, all excuses Set a part, shall be damned.

column7: Vpon this it necessarily foloweth, that myracles & sygnes were excedyng necessary at ye fyrst beginnyng to preache the gospel.
column8: Upon this it necessarily Followeth, that Miracles & Signs were exceeding necessary At you fyrst beginning to preach the gospel.

column7: For if any authoritee and power should be geuen to this dottryne, it was necessarye to establishe it and confirme it, with so excellent and noble myracles, lyke as the lawe also was before confyrmed by sygnes and myracles.
column8: For if any Authority and power should be given to this dottryne, it was necessary to establish it and confirm it, with so excellent and noble Miracles, like as the law also was before confirmed by Signs and Miracles.

column7: Notwithstandyng those sygnes wherby the lawe was confirmed, were farre more horrible then were the sygnes in the beginnyng of the Gospell.
column8: Notwithstanding those Signs whereby the law was confirmed, were Far more horrible then were the Signs in the beginning of the Gospel.

column7: For the sygnes that were wrought in the beginnyng of the gospel, were very pleasant, if you compare them to those sygnes that were shewed in the beginnyng of the lawe.
column8: For the Signs that were wrought in the beginning of the gospel, were very pleasant, if you compare them to those Signs that were showed in the beginning of the law.

column7: And the preachyng of the gospel also is farre more gladder tidynges & more comfortable to the heart, then is Moses with al his preceptes & lawes.
column8: And the preaching of the gospel also is Far more gladder tidings & more comfortable to the heart, then is Moses with all his Precepts & laws.

column7: Nowe in our tyme to requyre lyke myracles and sygnes, it is vnsittyng, vnreasonable and vnlawfull.
column8: Now in our time to require like Miracles and Signs, it is unfitting, unreasonable and unlawful.

column7: But if wee wyl so do,
column8: But if we will so do,

column7: Christ answereth and sayth: <NOTE> This aduouterous generacion seeketh a sygne, and other shall not be geuen to it, but the sygne of the prophet Ionas &c.
column8: christ Answers and say: This aduouterous generation seeks a Signen, and other shall not be given to it, but the Signen of the Prophet Jonah etc.

column7: For we haue the gospel of Christ confirmed with miracles and sygnes of the Apostles, and that sufficiently established, surely he that wyll not beleue it, can with no miracles nor sygnes be brought vnto the fayth.
column8: For we have the gospel of christ confirmed with Miracles and Signs of the Apostles, and that sufficiently established, surely he that will not believe it, can with no Miracles nor Signs be brought unto the faith.

column7: Fyftly, <NOTE> we haue in this gospell an article of oure fayth of the ascencion of Christ into heauen, with ye approue & confirmacion of the same.
column8: Fifthly, we have in this gospel an article of our faith of the Ascension of christ into heaven, with you approve & confirmation of the same.

column7: For thus sayth the texte:
column8: For thus say the text:

column7: And the Lorde after that he had spoken vnto them, he was taken vppe into heauen, and sitteth on the right hand of God &c.
column8: And the Lord After that he had spoken unto them, he was taken up into heaven, and Sitteth on the right hand of God etc.

column7: Hetherto Christ had preached and taught after that he was crucifyed and rysen agayn the thyrd daye from the dead, and truely after his resurrection he had muche a do with the incredulitee of his Apostles, to whom also at the last he shewed what he would theim to do.
column8: Hitherto christ had preached and taught After that he was Crucified and risen again the Third day from the dead, and truly After his resurrection he had much a do with the incredulity of his Apostles, to whom also At the last he showed what he would them to do.

column7: And after he had all this doone,
column8: And After he had all this done,

column7: <NOTE> he ascended into heauen, and sytteth on the right hand of God, that is, he taketh to himselfe a newe kyngdome, that he perpetually with his father beyng Lord on heauen and yearth, may and shal reigne in equal power wt God his father,
column8: he ascended into heaven, and Sitteth on the right hand of God, that is, he Takes to himself a new Kingdom, that he perpetually with his father being Lord on heaven and earth, may and shall Reign in equal power with God his father,

column7: <NOTE> for to conserue, gouerne, maintayn and defend, all that are his, from all euils.
column8: for to conserve, govern, maintain and defend, all that Are his, from all evils.

column7: For this to do, is to syt on the right hand of God.
column8: For this to do, is to fit on the right hand of God.

column7: Furthermore, lest his assencion into heauen should be without an euident vtilitee and profyte, he would sende from heauen his holy ghost, which might confirme his in the fayth, make them strong in all their troubles and persecucions, and defende & comfort them against their threttes that hated the word, euen as the Prophet did testifi,
column8: Furthermore, lest his Ascension into heaven should be without an evident utility and profit, he would send from heaven his holy ghost, which might confirm his in the faith, make them strong in all their Troubles and persecutions, and defend & Comfort them against their Treats that hated the word, even as the Prophet did testifi,

column7: <NOTE> saiyng: Hee ascended into the highth, and hath ledde captiuitee, capteiue and hath geuen gyftes to men.
column8: saying: He ascended into the highth, and hath led captivity, capteiue and hath given Gifts to men.

column7: Oh deare brethren is not this a mightie Lord, that hath coquered and deliuered vs from the captiuitee of Sathan,
column8: O deer brothers is not this a mighty Lord, that hath coquered and Delivered us from the captivity of Sathan,

column7: & hath geuen frely to vs his worde and spirit, and lastly by this meanes hath made vs the sonnes of God?
column8: & hath given freely to us his word and Spirit, and lastly by this means hath made us the Sons of God?

column7: Surely, he that wyll not beleue and put his confidence in this god and suche a Lorde, doubtlesse his vnbelif shal turne & brig him vnto perpetual dampnacion and losse bothe of body and soule.
column8: Surely, he that will not believe and put his confidence in this god and such a Lord, doubtless his unbelief shall turn & brig him unto perpetual damnation and loss both of body and soul.

column7: The whiche God vouchesafe to turne fro vs for his great infinite grace, through Iesu Christ our Lorde.
column8: The which God vouchsafe to turn from us for his great infinite grace, through Jesu christ our Lord.

column7: Amen. The gospel on the Monday after Witsondaye. Ioh. 3.
column8: Amen. The gospel on the Monday After Whitsunday. John 3.

column7: F Or God so loued the world, that he gaue his only begotten sonne, that whosoeuer beleueth in him, shoulde not perishe, but haue euerlasting life.
column8: FOr FOr God so loved the world, that he gave his only begotten son, that whosoever Believeth in him, should not perish, but have everlasting life.

column7: <NOTE> For God sent not his sonne into the world to condemn the worlde, but that the worlde through hym myght be saued.
column8: For God sent not his son into the world to condemn the world, but that the world through him might be saved.

column7: Hee that beleueth on hym, is not condemned.
column8: He that Believeth on him, is not condemned.

column7: But hee that beleueth not, is condemned already, bycause he hath not beleued in the name of the onlye begotten son of god.
column8: But he that Believeth not, is condemned already, Because he hath not believed in the name of the only begotten son of god.

column7: And thys is the codemnacio <NOTE> the lyght is come into the world, and men loued darkenes more then lyght, bycause their deedes were euel.
column8: And this is the codemnacio the Light is come into the world, and men loved darkness more then Light, Because their Deeds were evil.

column7: For <NOTE> euery one that euell dooeth, hateth the lyght, neither commeth to the lyght, least hys dedes shuld be reproued.
column8: For every one that evil doth, hates the Light, neither comes to the Light, lest his Deeds should be reproved.

column7: But he that doth truthe, commeth to the lyghte, that hys deedes maye bee knowen, howe they are wrought in God.
column8: But he that does truth, comes to the Light, that his Deeds may be known, how they Are wrought in God.

column7: After these thynges, came Iesus and hys disciples into the land of Iewrye, and there he taryed with them,
column8: After these things, Come jesus and his Disciples into the land of Jewry, and there he tarried with them,

column7: <NOTE> and baptized.
column8: and baptised.

column7: And Iohn also baptized in Enno besyds Salim, bicause ther was muche water there, and they came, and were baptized.
column8: And John also baptised in Enno besides Salim, Because there was much water there, and they Come, and were baptised.

column7: For Ihon was not yet put in pryson. THE EXPOSITION.
column8: For John was not yet put in prison. THE EXPOSITION.

column7: IN this gospell CHRIST setteth out highly,
column8: IN this gospel CHRIST sets out highly,

column7: <NOTE> that excedinge loue and charitye of oure heauenly father, that he euer hath borne vnto man k^nde.
column8: that exceeding love and charity of our heavenly father, that he ever hath born unto man k^nde.

column7: And this loue doth Christe so highly extoll and magnifye, that he affirmeth that loue to haue beene the chiefe principall and onlye cause wherfore hee wolde giue his onlye begotten sonne into this worlde.
column8: And this love does Christ so highly extol and magnify, that he Affirmeth that love to have been the chief principal and only cause Wherefore he would give his only begotten son into this world.

column7: Lette vs therefore with most herty attentio cosider this praise wherwith Christ setteth out the loue of his heauely father.
column8: Let us Therefore with most hearty attentio Consider this praise wherewith christ sets out the love of his heavily father.

column7: For in it we shal plainely perceiue, what moued god to redeme vs, and by whome he would worke our redemtion.
column8: For in it we shall plainly perceive, what moved god to Redeem us, and by whom he would work our redemption.

column7: And what moued the heauenly father to doo thys?
column8: And what moved the heavenly father to do this?

column7: Dyd men obtaine it with their good works?
column8: Did men obtain it with their good works?

column7: Or deserued they it by theyr honest conuersacion?
column8: Or deserved they it by their honest Conversation?

column7: Truly if that time that Christ came into to the worlde, he wold haue iudged men accordinge to their merites and workes, it was to be feared, least as it happein the tyme of Noe, he shulde haue drowned all the worlde with water, for doubteles, at that tyme ther were not very many good in al the world.
column8: Truly if that time that christ Come into to the world, he would have judged men according to their merits and works, it was to be feared, lest as it happein the time of Noah, he should have drowned all the world with water, for doubtless, At that time there were not very many good in all the world.

column7: For euen the Iewes which receiued the law & prophets, and therfore ought to haue been more holier and better then the other nacions, these (I say) were (a fewe except) more wretched and abhominable then anye other.
column8: For even the Jews which received the law & Prophets, and Therefore ought to have been more Holier and better then the other Nations, these (I say) were (a few except) more wretched and abominable then any other.

column7: Then needes must ther be a far other cause of our redemtio,
column8: Then needs must there be a Far other cause of our redemtio,

column7: <NOTE> then the merites of man.
column8: then the merits of man.

column7: What is it then? Christe answereth:
column8: What is it then? Christ Answers:

column7: God so loued the worlde.
column8: God so loved the world.

column7: Do not you heare now, that our redemtion dependeth and consisteth vpon mere loue, grace, compassion and mercy?
column8: Do not you hear now, that our redemption dependeth and Consisteth upon mere love, grace, compassion and mercy?

column7: And this loue ought well to styrre vs vp and to bringe vs to faithe.
column8: And this love ought well to stir us up and to bring us to faith.

column7: For if we wel consider and weye this loue in our hearts, it wil sufficiently teach vs, how high, ye vnspeakable it is.
column8: For if we well Consider and weye this love in our hearts, it will sufficiently teach us, how high, you unspeakable it is.

column7: For suerly we had deserued by vnbeliefe and our sinnes perpetual damnacio,
column8: For surely we had deserved by unbelief and our Sins perpetual damnacio,

column7: & god mought most rightfully haue shed vpon vs his terrible wrath, furor, and indignacion, and haue condemnd vs vnto perpetual danacion. but what dyd he?
column8: & god might most rightfully have shed upon us his terrible wrath, Furor, and Indignation, and have condemned us unto perpetual danacion. but what did he?

column7: So mighty nowe was not his wrathe, but his loue, that not only he saued vs fro destruction, but also made vs free & safe fro synne, death, dyuel and hell.
column8: So mighty now was not his wrath, but his love, that not only he saved us from destruction, but also made us free & safe from sin, death, Devil and hell.

column7: But howe did he this,
column8: But how did he this,

column7: or by what meane or mediator?
column8: or by what mean or Mediator?

column7: Wold he do this by his angels, or by any other mediator or mean?
column8: Wold he do this by his Angels, or by any other Mediator or mean?

column7: Nay verily: But to do this, he sent & gaue freely his only begotten son.
column8: Nay verily: But to do this, he sent & gave freely his only begotten son.

column7: Here againe that excedyng loue is glorified, which was the cause ye god would redeme vs.
column8: Here again that exceeding love is glorified, which was the cause you god would Redeem us

column7: For truely all that euer god giueth, that giueth he of grace, no merites goyng before.
column8: For truly all that ever god gives, that gives he of grace, no merits going before.

column7: With this agreeth the saying of S,
column8: With this agreeth the saying of S,

column7: Paul: If when we wer enemies we were recociled to god by ye death of his son much more now that we be reconcyled, we shalbe saued by his life.
column8: Paul: If when we were enemies we were recociled to god by you death of his son much more now that we be reconciled, we shall saved by his life.

column7: Here also in this saying the apostell cofesseth that god receiued vs of grace, ye when we were yet his enemies.
column8: Here also in this saying the apostle cofesseth that god received us of grace, you when we were yet his enemies.

column7: Finally, God hath deliuered vs from our sins & from hel,
column8: Finally, God hath Delivered us from our Sins & from hell,

column7: & hath giuen to vs eternall life by free grace & loue,
column8: & hath given to us Eternal life by free grace & love,

column7: & that hath he done by his beloued and only begotte sonne Iesus Christe.
column8: & that hath he done by his Beloved and only begotten son jesus Christ.

column7: Secondarily, althogh our saluacion be gotten & made perfect by Christ only, yet this must we learn to knowe, how men maye obtaine it.
column8: Secondarily, although our salvation be got & made perfect by christ only, yet this must we Learn to know, how men may obtain it.

column7: And thys also doth Christe manifestly shew in this gospell:
column8: And this also does Christ manifestly show in this gospel:

column7: That euery man (saith he) ye beleueth in him shuld not perishe, but shoulde haue lyfe eaternall.
column8: That every man (Says he) you Believeth in him should not perish, but should have life eaternall.

column7: You heare in these wordes, whether saluacion gotten by Christe, may be receiued by works, or apprehended by faith.
column8: You hear in these words, whither salvation got by Christ, may be received by works, or apprehended by faith.

column7: Without doubte, our workes do nothinge in this matter.
column8: Without doubt, our works do nothing in this matter.

column7: But here muste needes be a true faith, and an assured confidence and beliefe in god.
column8: But Here must needs be a true faith, and an assured confidence and belief in god.

column7: But whe is that beliefe and faithe trewe?
column8: But when is that belief and faith true?

column7: <NOTE> When we dispaire of all our workes, merites and vertues, and esteme them as thinges that can not helpe vs, and therefore the Prophete Esai sayeth:
column8: When we despair of all our works, merits and Virtues, and esteem them as things that can not help us, and Therefore the Prophet Isaiah Saith:

column7: <NOTE> that all oure iustyce or righteousnes are as a defyled clothe.
column8: that all our Justice or righteousness Are as a defiled cloth.

column7: And thus dispairyng of our selues to seke our righteousnes in the merytes, passion and death of oure Lord Iesu Christ onely, of whom Ihon the Baptist gaue this true testimonye, that he is the Lambe of God,
column8: And thus despairing of our selves to seek our righteousness in the merits, passion and death of our Lord Jesu christ only, of whom John the Baptist gave this true testimony, that he is the Lamb of God,

column7: <NOTE> that taketh away the synnes of the worlde.
column8: that Takes away the Sins of the world.

column7: This fayth I say, dothe apprehende by Christe remission of synnes, iustyce and eternal life.
column8: This faith I say, doth apprehend by Christ remission of Sins, Justice and Eternal life.

column7: Neither may we in this matter admyt any worke of man, except we would plucke away, steale & take fro Christ his glory,
column8: Neither may we in this matter admit any work of man, except we would pluck away, steal & take from christ his glory,

column7: <NOTE> whiche he wyl not geue to any other, and so stealyng Christes honor, burthen our soules vnto the perpetual death & damnacion of our selues.
column8: which he will not give to any other, and so stealing Christ's honour, burden our Souls unto the perpetual death & damnation of our selves.

column7: Surely it is an vndoubted trueth, that a christian man must do good workes, and haue an honest conuersacion, and with good workes confyrme & allow his fayth.
column8: Surely it is an undoubted truth, that a christian man must do good works, and have an honest Conversation, and with good works confirm & allow his faith.

column7: For who would deny this?
column8: For who would deny this?

column7: But to sette a fayth and confidence in those workes, and to admit our merytes in ye cause of our iustifycacion, is in no wyse to bee permytted.
column8: But to Set a faith and confidence in those works, and to admit our merits in you cause of our justification, is in no wise to be permitted.

column7: For by that meanes, grace were no grace, and that whiche before was atributed by verye right vnto the onely loue of God, that should we then ascrybe vnto our workes & merites.
column8: For by that means, grace were no grace, and that which before was attributed by very right unto the only love of God, that should we then ascribe unto our works & merits.

column7: Therfore Christ sayth in this gospell:
column8: Therefore christ say in this gospel:

column7: He that beleueth in the sonne of man, shal not be iudged.
column8: He that Believeth in the son of man, shall not be judged.

column7: But he that beleueth not, is already iudged, because he beleueth not in the name of the only begotten sone of God. <NOTE>
column8: But he that Believeth not, is already judged, Because he Believeth not in the name of the only begotten soon of God.

column7: See ye that in the conflicte and battayle of the conscience, fayth standeth sure, and is not condempned nor iudged?
column8: See you that in the conflict and battle of the conscience, faith Stands sure, and is not condemned nor judged?

column7: Contrarily, that vnbeliefe is already codempned,
column8: Contrarily, that unbelief is already codempned,

column7: & the sentece of eternal damnacion is pronouced against it?
column8: & the sentece of Eternal damnation is pronounced against it?

column7: For Christ wyl in this gospel (as he doth in many other places of the scripture) ascribe quietnesse of conscience and saluacion vnto faithe, and the disquietnes of conscience & perpetuall damnacion to vnbeliefe.
column8: For christ will in this gospel (as he does in many other places of the scripture) ascribe quietness of conscience and salvation unto faith, and the disquietness of conscience & perpetual damnation to unbelief.

column7: Thirdely, <NOTE> bicause Christe spake of iudgemente and condemnacio, he now procedeth and declareth what is condemnacio, and saith.
column8: Thirdly, Because Christ spoke of judgement and condemnacio, he now Proceedeth and Declareth what is condemnacio, and Says.

column7: And this is ye condemnacion, that the light is come into the world,
column8: And this is the condemnation, that the Light is come into the world,

column7: & men haue loued rather darkenes then lighte.
column8: & men have loved rather darkness then Light.

column7: And why? For bycause their workes were euell.
column8: And why? For Because their works were evil.

column7: Christe him self with his doctrine & gospel is this light,
column8: Christ him self with his Doctrine & gospel is this Light,

column7: <NOTE> as in another place he calleth himselfe, saying:
column8: as in Another place he calls himself, saying:

column7: I am the light of the world,
column8: I am the Light of the world,

column7: Whosoeuer foloweth me he walketh not in darknes.
column8: Whosoever Followeth me he walks not in darkness.

column7: The darknes, <NOTE> is our flesh, nature, mannes reason, and vnbeliefe, yea all the wisdome & prudencie of man, which doth not spring out of faith, but spring fro our reaso without faith.
column8: The darkness, is our Flesh, nature, Man's reason, and unbelief, yea all the Wisdom & prudency of man, which does not spring out of faith, but spring from our reason without faith.

column7: And now I beseche you to marke with me well, at what point our reason, our wisdome and prudence is wont to stumble at, if it folow not the very word of god as his capitaine and leader?
column8: And now I beseech you to mark with me well, At what point our reason, our Wisdom and prudence is wont to Stumble At, if it follow not the very word of god as his Captain and leader?

column7: Surely when Christ came into this world, he was more redyer to saue & help, then to condemn, nowithstanding that the father had giuen into his hand all iudgmente.
column8: Surely when christ Come into this world, he was more redyer to save & help, then to condemn, notwithstanding that the father had given into his hand all iudgmente.

column7: And truely the Iewes had wel eschaped this iudgement or eternall damnacion,
column8: And truly the Jews had well escaped this judgement or Eternal damnation,

column7: & had by faith obtayned health & saluation, if they wold haue receiued Christ which is the light of the world, and beleued his worde.
column8: & had by faith obtained health & salvation, if they would have received christ which is the Light of the world, and believed his word.

column7: But what doo they? They sette more by darknes then by lyght.
column8: But what do they? They Set more by darkness then by Light.

column7: <NOTE> And as Iohn saithe in the fyrst chap. of his gospel:
column8: And as John Saith in the fyrst chap. of his gospel:

column7: The light shined in darkenes,
column8: The Light shined in darkness,

column7: & the darknes comprehended it not.
column8: & the darkness comprehended it not.

column7: Ther was no faulte in the lyght, but a greate defaulte in the darkenes that receiued it not.
column8: There was no fault in the Light, but a great default in the darkness that received it not.

column7: But what foloweth nowe out of this darkenes?
column8: But what Followeth now out of this darkness?

column7: Forsoth this. Those that neither knowlege nor learne their darkenes, nor wyll not geue Christ his due honor, they iudge and condempne themselues, euen as Christe sayth:
column8: Forsooth this. Those that neither knowledge nor Learn their darkness, nor will not give christ his due honour, they judge and condemn themselves, even as Christ say:

column7: Whoso beleueth not, he is already condempned.
column8: Whoso Believeth not, he is already condemned.

column7: And truely it chauseth so by most rihgteous iudgement to him that is vnfaythfull.
column8: And truly it chauseth so by most rihgteous judgement to him that is unfaithful.

column7: <NOTE> For inasmuche as he doth euil, and yet can not abide the light or to be reprehended, it is right that his owne vnbeleife should iudge or condempne him.
column8: For inasmuch as he does evil, and yet can not abide the Light or to be reprehended, it is right that his own unbelief should judge or condemn him.

column7: But so is it not wt the faythful man, for he can abyde that his workes that are done in the truth, shuld come to the light & be tryed & wayed by the worde of God, and iudged by the rule & squire of the woorde of God.
column8: But so is it not with the faithful man, for he can abide that his works that Are done in the truth, should come to the Light & be tried & weighed by the word of God, and judged by the Rule & squire of the word of God.

column7: For how should he feare the light, seyng that all his workes are done in God?
column8: For how should he Fear the Light, sing that all his works Are done in God?

column7: Cosider it well: For thus in euery place of the scripture, life is ascribed vnto fayth, and iudgement and condempnacion to incredulitee and vnbeleife.
column8: Consider it well: For thus in every place of the scripture, life is ascribed unto faith, and judgement and condemnation to incredulity and unbelief.

column7: God geue vs grace to receiue & retayne with vs his light, to the comfort of our soules.
column8: God give us grace to receive & retain with us his Light, to the Comfort of our Souls.

column7: Amen. The gospel on the tewysday in the Whytson weke. Ihon. 10.
column8: Amen. The gospel on the tewysday in the Whitsun Week. John 10.

column7: V Erely, verely, I saye vnto you:
column8: Verily Verily, verily, I say unto you:

column7: He that entreth not in by the doore into the shepe fold, but clymeth vppe some other waye, the same is a thefe and a murtherer.
column8: He that entereth not in by the door into the sheep fold, but clymeth up Some other Way, the same is a thief and a murderer.

column7: But he that entreth in by the dore, is yt shepeherde of the shepe:
column8: But he that entereth in by the door, is that shepherd of the sheep:

column7: to him the porter openeth, and the shepe heare hys voyce, and <NOTE> hee calleth hys owne sheepe by name,
column8: to him the porter Openeth, and the sheep hear his voice, and he calls his own sheep by name,

column7: & leadeth them out. And when he hath sent forth hys owne sheep, he goeth before them,
column8: & leads them out. And when he hath sent forth his own sheep, he Goes before them,

column7: & the sheepe folowe hym, for they knowe his voyce.
column8: & the sheep follow him, for they know his voice.

column7: A straunger wyll they not folowe, but wyll flee from hym, for they knowe not the voyce of straungers.
column8: A stranger will they not follow, but will flee from him, for they know not the voice of Strangers.

column7: This prouerbe spake Iesus vnto them, but they vnderstode not what thinges they were, whiche he spake vnto them.
column8: This proverb spoke jesus unto them, but they understood not what things they were, which he spoke unto them.

column7: Then sayde Iesus vnto them agayne:
column8: Then said jesus unto them again:

column7: Verely verely, I say vnto you:
column8: Verily verily, I say unto you:

column7: <NOTE> I am the dore of the sheepe.
column8: I am the door of the sheep.

column7: All (euen as many as came before me) are theues & murtherers, but the sheep did not heare them.
column8: All (even as many as Come before me) Are thieves & murderers, but the sheep did not hear them.

column7: I am the dore, by me yf any man enter in, he shall be safe, and shall go in and out, and fynde pasture.
column8: I am the door, by me if any man enter in, he shall be safe, and shall go in and out, and find pasture.

column7: A thefe commeth not but for to steale, kyll and destroye.
column8: A thief comes not but for to steal, kill and destroy.

column7: I am come that they myght haue lyfe, and that they might haue it more aboundantlye. THE EXPOSITION.
column8: I am come that they might have life, and that they might have it more abundantly. THE EXPOSITION.

column7: F Orasmuche as Christ our Lord sheweth in this gospell or similitude by conferryng theim together, both what the euil shepeherd & teacher is, also howe he may bee knowen:
column8: Forasmuch Forasmuch as christ our Lord shows in this gospel or similitude by conferring them together, both what the evil shepherd & teacher is, also how he may be known:

column7: and on the other parte, what the good shepeherde and teacher is, and by what sygnes also menne may knowe him,
column8: and on the other part, what the good shepherd and teacher is, and by what Signs also men may know him,

column7: I thynke it mete fyrst to treate of the good shepeherde, especiall for this cause, that it is a thinge very profitable and necessary, and also a matter of great waight & importance.
column8: I think it meet fyrst to Treat of the good shepherd, especial for this cause, that it is a thing very profitable and necessary, and also a matter of great weight & importance.

column7: For Christ describeth here the good shepheard so,
column8: For christ Describeth Here the good shepherd so,

column7: <NOTE> that he must nedes entre in at ye dore into the shepefold. that is, it is necessary yt the preacher be called by some lawefull and godly meanes. it is necessary also, that his doctrine bee trewe and godly.
column8: that he must needs enter in At you door into the shepefold. that is, it is necessary that the preacher be called by Some lawful and godly means. it is necessary also, that his Doctrine be true and godly.

column7: And howe can they teache the trewth, that are not called vnto that office by god, or by some godly meanes?
column8: And how can they teach the truth, that Are not called unto that office by god, or by Some godly means?

column7: Surely in this matter it is not conuenient for euery man that will, to run, but it is necessary, that me enter by the dore into the shepfold.
column8: Surely in this matter it is not convenient for every man that will, to run, but it is necessary, that me enter by the door into the shepfold.

column7: And if thou wilt know who is the dore, then marke well Christes wordes, which thus expoundeth him selfe,
column8: And if thou wilt know who is the door, then mark well Christ's words, which thus expoundeth him self,

column7: <NOTE> saying:
column8: saying:

column7: I am the dore of the shepe, by me who so entreth, he shal be saued, and he shal entre in and go forthe, and he shall fynde pasture.
column8: I am the door of the sheep, by me who so entereth, he shall be saved, and he shall enter in and go forth, and he shall find pasture.

column7: Marke here that not only the preacher must be admitted to this office by Christe and a christian meane, but that the hearer also by lyke manner oughte to bee called to thys sheepefolde of the electe of God.
column8: Mark Here that not only the preacher must be admitted to this office by Christ and a christian mean, but that the hearer also by like manner ought to be called to this sheepefolde of the elect of God.

column7: And thys onlye standeth in the power of CHRIST, in his woorde and his gospell.
column8: And this only Stands in the power of CHRIST, in his word and his gospel.

column7: <NOTE> Saynct Paule was called frome heauen of Christe, vnto this office to teache the gospell withoute anye other meane, so that hee myghte entre at the trewe doore into the sheepefolde.
column8: Saint Paul was called from heaven of Christ, unto this office to teach the gospel without any other mean, so that he might enter At the true door into the sheepefolde.

column7: But God permytted the Apostell S.
column8: But God permitted the Apostle S.

column7: Mathye to bee called vnto the office to teache the worde of god,
column8: Matthew to be called unto the office to teach the word of god,

column7: <NOTE> by certayn other meanes, so that hee also shoulde enter by the trewe dore.
column8: by certain other means, so that he also should enter by the true door.

column7: And are not al men called vnto the fold of Christ by ye word of Christ, as often as thys or other lyke gospell is preached?
column8: And Are not all men called unto the fold of christ by the word of christ, as often as this or other like gospel is preached?

column7: Whosoeuer thirsteth, <NOTE> lette hym come to me and drynke?
column8: Whosoever Thirsteth, let him come to me and drink?

column7: Therefore, before all thinges thys is necessarye, that wee entre in at the dore into the sheepfolde, that is to say, by Christe.
column8: Therefore, before all things this is necessary, that we enter in At the door into the sheepfold, that is to say, by Christ.

column7: For if thys entrance be true and by faithful meanes done, doubtles it shal come to passe as Christ here saith:
column8: For if this Entrance be true and by faithful means done, doubtless it shall come to pass as christ Here Says:

column7: Whosoeuer entreth in by me, he shal be saued.
column8: Whosoever entereth in by me, he shall be saved.

column7: Heare ye not now, that our saluacion standeth only in the power of Christ?
column8: Hear you not now, that our salvation Stands only in the power of christ?

column7: And in like manner said he vnto his Apostles, whe they asked him the waye to ye father:
column8: And in like manner said he unto his Apostles, when they asked him the Way to you father:

column7: I am (said he) the way, the truth, and the life.
column8: I am (said he) the Way, the truth, and the life.

column7: Furthermore he that thus entreth by Christ, he must nedes by faith obtain and possesse al those goods and heuenly treasures, that the heuenly father hath giuen vnto vs in his son,
column8: Furthermore he that thus entereth by christ, he must needs by faith obtain and possess all those goods and heavenly treasures, that the heavenly father hath given unto us in his son,

column7: & so confesse it and with his mouth declare it vnto other in al places, the which thing Christ shewed vnder these words, coming in, and goyng forth.
column8: & so confess it and with his Mouth declare it unto other in all places, the which thing christ showed under these words, coming in, and going forth.

column7: Moreouer, They shal euer fynde pasture.
column8: Moreover, They shall ever find pasture.

column7: These pastures <NOTE> signify the word of god, ye Christe shulde largly giue vnto his disciples.
column8: These pastures signify the word of god, you Christ should largely give unto his Disciples.

column7: And whersoeuer this Word be, ther can not men codingly praise so great a benefite of god.
column8: And wheresoever this Word be, there can not men codingly praise so great a benefit of god.

column7: But where it is not, ther chanceth it according to the saying of the prophet Ioel:
column8: But where it is not, there chanceth it according to the saying of the Prophet Joel:

column7: Why doth the cattel morne?
column8: Why does the cattle morn?

column7: Why do the droues of beastes cry & rore?
column8: Why do the droves of beasts cry & roar?

column7: Bicause that they haue no pasture. yea euen the whole flocks of sheep haue perished.
column8: Because that they have no pasture. yea even the Whole flocks of sheep have perished.

column7: Out of all this it foloweth, that the good shepeherd that came in by Christ, must needs teache the word of Christ, and the righteousnes of faith by Christ.
column8: Out of all this it Followeth, that the good shepherd that Come in by christ, must needs teach the word of christ, and the righteousness of faith by christ.

column7: And suerly by this token and sygne a good shepeheard may well be knowen.
column8: And surely by this token and Signen a good shepherd may well be known.

column7: <NOTE> Secondarily, Christ in this gospel describeth the euil shepeherd, whom he so paynteth in his owne colours, that wee may well knowe him if wee wyll open our eyes to see him.
column8: Secondarily, christ in this gospel Describeth the evil shepherd, whom he so painteth in his own colours, that we may well know him if we will open our eyes to see him.

column7: For thus sayth Christ: He that entreth not in at the doore into the shepefolde, but clymeth vppe another way, he is a thefe and a murtherer.
column8: For thus say christ: He that entereth not in At the door into the shepefolde, but clymeth up Another Way, he is a thief and a murderer.

column7: We heard a lytle before, that Christe himself is the doore, and also the keper of the doore.
column8: We herd a little before, that Christ himself is the door, and also the keeper of the door.

column7: And surely where this Christe is vnknowen, let no man thynke to haue any enteraunce geuen him into this shepefold, let no man promyse himselfe their saluacion.
column8: And surely where this Christ is unknown, let no man think to have any Entrance given him into this shepefold, let no man promise himself their salvation.

column7: Briefely, there is no enteraunce in, nor goyng out, nor findyng of pasture, muche lesse shal wee haue there good shepeherdes or preachers of the woorde.
column8: Briefly, there is no Entrance in, nor going out, nor finding of pasture, much less shall we have there good shepherds or Preachers of the word.

column7: For howe shall that man teache Christen men, whiche himselfe was neuer made a Christian?
column8: For how shall that man teach christian men, which himself was never made a Christian?

column7: Or howe should he in preachyng cotynually declare vnto the people the iustice of fayth, that as yet neuer, not so muche as ones, tasted it?
column8: Or how should he in preaching cotynually declare unto the people the Justice of faith, that as yet never, not so much as ones, tasted it?

column7: <NOTE> Surely where suche are, there canne be founde nothyng but stealyng and murtheryng.
column8: Surely where such Are, there can be found nothing but stealing and murdering.

column7: For they steale from Christ his owne due honor, in that they ascrybe to the merytes of woorkes, righteousnes, where as it onely commeth by the merytes of Iesu Christe.
column8: For they steal from christ his own due honour, in that they ascribe to the merits of works, righteousness, where as it only comes by the merits of Jesu Christ.

column7: And vpon this theft commeth that horrible murther, that is, by their false and wicked doctryne they leade fro Christ so great a nombre of soules, rauishyng them violetly into condempnacion, and castyng them into Sathans mouth to deuour them.
column8: And upon this theft comes that horrible murder, that is, by their false and wicked Doctrine they lead from christ so great a number of Souls, ravishing them violetly into condemnation, and casting them into Satan's Mouth to devour them.

column7: Oh alacke, what an exceadyng nombre of soules hath been by this doctryne deceyued bothe before the incarnacion of Christ, and also synce, and so cast headlong into condempnacion?
column8: O alack, what an exceeding number of Souls hath been by this Doctrine deceived both before the incarnation of christ, and also since, and so cast headlong into condemnation?

column7: Among the Iewes, this dyd the Byshoppes,
column8: Among the Jews, this did the Bishops,

column7: Priests, Scribes and Phariseys, whiche would vtterly oppresse the righteousnes of fayth, and in the place of it set vppe the righteousnes of woorkes.
column8: Priests, Scribes and Pharisees, which would utterly oppress the righteousness of faith, and in the place of it Set up the righteousness of works.

column7: Yea, they so sore preuayled in this doctryne, that all the Prophetes had enough to do to dispute and resyst their doctrine, in somuche that many tymes the Prophetes suffered no lytle persecucion for resystyng it, lyke as Christe himselfe in the gospel of sainct Mathew reproueth them for it, saiyng:
column8: Yea, they so soar prevailed in this Doctrine, that all the prophets had enough to do to dispute and resist their Doctrine, in So much that many times the prophets suffered no little persecution for resisting it, like as Christ himself in the gospel of saint Matthew Reproveth them for it, saying:

column7: <NOTE> Beholde I sende vnto you prophetes and wyse menne, and Scribes, and some of them shall ye murther & crucifye &c.
column8: Behold I send unto you Prophets and wise men, and Scribes, and Some of them shall you murder & crucify etc.

column7: But among christen men the same parte was played by the religious fathers, that boosted them self to be the children of the Romishe byshop.
column8: But among christian men the same part was played by the religious Father's, that boosted them self to be the children of the Romish bishop.

column7: For whiche of theim all (if you except very fewe) can be found that preached the righteousnes of fayth so diligently and earnestly, as it became him?
column8: For which of them all (if you except very few) can be found that preached the righteousness of faith so diligently and earnestly, as it became him?

column7: Doubtles they all had an eye vnto theyr father the Byshop of Rome, and neither by teachyng nor preachyng sought they any other pasture, or shewed any other to their shepe then that whiche the Prophete Hieremye speaketh of, saiyng:
column8: Doubtless they all had an eye unto their father the Bishop of Room, and neither by teaching nor preaching sought they any other pasture, or showed any other to their sheep then that which the Prophet Jeremiah speaks of, saying:

column7: Woo to the shepeherdes of Israel,
column8: Woo to the shepherds of Israel,

column7: <NOTE> that feade them selues &c.
column8: that feade them selves etc.

column7: Nowe if thou wylte knowe these theues and murtherers, marke their doctryn.
column8: Now if thou wilt know these thieves and murderers, mark their Doctrine.

column7: For whosoeuer they bee that sette vppe rihgteousnes by the merytes and deseruynges of woorkes, and contrary to Christes merytes earnestly preache the same, those are they that Christe descrybeth in this place, and whom also he commaundeth vs to beware of Mathew. 7.
column8: For whosoever they be that Set up rihgteousnes by the merits and deservings of works, and contrary to Christ's merits earnestly preach the same, those Are they that Christ Describeth in this place, and whom also he commandeth us to beware of Matthew. 7.

column7: Thyrdly, because Christ hath now described the good shepeherdes & the euil, he nowe sheweth howe christen men must behaue themselfe towardes them both, that is,
column8: Thirdly, Because christ hath now described the good shepherds & the evil, he now shows how christian men must behave themselves towards them both, that is,

column7: They must heare the voyce & doctrine of this good shepeherde, to whom the keaper of the doore hath opened the doore, and they must knowe his voyce and folowe him,
column8: They must hear the voice & Doctrine of this good shepherd, to whom the keaper of the door hath opened the door, and they must know his voice and follow him,

column7: <NOTE> if he go before &c.
column8: if he go before etc.

column7: But howe shall this come to passe, that the shepe shall so readyly knowe the voyce of the good shepeherde?
column8: But how shall this come to pass, that the sheep shall so readily know the voice of the good shepherd?

column7: They are accustomed to the good and healthsome pastures, that is, they haue ones learned out of the holy gospels, that in terrours of conscience & knowlege of synnes, there is none other consolacion, but in the onely merytes of Christ.
column8: They Are accustomed to the good and healthsome pastures, that is, they have ones learned out of the holy gospels, that in terrors of conscience & knowledge of Sins, there is none other consolation, but in the only merits of christ.

column7: And that those only be partakers of it, that take hold of it by fayth, and so turne it vnto their owne profite.
column8: And that those only be partakers of it, that take hold of it by faith, and so turn it unto their own profit.

column7: And forasmuche as when the good shepeherde commeth, he leadeth them no waye, but vnto Christe.
column8: And forasmuch as when the good shepherd comes, he leads them not Way, but unto Christ.

column7: They knowe also that they are bound to receyue him as a minister of the worde, as Christ testifyeth in another place, saiyng:
column8: They know also that they Are bound to receive him as a minister of the word, as christ Testifieth in Another place, saying:

column7: <NOTE> He that receyueth you, receyueth me.
column8: He that receiveth you, receiveth me.

column7: And in another place, when the thefe and murtherer commeth with his false doctryne, preachyng another straunge doctryne that floweth not out of the fayth of Christ, then can they by the worde of God know, iudge, and reproue that doctryne,
column8: And in Another place, when the thief and murderer comes with his false Doctrine, preaching Another strange Doctrine that flows not out of the faith of christ, then can they by the word of God know, judge, and reprove that Doctrine,

column7: & wyll in no wyse receiue nor admit nor heare that false prophet in the steade of a true Prophete of God.
column8: & will in no wise receive nor admit nor hear that false Prophet in the stead of a true Prophet of God.

column7: For they knowe perfectly that Christe sayeth, that he that heareth & kepeth the worde of God (I say the woorde of God) he shalbe saued.
column8: For they know perfectly that Christ Saith, that he that hears & Keepeth the word of God (I say the word of God) he shall saved.

column7: <NOTE> And what nedeth many woordes?
column8: And what needeth many words?

column7: Doth not the scriptures euery where admonish vs to beware of such theues and murtherers?
column8: Does not the Scriptures every where admonish us to beware of such thieves and murderers?

column7: Beware (sayth Christ) of false prophetes, that comme to you in shepes clothing, but inwardly thei are rauening Wolfes.
column8: Beware (say christ) of false Prophets, that comme to you in Sheep clothing, but inwardly they Are ravening Wolves.

column7: And sainct Paule forbyddeth the Galathians, that they admit none other gospel then that they heard of him, insomuch that if an Angel shuld come doune from heauen & preache another gospel they ought not to receiue him.
column8: And saint Paul forbiddeth the Galatians, that they admit none other gospel then that they herd of him, insomuch that if an Angel should come down from heaven & preach Another gospel they ought not to receive him.

column7: The shepe of Christ knowe all this, wherfore they wyl heare none other but their owne hyghest byshop & shepeherd Christ, whiche here sayth:
column8: The sheep of christ know all this, Wherefore they will hear none other but their own highest bishop & shepherd christ, which Here say:

column7: I am come that they maye haue life, yea and haue it more aboundantly.
column8: I am come that they may have life, yea and have it more abundantly.

column7: Furthermore, they heare all ye ministers of Christ, that come in his name & bryng his worde.
column8: Furthermore, they hear all you Ministers of christ, that come in his name & bring his word.

column7: The other worke-doctors they do forsake, cosideryng they are theues and murtherers,
column8: The other worke-doctors they do forsake, cosideryng they Are thieves and murderers,

column7: & suche as treate the worde of God both falsely and vngodly.
column8: & such as Treat the word of God both falsely and ungodly.

column7: Wherfore Christ sayth: They shal not folowe ye forreyner or strange shepeherd, but they wyll flee fro him, for they knowe not the voyce of straungers.
column8: Wherefore christ say: They shall not follow you forreyner or strange shepherd, but they will flee from him, for they know not the voice of Strangers.

column7: Whiche God graunt that we may also acknowlege Christ our sheherde and folowe his worde. Amen.
column8: Which God grant that we may also acknowledge christ our sheherde and follow his word. Amen.

column7: The sermon on sainct Barnabas the Apostles day, is the same that is red on Symon and Iudes day.
column8: The sermon on saint Barnabas the Apostles day, is the same that is read on Symon and Jude's day.

column7: The gospell on sainct Iohn the Baptystes daye. Luc. 1.
column8: The gospel on saint John the Baptist day. Luke 1.

column7: Woodcut illustration of St. John the Baptist with a cross (held like a military standard) and lamb.
column8: Woodcut illustration of Saint John the Baptist with a cross (held like a military standard) and lamb.

column7: E Lyzabeths time came that she shuld be delyuered, and she brought forth a sonne.
column8: Elizabeth Elizabeth time Come that she should be Delivered, and she brought forth a son.

column7: And her neighbours & her cosyns hearde howe the lorde had shewed greate mercye vpon hyr, and they reioysed wyth her. <NOTE>
column8: And her neighbours & her cousin's heard how the lord had showed great mercy upon her, and they rejoiced with her.

column7: And it fortuned that in the eyght day they came to circumcise the chylde:
column8: And it fortuned that in the eyght day they Come to circumcise the child:

column7: and called his name Zacharias, after the name of his father.
column8: and called his name Zacharias, After the name of his father.

column7: And his mother answered and sayde:
column8: And his mother answered and said:

column7: Not so, but he shal be called Iohn.
column8: Not so, but he shall be called John.

column7: And they sayde vnto her:
column8: And they said unto her:

column7: There is none in thy kyndred, that is named with thys name.
column8: There is none in thy kindred, that is nam with this name.

column7: And they made signes to hys father,, howe he would haue him called.
column8: And they made Signs to his father,, how he would have him called.

column7: And he asked for writing tables, and wrote, saying:
column8: And he asked for writing tables, and wrote, saying:

column7: His name is Iohn. And they meruayled all.
column8: His name is John. And they marveled all.

column7: And his mouthe was opened immediatly, and his tongue also, and he spake and praysed God.
column8: And his Mouth was opened immediately, and his tongue also, and he spoke and praised God.

column7: And fear came on al them ye dwelt nye vnto them.
column8: And Fear Come on all them you dwelled High unto them.

column7: And all these sayinges were noysed abroade thorowe out all the hyll countrey of Iurye:
column8: And all these sayings were noised abroad thorough out all the hill country of Jury:

column7: and all they that hearde them, layed theym vp in their heartes, saying:
column8: and all they that heard them, laid them up in their hearts, saying:

column7: What manner of chyld shal this be?
column8: What manner of child shall this be?

column7: And the hande of the Lorde was with him.
column8: And the hand of the Lord was with him.

column7: And hys father zacharias was fylled wyth the holy ghoste, & prophecyed, saying:
column8: And his father zacharias was filled with the holy ghost, & prophesied, saying:

column7: Praysed be the lorde god of Israel, for he hathe visited and redemed his people. THE EXPOSITION.
column8: Praised be the lord god of Israel, for he hath visited and redeemed his people. THE EXPOSITION.

column7: S Eyng (deere christians) that the Euangeliste S.
column8: Sing Sing (deer Christians) that the Evangelist S.

column7: Luke hathe doone suche diligence in describing the natiuiti of Iohn the Baptist as it is plainly manifest in the gospell that this daye is recyted, it shall be necessary that we diligently consider and well loke vpon the person of Iohn.
column8: Lycia hath done such diligence in describing the natiuiti of John the Baptist as it is plainly manifest in the gospel that this day is recited, it shall be necessary that we diligently Consider and well look upon the person of John.

column7: For surely this childe (in whose byrthe those so great and glorious tokens chaunsed) hath some syngular grace & gyft aboue other children.
column8: For surely this child (in whose birth those so great and glorious tokens chanced) hath Some singular grace & gift above other children.

column7: <NOTE> Is not this a new and a syngular great thyng, that he is borne of paretes very olde, yea in maner at the pyttes brynke with age,
column8: Is not this a new and a singular great thing, that he is born of paretes very old, yea in manner At the pits brink with age,

column7: & is sanctifyed in his mothers wombe, and ordayned to be the foreleaper, that is, a gentlema vssher vnto our Lord God Iesu Christ?
column8: & is sanctified in his mother's womb, and ordained to be the foreleaper, that is, a Gentleman usher unto our Lord God Jesu christ?

column7: He shalbe (sayd the Angel, when he declared his byrth vnto Zacharye his father, what tyme he dyd his priestly offyce afore God) great before the Lorde.
column8: He shall (said the Angel, when he declared his birth unto Zacharye his father, what time he did his priestly office afore God) great before the Lord.

column7: Wyne and strong drynke shal he not drinke,
column8: Wine and strong drink shall he not drink,

column7: & euen from his mothers wombe shal he be fylled with the holy ghost,
column8: & even from his mother's womb shall he be filled with the holy ghost,

column7: & many of ye children of Israel shal he turne agayne wholly vnto the Lord theyr God &c.
column8: & many of you children of Israel shall he turn again wholly unto the Lord their God etc.

column7: By these wordes you heare, that great excellent and wonderful thynges shalbe brought to passe and accomplyshed by this chylde.
column8: By these words you hear, that great excellent and wondered things shall brought to pass and accomplished by this child.

column7: Furthermore, Zacharye thus reioyseth in his canticle, saiyng:
column8: Furthermore, Zacharye thus Rejoiceth in his canticle, saying:

column7: And thou O babe shalt be called a prophet of the most highest,
column8: And thou Oh babe shalt be called a Prophet of the most highest,

column7: For thou shalt go before the face of the Lord, to prepare his waies &c.
column8: For thou shalt go before the face of the Lord, to prepare his ways etc.

column7: What thynke you was this holy childe afterward? <NOTE> He was made a true, godly and excellent preacher, whiche besydes that moost holy life that he altogether spent in godly and honest conuersacion, he so administered and fulfylled his office, that he may well be sette furth to all preachers and ministers of Gods worde, as a worthy ensample & president, contynually to be present and sette before them.
column8: What think you was this holy child afterwards? He was made a true, godly and excellent preacher, which besides that most holy life that he altogether spent in godly and honest Conversation, he so administered and fulfilled his office, that he may well be Set forth to all Preachers and Ministers of God's word, as a worthy ensample & president, continually to be present and Set before them.

column7: For he not only preached penaunce, and by preachyng the law prepared a way vnto Christ, but also he shewed vnto the people Christ, whiche is moost truely that Lambe of God, that taketh away the synnes of the whole worlde.
column8: For he not only preached penance, and by preaching the law prepared a Way unto christ, but also he showed unto the people christ, which is most truly that Lamb of God, that Takes away the Sins of the Whole world.

column7: As also the holy ghoste sayeth againe by Zacharye:
column8: As also the holy ghost Saith again by Zacharye:

column7: To geue knowlege vnto his people.
column8: To give knowledge unto his people.

column7: But what knowlege? Knowlege of saluacion or health.
column8: But what knowledge? Knowledge of salvation or health.

column7: For thereto serueth the preachyng of Iohn, whiche firste through the lawe feareth the consciences, and afterward comforteth them & rayseth them vp by preachyng vnto them the lambe of god.
column8: For thereto serveth the preaching of John, which First through the law fears the Consciences, and afterwards comforts them & raises them up by preaching unto them the lamb of god.

column7: Wherein then resteth this knowlege?
column8: Wherein then rests this knowledge?

column7: In the forgeuenes of synnes.
column8: In the forgiveness of Sins.

column7: Howe then obtayne we that remission of synnes?
column8: Howe then obtain we that remission of Sins?

column7: By the bowels of mercy of our Lord god, wherein the day starre (Christ) hath visited vs from heauen.
column8: By the bowels of mercy of our Lord god, wherein the day star (christ) hath visited us from heaven.

column7: And to who hath he appeared by that so great mercy?
column8: And to who hath he appeared by that so great mercy?

column7: To those that sytte in darkenes and in the shadowe of death, aswell the Iewes as Gentyles.
column8: To those that fit in darkness and in the shadow of death, aswell the Jews as Gentiles.

column7: <NOTE> For Christ would as our archcbishop and true shepeherd make one flocke & one shepefold of the Iewes and Heathen, that the feare of al men (if at the least they would receyue the daye starre or day spryng of the gospel and beleife in Christe) that theyr feet (I say) might be set straight into the way of peace, whiche procedeth of true fayth.
column8: For christ would as our archcbishop and true shepherd make one flock & one shepefold of the Jews and Heathen, that the Fear of all men (if At the least they would receive the day star or day spring of the gospel and belief in Christ) that their feet (I say) might be Set straight into the Way of peace, which Proceedeth of true faith.

column7: Beholde, all these thynges appertayne to the office of Ihon, whiche was not only a preacher and a prophet, but also he was more then a prophete.
column8: Behold, all these things appertain to the office of John, which was not only a preacher and a Prophet, but also he was more then a Prophet.

column7: <NOTE> For he preached not only Christ to come, as other prophetes did, but also he shewed Christ present.
column8: For he preached not only christ to come, as other Prophets did, but also he showed christ present.

column7: And forasmuche as Ihon should thus shewe Christ, whiche by his preachyng, passion, death and resurrection should take away all our sorowes & sickenesses, it was nedefull that great ioy should happen in his natiuite.
column8: And forasmuch as John should thus show christ, which by his preaching, passion, death and resurrection should take away all our sorrows & Sicknesses, it was needful that great joy should happen in his Nativity.

column7: For and by assone as this childe was borne, al ye neighbours and kynsfolke did reioyce with the parentes of ye child:
column8: For and by As soon as this child was born, all you neighbours and kynsfolke did rejoice with the Parents of the child:

column7: and vpon the eyght day they circumcised the chyld, and at the fathers commaundement and writyng, they gaue him a name of grace and mercy, and this fame is spredde abrode among all theim that dwelt in the Mountaynes of Iewrye, and all that did heare it, layde it in their heartes, cofessyng that the hande of the Lorde, that is,
column8: and upon the eyght day they circumcised the child, and At the Father's Commandment and writing, they gave him a name of grace and mercy, and this fame is spread abroad among all them that dwelled in the Mountains of Jewry, and all that did hear it, laid it in their hearts, cofessyng that the hand of the Lord, that is,

column7: <NOTE> the power and helpe of God was with him.
column8: the power and help of God was with him.

column7: Lo, thus muste men consider Ihon, to knowe howe highly he is to bee estemed.
column8: Lo, thus must men Consider John, to know how highly he is to be esteemed.

column7: Secondarily, in this gospell fayth maketh Zachary to speake, whiche a lytle before, throughe his incredulitee was domme.
column8: Secondarily, in this gospel faith makes Zachary to speak, which a little before, through his incredulity was domme.

column7: And lyke as in this wee see howe great a synne vnbeleife is, euen so on the other part wee perceyue, howe precious and godly a treasure fayth is.
column8: And like as in this we see how great a sin unbelief is, even so on the other part we perceive, how precious and godly a treasure faith is.

column7: The Angel of God sayd vnto zacharye:
column8: The Angel of God said unto Zachary:

column7: Thy wyfe Elizabeth shall beare vnto thee a sonne.
column8: Thy wife Elizabeth shall bear unto thee a son.

column7: To these wordes ought zacharias to haue geuen credite.
column8: To these words ought zacharias to have given credit.

column7: But what doth he? Because he was aged and his wyfe well gone in age also, therfore he wyll or he geue credite, knowe howe these thynges shalbe fulfylled, therefore he is compelled to silence, tyl those thinges were fulfylled that were promised vnto him by the Angel.
column8: But what does he? Because he was aged and his wife well gone in age also, Therefore he will or he give credit, know how these things shall fulfilled, Therefore he is compelled to silence, till those things were fulfilled that were promised unto him by the Angel.

column7: And in lyke maner, vnto this day are all they stryken dumme,
column8: And in like manner, unto this day Are all they stricken dumb,

column7: <NOTE> that wyll not beleue the Apostles of God, his worde and the Gospell.
column8: that will not believe the Apostles of God, his word and the Gospel.

column7: For where as it were their duetye to aduaunce the glory of God & the meryte of Christe, and to set furth the same, there they extoll the righteousnes of their own works, as that Pharisei did. Luc. 17 God (said he) I thank the:
column8: For where as it were their duty to advance the glory of God & the merit of Christ, and to Set forth the same, there they extol the righteousness of their own works, as that Pharisees did. Luke 17 God (said he) I thank thee:

column7: For I am not as the residue of menne, extorcioners, vnrighteous, aduouterers, nor yet as this Publycane.
column8: For I am not as the residue of men, extortioners, unrighteous, aduouterers, nor yet as this Publican.

column7: Call yee this to laude and glorifie the grace of god, and merite of Christ?
column8: Call ye this to laud and Glorify the grace of god, and merit of christ?

column7: Naye truly. Thus to boast, is worse then to bee dumme.
column8: Nay truly. Thus to boast, is Worse then to be dumb.

column7: For thoughe in this prayer are heard many wordes, yet is ther not one heard, that seteth vp or magnifieth the grace of god or merite of Christe.
column8: For though in this prayer Are herd many words, yet is there not one herd, that seateth up or magnifieth the grace of god or merit of Christ.

column7: Nowe thoughe I can speake and vtter many woordes, yet as longe as vnbeliefe (that taketh away the glory of god) raigneth in my heart,
column8: Now though I can speak and utter many words, yet as long as unbelief (that Takes away the glory of god) Reigneth in my heart,

column7: I remaine dombe afore god:
column8: I remain dumb afore god:

column7: as the scripture saith: Wysdome hathe opened the mouthe of the dombe. that is to say:
column8: as the scripture Says: Wisdom hath opened the Mouth of the dumb. that is to say:

column7: The knowledge of god maketh men eloquent, that they knowe how to gyue god his honoure in Christ, to praise and glorifie him, and fynally to confesse his worde.
column8: The knowledge of god makes men eloquent, that they know how to gyve god his honour in christ, to praise and Glorify him, and finally to confess his word.

column7: Suche an eloquent Orator was Paul made when he compared his own iustice that he had in the lord vnto myre and dong, that by it he might suffre no dammage in that righteousnes whiche Christe hath brought and giueth to the beleuers.
column8: Suche an eloquent Orator was Paul made when he compared his own Justice that he had in the lord unto mire and dung, that by it he might suffer no damage in that righteousness which Christ hath brought and gives to the believers.

column7: And such an eloquet preacher was Zacharias, after that the tyme apointed by the angel, was fulfilled.
column8: And such an eloquet preacher was Zacharias, After that the time appointed by the angel, was fulfilled.

column7: For by and by after the circumcision of his sonne Iohn, he was fylled with the holy ghost, and prophecyed, praisyng god, that had giuen that greate grace vnto him.
column8: For by and by After the circumcision of his son John, he was filled with the holy ghost, and prophesied, praising god, that had given that great grace unto him.

column7: Therfore I saye, where faith and the holy ghost are not, there muste we needes be dum spiritually, yea though we speak many vayne and voide wordes.
column8: Therefore I say, where faith and the holy ghost Are not, there must we needs be dum spiritually, yea though we speak many vain and void words.

column7: Thirdely, the Euangelist heere describeth worde for worde, what Zacharias sayd whe he was fylled with the holy ghost, and why he so earnestly praised and glorified the Lord his God. For thus he sayd:
column8: Thirdly, the Evangelist Here Describeth word for word, what Zacharias said when he was filled with the holy ghost, and why he so earnestly praised and glorified the Lord his God. For thus he said:

column7: Blessed be the Lord God of Israel.
column8: Blessed be the Lord God of Israel.

column7: To blesse <NOTE> in this place is asmuche as to laude.
column8: To bless in this place is asmuch as to laud.

column7: For nowe in as muche as zacharias had receyued ye child promised to him,
column8: For now in as much as zacharias had received you child promised to him,

column7: & also he knewe in spirit what Christe shuld do, whose waye this chylde should make ready, he praiseth God for that so great and excellent a benefyte:
column8: & also he knew in Spirit what Christ should do, whose Way this child should make ready, he Praiseth God for that so great and excellent a benefit:

column7: Geuyng vs an ensample, that wee euermore should thanke & prayse God for those his benefites geuen to vs, both corporal and also spiritual.
column8: Giving us an ensample, that we evermore should thank & praise God for those his benefits given to us, both corporal and also spiritual.

column7: Now if ye be desirous to heare the cause of this praisyng God of zachary himself.
column8: Now if you be desirous to hear the cause of this praising God of Zachary himself.

column7: For he (sayth he) hath visited and wrought the redempcion of his people.
column8: For he (say he) hath visited and wrought the redemption of his people.

column7: This woorde Visite, <NOTE> is in the scriptures taken two maner of wayes.
column8: This word Visit, is in the Scriptures taken two manner of ways.

column7: For sometyme God visiteth vs in his wrath & furor, as when he punisheth our sinnes as it chaunsed Pharao in the red sea, and ye Iewes in the tyme of Tytus and Vespasian the Emperor.
column8: For sometime God Visiteth us in his wrath & Furor, as when he Punisheth our Sins as it chanced Pharaoh in the read sea, and you Jews in the time of Titus and Vespasian the Emperor.

column7: Many tymes he visiteth vs in mercy and grace, as it happened to the Iewes when they were brought out of Egypt, also when Christ was sent and geue, of the whiche visitacion Christ himselfe speaketh & complayneth,
column8: Many times he Visiteth us in mercy and grace, as it happened to the Jews when they were brought out of Egypt, also when christ was sent and give, of the which Visitation christ himself speaks & Complaineth,

column7: <NOTE> because they knewe not the tyme of their visitacion.
column8: Because they knew not the time of their Visitation.

column7: And of this mercyfull visitacion dothe zacharias speake in this place, saiyng that God hath visited and wrought the redempcion of his people.
column8: And of this merciful Visitation doth zacharias speak in this place, saying that God hath visited and wrought the redemption of his people.

column7: He knowlegeth also and estemeth this redempcion so certayne & sure, that he proclaymeth and laudeth it as done already wher in dede it was as then yet to be done in tyme commyng.
column8: He knowledgeth also and esteemeth this redemption so certain & sure, that he proclaimeth and laudeth it as done already where in deed it was as then yet to be done in time coming.

column7: And to this apertayneth ye foloweth in this caticle.
column8: And to this appertaineth you Followeth in this caticle.

column7: And he hath set vp vnto vs an horne of health, in ye house of Dauid his seruat.
column8: And he hath Set up unto us an horn of health, in the house of David his seruat.

column7: An horne in scripture <NOTE> is taken for the power & dominion.
column8: an horn in scripture is taken for the power & dominion.

column7: As zacharias would say: The corporal kyngdome nowe hath his ende nowe appointed,
column8: As zacharias would say: The corporal Kingdom now hath his end now appointed,

column7: & the septer is taken fro ye tribe of Iuda,
column8: & the scepter is taken from you tribe of Juda,

column7: But be of good cofort, we shall nowe be better then euer we were.
column8: But be of good Comfort, we shall now be better then ever we were.

column7: For why, we shall haue a newe kyng, whiche in dede was promised vs long agoo, whiche shal set vp a kyngdom, not corporal, wherin he may reigne wt outward power, but a kyngdome of helth and eternal lyfe, accordyng to the promyse so many thousand yeres promised to the Patriarkes & vnto Dauid.
column8: For why, we shall have a new King, which in deed was promised us long ago, which shall Set up a Kingdom, not corporal, wherein he may Reign with outward power, but a Kingdom of health and Eternal life, according to the promise so many thousand Years promised to the Patriarchs & unto David.

column7: For doubtles, whosoeuer shall beleue in this kyng,
column8: For doubtless, whosoever shall believe in this King,

column7: & kepe his word, he shal assuredly obtain this helth.
column8: & keep his word, he shall assuredly obtain this health.

column7: Now who could doubt in this?
column8: Now who could doubt in this?

column7: Dyd not God in tymes past speake these wordes by ye mouth of the Prophetes? <NOTE>
column8: Did not God in times passed speak these words by you Mouth of the prophets?

column7: Dyd not he promyse the same by the Patriarches?
column8: Did not he promise the same by the Patriarchs?

column7: Notwithstadyng there shall ryse debate & discencion betwene this kyng & the world.
column8: Notwithstanding there shall rise debate & dissension between this King & the world.

column7: For surely he wyll geue sentece, that all suche thynges as the world estemeth right & good, be vnrighteous, and by his worde he wyll cast away all their holynes, wysedome & vertues, and codempne them.
column8: For surely he will give sentece, that all such things as the world esteemeth right & good, be unrighteous, and by his word he will cast away all their holiness, Wisdom & Virtues, and codempne them.

column7: And here out shal begyn this stryfe with contynuance, but yet so, that at ye conclusion the victory shal be Christes, not alonly for his owne commoditee or profite, but muche rather for al those that beleue in him.
column8: And Here out shall begin this strife with Continuance, but yet so, that At you conclusion the victory shall be Christ's, not alonely for his own commodity or profit, but much rather for all those that believe in him.

column7: If thou desyrest to knowe what he shall do:
column8: If thou Desirest to know what he shall do:

column7: He shal deliuer vs from our enemyes, and from the handes of all them that hated vs.
column8: He shall deliver us from our enemies, and from the hands of all them that hated us

column7: Furthermore he wyll shewe vs the waye, whiche when we entre into we shall not dispayre of mercye for our sinnes:
column8: Furthermore he will show us the Way, which when we enter into we shall not despair of mercy for our Sins:

column7: for he wyll remembre that faithfull othe, that he sware to Abraham oure father.
column8: for he will Remember that faithful other, that he sware to Abraham our father.

column7: Briefely by his owne merites of mere grace without deseruinge of our workes, he will make vs righteous, godly and blessed:
column8: Briefly by his own merits of mere grace without deserving of our works, he will make us righteous, godly and blessed:

column7: so that we beyng delyuered from the handes of our enemies, may serue him all the dayes of oure lyfe:
column8: so that we being Delivered from the hands of our enemies, may serve him all the days of our life:

column7: not in outwarde ceremonyes and seruices, as in tymes past, but in holynes and righteousnes that is accepted before him.
column8: not in outward ceremonies and services, as in times past, but in holiness and righteousness that is accepted before him.

column7: He requyreth the heart, he asketh faith, he wilbe worshipped in spirite and truth and will not be fylled with outwarde woorkes that lacke faith, as men haue done in times past.
column8: He requireth the heart, he asks faith, he will worshipped in Spirit and truth and will not be filled with outward works that lack faith, as men have done in times past.

column7: Thus you see that Zacharias by the holy ghost acknowledgeth the grace of the gospell that shoulde come, therfore he praiseth and glorifieth god, as one ascertayned, that by this grace we al shal be saued.
column8: Thus you see that Zacharias by the holy ghost acknowledgeth the grace of the gospel that should come, Therefore he Praiseth and Glorifieth god, as one ascertained, that by this grace we all shall be saved.

column7: The lorde our god gyue vs grace, bothe that wee maye know it, and also that for it we may giue thanks to god our father, and glorifie him for euer.
column8: The lord our god gyve us grace, both that we may know it, and also that for it we may give thanks to god our father, and Glorify him for ever.

column7: Amen. The gospell on sainct Peter and Paules daye. Math. 16.
column8: Amen. The gospel on saint Peter and Paul's day. Math. 16.

column7: Woodcut illustration of St. Peter the Apostle holding a book and the keys of the kingdom of heaven.
column8: Woodcut illustration of Saint Peter the Apostle holding a book and the keys of the Kingdom of heaven.

column7: W He Iesus came into the coasts of the cytye whych is called Cesarea Philippi, he asked hys disciples, saying:
column8: When When jesus Come into the coasts of the City which is called Caesarea Philippi, he asked his Disciples, saying:

column7: <NOTE> Who do men say that I the sonne of man am?
column8: Who do men say that I the son of man am?

column7: They say: Some saye, thou art Iohn Baptist:
column8: They say: some say, thou art John Baptist:

column7: some Helias: some Hieremias, or one of the numbre of the prophetes.
column8: Some Elias: Some Jeremiah, or one of the numbered of the Prophets.

column7: He sayeth vnto theym: But whom saye yee that I am?
column8: He Saith unto them: But whom say ye that I am?

column7: Simon Peter answered and sayde:
column8: Simon Peter answered and said:

column7: <NOTE> Thou arte Christe the sonne of the lyuyng god.
column8: Thou art Christ the son of the living god.

column7: And Iesus answered & sayde vnto him:
column8: And jesus answered & said unto him:

column7: Happy art thou Simon the sonne of Ionas, for flesh and bloud hath not opened that vnto the,
