column8: Woodcut illustration of the apostle Saint

column7: Matthew the Evangelist holding a scroll.
column8: Matthew the Evangelist holding a scroll.

column7: A Nd as Iesus passed furth from thence, he sawe a ma (named Mathewe) sittyng at the receyte of custome, and he saith vnto him, folowe me.
column8: ANd ANd as jesus passed forth from thence, he saw a ma (nam Matthew) sitting At the receipt of custom, and he Says unto him, follow me.

column7: And he rose, & folowed him.
column8: And he rose, & followed him.

column7: And it came to passe, as Iesus satte at meate in his house:
column8: And it Come to pass, as jesus sat At meat in his house:

column7: beholde, many Publicanes also & synners that came, sat doune with Iesus and his disciples.
column8: behold, many Publicans also & Sinners that Come, sat down with jesus and his Disciples.

column7: And when the Phariseys sawe it, thei said vnto his disciples:
column8: And when the Pharisees saw it, they said unto his Disciples:

column7: Why eateth your mayster with Publicans & synners?
column8: Why Eateth your master with Publicans & Sinners?

column7: But when Iesus heart that, he sayd vnto them:
column8: But when jesus heart that, he said unto them:

column7: They that be strong, nede not the Phisicion, but they that are sicke:
column8: They that be strong, need not the physician, but they that Are sick:

column7: Go ye rather and learne what that meaneth:
column8: Go you rather and Learn what that means:

column7: <NOTE> I wyll haue mercy, and not sacrifice.
column8: I will have mercy, and not sacrifice.

column7: For I am not come to call the righteous, but synners to repentaunce. THE EXPOSITION.
column8: For I am not come to call the righteous, but Sinners to Repentance. THE EXPOSITION.

column7: WE haue here fyrst in this Gospel the callyng of the holy Apostle S.
column8: WE have Here fyrst in this Gospel the calling of the holy Apostle S.

column7: Mathewe vnto his office to preache the Gospell.
column8: Matthew unto his office to preach the Gospel.

column7: And it is very necessarye to consider and looke well vppon this and suche lyke callynges.
column8: And it is very necessary to Consider and look well upon this and such like callings.

column7: For we see howe great euil they are authors of, and what great hurt thei do, that forsake wife and children and vncalled take vpon them the office of preachyng. <NOTE> Verely the lawfull callyng is wrought of God, either immediatly or mediatly.
column8: For we see how great evil they Are Authors of, and what great hurt they do, that forsake wife and children and uncalled take upon them the office of preaching. Verily the lawful calling is wrought of God, either immediately or mediately.

column7: By God immediatly were called in the olde testament Moses & the prophetes, and in the newe testament S.
column8: By God immediately were called in the old Testament Moses & the Prophets, and in the new Testament S.

column7: Paule. And these certainly approued their vocacion with good doctrine & myracles,
column8: Paul. And these Certainly approved their vocation with good Doctrine & Miracles,

column7: that it was of God.
column8: that it was of God.

column7: <NOTE> And mediatly from God were called the other Apostles, which also after the resurrection of Christ chose certaine other & ordayned & appointed them to be preachers.
column8: And mediately from God were called the other Apostles, which also After the resurrection of christ chosen certain other & ordained & appointed them to be Preachers.

column7: Nowe this meane & organe is Christ, whiche chose in the name of his father certayne disciples,
column8: Now this mean & organ is christ, which chosen in the name of his father certain Disciples,

column7: & appointed theim to preache the gospel.
column8: & appointed them to preach the gospel.

column7: Of this vocacion whiche is by certain meanes,
column8: Of this vocation which is by certain means,

column7: S. Paule speaketh manyfestly: For this cause I left yt in Candy (or Creta) to amed suche thynges as want, and to sette in euery toune byshoppes &c.
column8: S. Paul speaks manifestly: For this cause I left that in Candy (or Crete) to amed such things as want, and to Set in every town Bishops etc.

column7: But nowe some man wyll say:
column8: But now Some man will say:

column7: Howe shal I know whether this vocacio done by meanes betwene God & vs, be true and godly, seyng that ye Papistes and Anabaptistes call and appoint suche as be of their sectes to preachyng?
column8: How shall I know whither this vocacio done by means between God & us, be true and godly, sing that you Papists and Anabaptists call and appoint such as be of their Sects to preaching?

column7: I answere. This may be knowen by ye doctrine of him that is called.
column8: I answer. This may be known by you Doctrine of him that is called.

column7: For if it be agreale to the word of God, then is that vacacio tru & lawful:
column8: For if it be agreale to the word of God, then is that vacacio true & lawful:

column7: And suche a preacher is to be heard, receiued,
column8: And such a preacher is to be herd, received,

column7: & had in good honour & estimacio.
column8: & had in good honour & estimacio.

column7: That he ought to be heard,
column8: That he ought to be herd,

column7: Christ sayth: Who that heareth you, heareth me.
column8: christ say: Who that hears you, hears me.

column7: Who casteth furth you, he casteth furth me.
column8: Who Cast forth you, he Cast forth me.

column7: That he ought to be had in good estimacion,
column8: That he ought to be had in good estimation,

column7: S. Paule sayth: Priestes that gouerne well, are worthy double honour, especially suche as labour in the woorde and doctryne.
column8: S. Paul say: Priests that govern well, Are worthy double honour, especially such as labour in the word and Doctrine.

column7: But if he boast his sendyng, ministery & callyng neuer so muche,
column8: But if he boast his sending, Ministry & calling never so much,

column7: & yet his doctryne be against the worde of God, take it for an vnfallyble truth, he is set of Sathan.
column8: & yet his Doctrine be against the word of God, take it for an vnfallyble truth, he is Set of Sathan.

column7: And suche in very dede are the Papistes and Annabaptystes, whose doctryne almoste in euerye article is playne contrary against the worde of God.
column8: And such in very deed Are the Papists and Anabaptists, whose Doctrine almost in every article is plain contrary against the word of God.

column7: Nowe in this vocacion of Mathewe note these 11. thinges.
column8: Now in this vocation of Matthew note these 11. things.

column7: Fyrst that Christ called a symple & vnlearned plain man to ye office of preachyng.
column8: Fyrst that christ called a simple & unlearned plain man to you office of preaching.

column7: This sheweth plainly that God choseth those thynges yt are folishe afore the worlde, to shame those that the worlde hath in high estimacion.
column8: This shows plainly that God chooses those things that Are foolish afore the world, to shame those that the world hath in high estimation.

column7: Another to note is, that he called vnto ye office of Apostleship a synner & a Publican.
column8: another to note is, that he called unto you office of Apostleship a sinner & a Publican.

column7: And by this he sheweth, that he is not a respector of personages, and also that he came into the worlde to saue synners.
column8: And by this he shows, that he is not a Respector of Personages, and also that he Come into the world to save Sinners.

column7: <NOTE> Secondarily, this Gospell prayseth and setteth furth the obedience of Mathewe.
column8: Secondarily, this Gospel Praiseth and sets forth the Obedience of Matthew.

column7: For by and by as he had heard the voyce & comaundement of Christ, he obayed and folowed him.
column8: For by and by as he had herd the voice & Commandment of christ, he obeyed and followed him.

column7: Yea he folowed Christ both spiritually & also corporally.
column8: Yea he followed christ both spiritually & also corporally.

column7: The woorde that Christ sayd to him,
column8: The word that christ said to him,

column7: Folowe me, not only sounded in the eares of his body, but it also entred into his very heart, and made him prompt and glad to forsake all thynges, and to folowe Christ.
column8: Follow me, not only sounded in the ears of his body, but it also entered into his very heart, and made him prompt and glad to forsake all things, and to follow christ.

column7: For if the spirite of God had not made that worde liuely and able to worke in his heart, he had not (doubtles) so sone forsaken his office & ryches.
column8: For if the Spirit of God had not made that word lively and able to work in his heart, he had not (doubtless) so soon forsaken his office & riches.

column7: For surely we know right well the nature of richemen,
column8: For surely we know right well the nature of richemen,

column7: <NOTE> euen by ye wordes that Christ himselfe spake, saiyng:
column8: even by you words that christ himself spoke, saying:

column7: It is easyer for a Camel to go through the eye of a nedle, then for a riche man to entre into the kyngdome of heauen.
column8: It is Easier for a Camel to go through the eye of a needle, then for a rich man to enter into the Kingdom of heaven.

column7: And here note the power of the worde when it is spoken, for it is not so light a thyng or of so lytle price as some vngodly esteme it.
column8: And Here note the power of the word when it is spoken, for it is not so Light a thing or of so little price as Some ungodly esteem it.

column7: And Christ sayth also in another place of the same woorde.
column8: And christ say also in Another place of the same word.

column7: You are not those that speake, but the spirite of your father that speaketh within you.
column8: You Are not those that speak, but the Spirit of your father that speaks within you.

column7: You heare that Christe wyll not separate his spirite and his woorde.
column8: You hear that Christ will not separate his Spirit and his word.

column7: So wee see in this gospel, that this word of Christ,
column8: So we see in this gospel, that this word of christ,

column7: Folow me. did illuminat with the holy spirit the heart of Mathew, and wrought in him so great faith, desire & loue toward Christ, that by & by, nothing considering his acompt, which yet he had not mad to the magistrates, he forsooke al togither and folowed Christ.
column8: Follow me. did illuminate with the holy Spirit the heart of Matthew, and wrought in him so great faith, desire & love towards christ, that by & by, nothing considering his accompt, which yet he had not mad to the Magistrates, he forsook all together and followed christ.

column7: As S. Paul saith: Al that is written, is writen for our learning, therfore ought wee to set before our eyes this obedience of Mathew, and learne by it to obei in al things that god comaundeth and requireth of vs.
column8: As S. Paul Says: All that is written, is written for our learning, Therefore ought we to Set before our eyes this Obedience of Matthew, and Learn by it to obei in all things that god comaundeth and requires of us

column7: As for exaple. If thou be called vnto matrimony, and haue not the gift of continency, folow god, which saith of this thing:
column8: As for Exampl. If thou be called unto matrimony, and have not the gift of continency, follow god, which Says of this thing:

column7: <NOTE> Therfore shal ma forsake father and mother, and kepe himself vnto his wyfe, and thei shalbe two in one flesh.
column8: Therefore shall ma forsake father and mother, and keep himself unto his wife, and they shall two in one Flesh.

column7: If thou be called to any office in the common welth and ciuyle adminystracion, be ready, faithful & obedient.
column8: If thou be called to any office in the Common wealth and ciuyle adminystracion, be ready, faithful & obedient.

column7: For this vocacion that is done by the superior Magistrates, is (as S Peter saith) of god himselfe. <NOTE> If thou be called to the office of preaching, and art apte to that office, be obediente, do thy callynge.
column8: For this vocation that is done by the superior Magistrates, is (as S Peter Says) of god himself. If thou be called to the office of preaching, and art apt to that office, be obedient, do thy calling.

column7: For in this case Christ saith: Folowe me.
column8: For in this case christ Says: Follow me.

column7: Thirdely, we se in this gospel,
column8: Thirdly, we see in this gospel,

column7: <NOTE> that Christ eateth & drinketh with publicans & sinners, so that in this dede he sheweth & testifieth, that he came into thys worlde for sinners.
column8: that christ Eateth & Drinketh with Publicans & Sinners, so that in this deed he shows & Testifieth, that he Come into this world for Sinners.

column7: Note that I say, for siners.
column8: Note that I say, for Sinners.

column7: For though al the world hath euer bene ful of mischiefe & gylty of sinne, neither is no man in it, but nedeth the merites of Christe, yet doo not all men vnderstande this nor acknowledge thys.
column8: For though all the world hath ever be full of mischief & guilty of sin, neither is no man in it, but needeth the merits of Christ, yet do not all men understand this nor acknowledge this.

column7: And especyallye the indurate and hard hearted Pharaos,
column8: And especially the indurate and hard hearted Pharaohs,

column7: <NOTE> and after them the hipocrites acknoweledge it not.
column8: and After them the Hypocrites acknowledge it not.

column7: For ye indurate synners leade furth their lyues euen lyke beastes, not greatly forsyng whether there bee any other lyfe after this or no, or whether there bee any Christ to bryng them to that life or no.
column8: For you indurate Sinners lead forth their lives even like beasts, not greatly forcing whither there be any other life After this or no, or whither there be any christ to bring them to that life or no.

column7: But the hypocrites <NOTE> that leane to their own righteousnes, in dede they can talke of ye wrath to come, yet notwithstandyng they leaue Christ & take thus muche vpon theim selues, that they trust in their owne good workes to obtaine that lyfe and saluacion.
column8: But the Hypocrites that lean to their own righteousness, in deed they can talk of you wrath to come, yet notwithstanding they leave christ & take thus much upon them selves, that they trust in their own good works to obtain that life and salvation.

column7: I praye you, what good can Christe do to suche?
column8: I pray you, what good can Christ do to such?

column7: Yea what shuld he do with suche?
column8: Yea what should he do with such?

column7: This fyrst sort of people are stubburne necked & hard hearted, and thynketh they haue no neede of Christe.
column8: This fyrst sort of people Are stubborn necked & hard hearted, and Thinketh they have no need of Christ.

column7: The other sorte of iusticiaryers, forsaketh the meryte of Christ,
column8: The other sort of iusticiaryers, Forsaketh the merit of christ,

column7: <NOTE> lyke as they would deserue heauen by theyr owne workes.
column8: like as they would deserve heaven by their own works.

column7: Christ seyng and consideryng this, leaueth these two sortes,
column8: christ sing and considering this, Leaveth these two sorts,

column7: & ioyneth himselfe to suche as acknowlege them selues sinners, and desire and seke for tomforte and helpe.
column8: & Joineth himself to such as acknowledge them selves Sinners, and desire and seek for tomforte and help.

column7: And they also with all their heart, with true loue and gladnes receiue him and beleue his preachyng,
column8: And they also with all their heart, with true love and gladness receive him and believe his preaching,

column7: <NOTE> they doubte not his promise, but they say with the Prophet Mycheas:
column8: they doubt not his promise, but they say with the Prophet Micah:

column7: He shalbe turned, and he wyll haue mercy vpo vs, and he wyll caste all oure synnes into the deapth of the seas.
column8: He shall turned, and he will have mercy upon us, and he will cast all our Sins into the depth of the Seas.

column7: Euen so must we do.
column8: Eve so must we do.

column7: Let vs adioyne our selues to Christ as synners, shewe to him our synnes, and with teares require his mercye.
column8: Let us adjoin our selves to christ as Sinners, show to him our Sins, and with tears require his mercy.

column7: If wee do this with a faythfull heart, surely in this gospel he hath declared in dede, yt he is ready to help suche sinners.
column8: If we do this with a faithful heart, surely in this gospel he hath declared in deed, that he is ready to help such Sinners.

column7: And furthermore with this his deede agreeth also his woordes that here he speaketh vnto the Phariseys, saiyng:
column8: And furthermore with this his deed agreeth also his words that Here he speaks unto the Pharisees, saying:

column7: The whole nedeth not the Physician but the sicke.
column8: The Whole needeth not the physician but the sick.

column7: Agayne: I am not comme to call the righteous, but synners to repentaunce.
column8: Again: I am not comme to call the righteous, but Sinners to Repentance.

column7: Fourthly, the Euangelist discrybeth howe the Phariseys murmured against Christ, wherein they open and shewe plainly that notable pryde of theyr heartes.
column8: Fourthly, the Evangelist discrybeth how the Pharisees murmured against christ, wherein they open and show plainly that notable pride of their hearts.

column7: But wherefore murmure they? Because Christ eateth and drynketh with synners.
column8: But Wherefore murmur they? Because christ Eateth and Drinketh with Sinners.

column7: O great holynes of these Phariseys.
column8: O great holiness of these Pharisees.

column7: Tell me I praye ye O holy hypocrites, where is it wrytten, that suche as knowlege themselues synners & do repent it, ought to bee fledde, and their company to be eschewed?
column8: Tell me I pray you Oh holy Hypocrites, where is it written, that such as knowledge themselves Sinners & do Repent it, ought to be fled, and their company to be Eschewed?

column7: Is not this thinke you a good & vertuous dede, to seke out agayne the lost & stray shepe, and to bryng him agayne into the right waye?
column8: Is not this think you a good & virtuous deed, to seek out again the lost & stray sheep, and to bring him again into the right Way?

column7: But I see you do the cleane contrary, for ye iudge it both wicked and vngodly.
column8: But I see you do the clean contrary, for you judge it both wicked and ungodly.

column7: Surely Christ sayd well of you in ye gospel of Mathew:
column8: Surely christ said well of you in the gospel of Matthew:

column7: Blynd guydes, coulyng out the gnat, and swolowe the Camel.
column8: Blind guides, coulyng out the gnat, and swolowe the Camel.

column7: <NOTE> Ye obserue mennes tradicions,
column8: You observe men's traditions,

column7: & would men should esteme you vertuous and godly, yet can ye very well awaye with it, that your neighbour should continue in synne and be codempned.
column8: & would men should esteem you virtuous and godly, yet can you very well away with it, that your neighbour should continue in sin and be codempned.

column7: Nowe if ye were vertuous in deede, ye would surely neuer do so.
column8: Now if you were virtuous in deed, you would surely never do so.

column7: For true righteousnes, because it cometh of fayth, and therfore also loueth his neighbor with all the heart, it wisheth yt all men might be vertuous, righteous & blessed.
column8: For true righteousness, Because it comes of faith, and Therefore also loves his neighbour with all the heart, it wishes that all men might be virtuous, righteous & blessed.

column7: Wherfore wyl ye knowe what ye want?
column8: Wherefore will you know what you want?

column7: Ye haue no fayth, and therfore can ye not loue your neighbour, for in very deede that is the fruite of fayth.
column8: You have no faith, and Therefore can you not love your neighbour, for in very deed that is the fruit of faith.

column7: Nowe because ye lacke fayth and loue, ye haue not only no copassion vpo them that be loden with synne and would with al their heartes be deliuered from their synnes, but also (euen as the nature of hypocrites and iusticiariers is) ye dispise them and caste them frome you.
column8: Now Because you lack faith and love, you have not only no copassion upon them that be laden with sin and would with all their hearts be Delivered from their Sins, but also (even as the nature of Hypocrites and iusticiariers is) you despise them and cast them from you.

column7: But this your dispising can do you no good in this behalf.
column8: But this your despising can do you no good in this behalf.

column7: Ye must neds take an other trade of liuing, yf ye wyll be taken for righteous.
column8: You must neds take an other trade of living, if you will be taken for righteous.

column7: Wyll ye knowe how so?
column8: Wyll you know how so?

column7: Learn what this meaneth that the prophet Oseas said:
column8: Learn what this means that the Prophet Hosea said:

column7: <NOTE> I will mercye and not sacrifice.
column8: I will mercy and not sacrifice.

column7: For all these outewarde woorkes, all these outewarde sacrifices, profyte nothynge at all, excepte there bee presente in the hearte a true faythe in God, and true loue to your neyghboure.
column8: For all these outward works, all these outward Sacrifices, profit nothing At all, except there be present in the heart a true faith in God, and true love to your neighbour.

column7: Behold thus haue wee here paynted vnto vs the arrogancy and pride of hypocrisy, and furthermore howe Christe stoppeth vppe the Phariseys mouthes, and confuteth theym by the holye scriptures.
column8: Behold thus have we Here painted unto us the arrogance and pride of hypocrisy, and furthermore how Christ stoppeth up the Pharisees mouths, and confuteth them by the holy Scriptures.

column7: God graunte that the aduersaryes of the truthe in thys oure presente tyme, maye acknowledge hys holye woorde, and beecome wyth the chylderen of god, partakers of hys heauenly kyngdome, through CHRIST our Lorde.
column8: God grant that the Adversaries of the truth in this our present time, may acknowledge his holy word, and become with the chylderen of god, partakers of his heavenly Kingdom, through CHRIST our Lord.

column7: Amen. The gospell vpon S.
column8: Amen. The gospel upon S.

column7: Mychael the Archangell daye. Math. 18.
column8: Michael the Archangel day. Math. 18.

column7: Woodcut illustration of the Archangel Michael fighting a dragon (Satan).
column8: Woodcut illustration of the Archangel Michael fighting a dragon (Satan).

column7: AT the same tyme came the disciples vnto Iesus, sayinge:
column8: AT the same time Come the Disciples unto jesus, saying:

column7: <NOTE> Who is the greatest in the kingdome of heauen?
column8: Who is the greatest in the Kingdom of heaven?

column7: Iesus called a chylde to hym,
column8: jesus called a child to him,

column7: & set hym in the middest of them, and said:
column8: & Set him in the midst of them, and said:

column7: Verely I say vnto you:
column8: Verily I say unto you:

column7: <NOTE> Except ye turn, and become as <NOTE> children, ye shall not enter into the kyngdome of heauen.
column8: Except you turn, and become as children, you shall not enter into the Kingdom of heaven.

column7: Whosoeuer therfore humbleth himself as this chyld, the same is the greatest in the kigdome of heauen.
column8: Whosoever Therefore Humbleth himself as this child, the same is the greatest in the Kingdom of heaven.

column7: And who so receaueth suche a chyld in my name, receiueth me.
column8: And who so receiveth such a child in my name, receiveth me.

column7: But who so doth offende one of these lytleones,
column8: But who so does offend one of these lytleones,

column7: <NOTE> whiche beleue in me, it were better for him, that a mylstone were haged about his necke,
column8: which believe in me, it were better for him, that a millstone were haged about his neck,

column7: & that he were doruned in the depth of the sea.
column8: & that he were doruned in the depth of the sea.

column7: Wo vnto ye worlde because of offences. <NOTE> Necessarye it is that offences come:
column8: Woe unto you world Because of offences. Necessary it is that offences come:

column7: But wo vnto the man by whom the offence commeth.
column8: But woe unto the man by whom the offence comes.

column7: Wherfore <NOTE> if thy hand or thy foote hynder the, cutte him of & cast it from thee.
column8: Wherefore if thy hand or thy foot hinder thee, Cut him of & cast it from thee.

column7: It is better for thee to entre into life halte or maymed, rather then thou shouldest (hauyng two handes or two feete) be cast into euerlastyng fyre.
column8: It is better for thee to enter into life halt or maimed, rather then thou Shouldst (having two hands or two feet) be cast into everlasting fire.

column7: And it thyne eye offende thee, plucke it out, and cast it from thee.
column8: And it thine eye offend thee, pluck it out, and cast it from thee.

column7: It is better for thee to entre into life with one eye, rather then (hauyng two eyes) to be cast in to hel fyre.
column8: It is better for thee to enter into life with one eye, rather then (having two eyes) to be cast in to hell fire.

column7: Take hede, that ye despise not one of these lytleones.
column8: Take heed, that you despise not one of these lytleones.

column7: For I say vnto you, that in heauen their Angels do alwayes be holde the face of my father, whiche is in heauen.
column8: For I say unto you, that in heaven their Angels do always be hold the face of my father, which is in heaven.

column7: THE EXPOSITION. of this present gospel.
column8: THE EXPOSITION. of this present gospel.

column7: WE haue againe here in this gospel an example of ye Apostles infirmitee & ignorance, wherin we see howe pacietly Christ beareth their infirmitee.
column8: WE have again Here in this gospel an Exampl of the Apostles infirmity & ignorance, wherein we see how pacietly christ bears their infirmity.

column7: And as ye goodnes of Christe appeareth in this Gospell, euen so the affection of the Apostles sheweth it selfe to bee exceadyng grosse and rude, and full of ignoraunce.
column8: And as you Goodness of Christ appears in this Gospel, even so the affection of the Apostles shows it self to be exceeding gross and rude, and full of ignorance.

column7: For consider what they do.
column8: For Consider what they do.

column7: They came to Christ & sayd:
column8: They Come to christ & said:

column7: Who is greattest in the kyngdome of heaue?
column8: Who is greatest in the Kingdom of heave?

column7: What meane they by these woordes?
column8: What mean they by these words?

column7: Thynke they that Christe shoulde haue a corporall knogdome in this worlde,
column8: Think they that Christ should have a corporal knogdome in this world,

column7: & promote his disciples vnto greate lordships, as it is done in worldly princes courtes.
column8: & promote his Disciples unto great lordship's, as it is done in worldly Princes Courts.

column7: Heard they euer Christ so teachig?
column8: Herd they ever christ so teachig?

column7: Did not he shew them afore:
column8: Did not he show them afore:

column7: <NOTE> Ye ar blessed whan men shall rayle vpo you,
column8: You Are blessed when men shall rail upon you,

column7: & persecute you for my names sake?
column8: & persecute you for my names sake?

column7: Now how agre these two, to be persecuted,
column8: Now how agree these two, to be persecuted,

column7: & to bear temporal dominion & power?
column8: & to bear temporal dominion & power?

column7: Truthe it is, that the Apostels shuld raign with Christ.
column8: Truth it is, that the Apostles should Reign with christ.

column7: But wher? In this world?
column8: But where? In this world?

column7: Nay verely. <NOTE> For the kingdome of Christ is a far other thing the a temporal worldly kingdome, as ye apostles wel proued & learned after yt they had receued ye holi ghost.
column8: Nay verily. For the Kingdom of christ is a Far other thing the a temporal worldly Kingdom, as you Apostles well proved & learned After that they had received you holy ghost.

column7: But here as yet thei vnderstad not this, and therfore they desire to know who is greatest in the kingdome of heauen.
column8: But Here as yet they Understand not this, and Therefore they desire to know who is greatest in the Kingdom of heaven.

column7: But what dothe or saith Christ?
column8: But what doth or Says christ?

column7: Suerly as he is wonte to do and saye.
column8: Surely as he is wont to do and say.

column7: For as he often bare their infirmity,
column8: For as he often bore their infirmity,

column7: & cast them not of for their rude and gosse affectios, euen so doth he now at this time.
column8: & cast them not of for their rude and gosse Affections, even so does he now At this time.

column7: He taketh a child, and setteth him in the middest of them, and saith:
column8: He Takes a child, and sets him in the midst of them, and Says:

column7: Except ye be tourned and become as chyldren, ye shall not entre into the kingdome of heauen.
column8: Except you be turned and become as children, you shall not enter into the Kingdom of heaven.

column7: Here in this place Christe teacheth his disciple both by word and exaple.
column8: Here in this place Christ Teaches his disciple both by word and Exampl.

column7: For he setteth a child in the middest of them, and by and by sheweth a cause why he so dothe, that is, yt it was necessary for them to become as children.
column8: For he sets a child in the midst of them, and by and by shows a cause why he so doth, that is, that it was necessary for them to become as children.

column7: How then do childre? They lyue as nature teacheth the, with out ani craft or malice, thei know no pomp, no pride or any other vices of the world, only flye thei to the milke that they sucke out of their mothers brestes.
column8: How then do children? They live as nature Teaches thee, with out ani craft or malice, they know no pomp, no pride or any other vices of the world, only fly they to the milk that they suck out of their mother's breasts.

column7: Euen so must a christian ma be minded.
column8: Eve so must a christian ma be minded.

column7: <NOTE> For it is necessary that he be whole dead as concernyng to the pompe, malyce, guyle, pride both spirituall and carnal,
column8: For it is necessary that he be Whole dead as Concerning to the pomp, malice, guile, pride both spiritual and carnal,

column7: and that he only depende vpon Christe and his worde, and neither attempt nor presume none other thyng, then the worde & commaundement of Christ prescrybeth to him.
column8: and that he only depend upon Christ and his word, and neither attempt nor presume none other thing, then the word & Commandment of christ prescrybeth to him.

column7: For whersoeuer they do thus, there is no pryde, no confidence in merytes of workes, no guyle, no malice, but mere pouertie of spirit and innocency.
column8: For wheresoever they do thus, there is no pride, no confidence in merits of works, no guile, no malice, but mere poverty of Spirit and innocency.

column7: Nowe where as is pouertie of spirit and innocency, there is fulfylled ye saiyng of Christ:
column8: Now where as is poverty of Spirit and innocency, there is fulfilled you saying of christ:

column7: Whoso meaketh himselfe as this chylde, he is the greatest in the kyngdome of heauens.
column8: Whoso meaketh himself as this child, he is the greatest in the Kingdom of heavens.

column7: And of this chyldehod speaketh S.
column8: And of this chyldehod speaks S.

column7: Paule, seiyng: <NOTE> Brethren be not chyldre in wyttes, but in malyce be chyldre. <NOTE> And S. Peter sayth: Desyre you yt reasonable mylke wtout guyle, as chyldren newe borne, that in it ye may growe vp, for you haue tasted how swete ye Lord is.
column8: Paul, seiyng: Brothers be not children in wits, but in malice be children. And S. Peter say: Desire you that reasonable milk without guile, as children new born, that in it you may grow up, for you have tasted how sweet you Lord is.

column7: Secondarily, Christ sheweth with what seueritie and constancy he wyll defend suche as come to this pouertee of spirit, yt is, he wyll take the cure of them whatsoeuer chaunce to them, be it good or euil.
column8: Secondarily, christ shows with what severity and constancy he will defend such as come to this poverty of Spirit, that is, he will take the cure of them whatsoever chance to them, be it good or evil.

column7: If any good thyng be done to theim, he wyll accepte it as done to himselfe, as he wytnesseth saiyng:
column8: If any good thing be done to them, he will accept it as done to himself, as he Witnesseth saying:

column7: <NOTE> Whatsoeuer you dyd to one of these lytleones yt beleueth in me, you did it to me.
column8: Whatsoever you did to one of these lytleones that Believeth in me, you did it to me.

column7: <NOTE> And in ye Prophet Zachary is written:
column8: And in the Prophet Zachary is written:

column7: Whoso toucheth you, toucheth the ball of myne eye.
column8: Whoso touches you, touches the ball of mine eye.

column7: Also if any euil be done to them, he wyl accompt it as done to himself.
column8: Also if any evil be done to them, he will account it as done to himself.

column7: For he sayth thus: He that receyueth suche a childe in my name, he receyueth me.
column8: For he say thus: He that receiveth such a child in my name, he receiveth me.

column7: And he that offedeth one of these lytleones that beleue in me, it were expedient for him, that an asse mylle stone were hanged at his necke, and he drouned in the depth of the sea.
column8: And he that offedeth one of these lytleones that believe in me, it were expedient for him, that an Ass mill stone were hanged At his neck, and he drowned in the depth of the sea.

column7: Doth not God now defend the beleuers,
column8: Does not God now defend the believers,

column7: & is not he careful for that litle & despised flocke that cleaueth vnto Christ?
column8: & is not he careful for that little & despised flock that cleaveth unto christ?

column7: I pray you, who shal cotempne ye doctrin of suche a Lord, yt thus careth & defedeth his seruantes?
column8: I pray you, who shall cotempne you Doctrine of such a Lord, that thus Careth & defedeth his Servants?

column7: Who would not this so great care moue to beleue in Christ?
column8: Who would not this so great care move to believe in christ?

column7: And to vs yt are already receiued vnto faith, what can be more cofort, or what can we more desire?
column8: And to us that Are already received unto faith, what can be more Comfort, or what can we more desire?

column7: Nowe loke howe comfortable this text is to the beleuers, when Christ saith:
column8: Now look how comfortable this text is to the believers, when christ Says:

column7: He yt receiueth you, receiuech me?
column8: He that receiveth you, receiuech me?

column7: Euen so feareful & terrible is it to those that vexe & persecute this poore & despised people of Christe, whiche doth beleue in the worde.
column8: Eve so fearful & terrible is it to those that vex & persecute this poor & despised people of Christ, which does believe in the word.

column7: And forasmuche as Christ shal impute ye pesecucion as done to himselfe, wtout doubt it shal come to passe, when ye tyme appointed of God is fulfylled, that Christ wyl brydle ye furor & voluptuous mynde of the vngodly.
column8: And forasmuch as christ shall impute you pesecucion as done to himself, without doubt it shall come to pass, when you time appointed of God is fulfilled, that christ will bridle you Furor & voluptuous mind of the ungodly.

column7: But yet notwtstadyng the vngodly wyll not nowe beleue this, tyl (as the comon prouerbe sayth) they haue both their handes ful, and the sentence of perpetual dampnacion be declared against them, euen as you perceiue it chaunsed vnto Pharao.
column8: But yet notwtstadyng the ungodly will not now believe this, till (as the Common proverb say) they have both their hands full, and the sentence of perpetual damnation be declared against them, even as you perceive it chanced unto Pharaoh.

column7: Thyrdly, Christ sheweth his disciples before, that there shuld come slader which shuld cotinue vnto ye ende of ye worlde:
column8: Thirdly, christ shows his Disciples before, that there should come slader which should cotinue unto you end of you world:

column7: & also instructeth them how to behaue themselues among suche slanders.
column8: & also Instructeth them how to behave themselves among such slanders.

column7: Wo to the worlde (saith he) for slanders.
column8: Woe to the world (Says he) for slanders.

column7: Nedes must slanders come, but yet wo to that man by who slanders come.
column8: Needs must slanders come, but yet woe to that man by who slanders come.

column7: Christ sheweth plainly yt slanders shuld cotinue in ye world vnto ye end of this world, euen as Paul saith:
column8: christ shows plainly that slanders should cotinue in you world unto you end of this world, even as Paul Says:

column7: There must bee sectes among you. <NOTE> Why so Paule?
column8: There must be Sects among you. Why so Paul?

column7: That they whiche are perfect among you, might be knowe.
column8: That they which Are perfect among you, might be know.

column7: But wherof shal this offece or slander arise, or wherin cosisteth it?
column8: But whereof shall this offence or slander arise, or wherein cosisteth it?

column7: <NOTE> Fyrst it shal come of false doctrine whiche did arise by & by after the resurrection of Christ, while the Apostels were yet aliue,
column8: Fyrst it shall come of false Doctrine which did arise by & by After the resurrection of christ, while the Apostles were yet alive,

column7: & was by conterfaict apostels and false brethre taught vnto the people, yea and that diligently.
column8: & was by conterfaict Apostles and false brethren taught unto the people, yea and that diligently.

column7: To omyt the other, did it not eue so chance to S.
column8: To omit the other, did it not eve so chance to S.

column7: Paul, amongst and with ye Galathias?
column8: Paul, among and with you Galatians?

column7: He had preached the gospell of Christ to them, and had fully and sufficiently instructed them in the matters of faith, yea and they had receaued him with suche harty loue and so feruent a desire & with such reuerece,
column8: He had preached the gospel of christ to them, and had Fully and sufficiently instructed them in the matters of faith, yea and they had received him with such hearty love and so fervent a desire & with such Reverence,

column7: <NOTE> that he confesseth that thei wold haue plucked out their eies & gyuen them to him, if it had bene possible.
column8: that he Confesses that they would have plucked out their eyes & given them to him, if it had be possible.

column7: Yet for all this, after his departure ther came false brethren, which set forth and taught to the Galathias other maner of doctrine the Paul had taught them.
column8: Yet for all this, After his departure there Come false brothers, which Set forth and taught to the Galatians other manner of Doctrine the Paul had taught them.

column7: What slanders thinke ye arose of this?
column8: What slanders think you arose of this?

column7: Euen in lyke manner chanced it in our daies.
column8: Eve in like manner chanced it in our days.

column7: God hath giuen to vs very plenteously & richely his worde and gospel, yt suerly we ought with whole heartes to thank him & laud him for that so great & noble a treasure.
column8: God hath given to us very plenteously & richly his word and gospel, that surely we ought with Whole hearts to thank him & laud him for that so great & noble a treasure.

column7: But what chanced now? When the word now did florishe, and thorow the wonderful goodnes & gracious fauour of god, it brought forth right bewtiful frutes amog many one, euen did ther burst forth with their slanders, the Byshop of Rome with all his Papisticall rablement of Monkes & Friers, which with the residue of their sectes and doctors, dyd with all their power inuade & resist (so muche as laye in them) the plain and true word of god, to the great hinderance of the gospel.
column8: But what chanced now? When the word now did flourish, and thorough the wondered Goodness & gracious favour of god, it brought forth right beautiful fruits Among many one, even did there burst forth with their slanders, the Bishop of Room with all his Papistical rabblement of Monks & Friars, which with the residue of their Sects and Doctors, did with all their power invade & resist (so much as say in them) the plain and true word of god, to the great hindrance of the gospel.

column7: By & by vpon this folowed that pestiferous sect & doctrin of ye Anabaptists, which made me excedig wood for a time, which also hath don no lyttle hurte to the furtheraunce of Christes holye worde.
column8: By & by upon this followed that pestiferous sect & Doctrine of you Anabaptists, which made me excedig wood for a time, which also hath dONE no little hurt to the furtherance of Christ's holy word.

column7: What slaunders thynke yee haue come by these and many mo sectes?
column8: What slanders think ye have come by these and many more Sects?

column7: Furthermore this slaunder is against loue, as when I wyll not obey the Magistrate,
column8: Furthermore this slander is against love, as when I will not obey the Magistrate,

column7: I will not do and paye, as other men doo and paye, neither beare the common charges as other beare, but I wyll be cleane without lawe, and haue a singuler prerogatiue afore al other.
column8: I will not do and pay, as other men do and pay, neither bear the Common charges as other bear, but I will be clean without law, and have a singular prerogative afore all other.

column7: Of this slaunder Christe hym selfe saithe to Peter:
column8: Of this slander Christ him self Saith to Peter:

column7: <NOTE> Leaste we shoulde bee a slaunder vnto them, go to the sea, and cast thy hooke, and that fyshe which firste commeth, take him vppe, open his mouthe, and thou shalte fynde a grote, take it oute, and giue it them for the and me.
column8: Jest we should be a slander unto them, go to the sea, and cast thy hook, and that Fish which First comes, take him up, open his Mouth, and thou shalt find a groat, take it out, and give it them for the and me.

column7: Nowe withoute doubt these slanders shall continue in the worlde vnto the end.
column8: Now without doubt these slanders shall continue in the world unto the end.

column7: And especiall the slaunderers of doctrine shall bee both greuous and vehemente.
column8: And especial the slanderers of Doctrine shall be both grievous and vehement.

column7: But what remedye againste this slaunder? <NOTE>
column8: But what remedy against this slander?

column7: I muste cut of that whiche woulde offende me, be it either foot, hande or eyes:
column8: I must Cut of that which would offend me, be it either foot, hand or eyes:

column7: that is, I must continue in the worde, nothing consyderyng what shall chaunce, euen thoughe father or mother, brother or syster, wyfe or children, kinne or affinytye, monye or ryches woulde plucke me frome it, yet muste I sette more by the woorde, then by all these.
column8: that is, I must continue in the word, nothing considering what shall chance, even though father or mother, brother or sister, wife or children, kin or affinytye, money or riches would pluck me from it, yet must I Set more by the word, then by all these.

column7: For better yt is that I forsake all thynges, be they neuer so deere and precious in thys worlde, and to bee saued afore god, then to haue all menne my friendes and be separated from god.
column8: For better that is that I forsake all things, be they never so deer and precious in this world, and to be saved afore god, then to have all men my Friends and be separated from god.

column7: And seeynge that god wyll so extremelye punyshe theym that rayse suche slaunders, what thynke yee shall come to suche as for those slaunders leaue and forsake the trueth?
column8: And seeing that god will so extremely Punish them that raise such slanders, what think ye shall come to such as for those slanders leave and forsake the truth?

column7: Doubtlesse hee shall punishe theym both alyke.
column8: Doubtless he shall Punish them both alike.

column7: Fourthly, here is a general admonicion vnto al men, that they dispyse none of these lytleones that are dead to the worlde & poore in spirit, and knyt together one in Christ.
column8: Fourthly, Here is a general admonition unto all men, that they despise none of these lytleones that Are dead to the world & poor in Spirit, and knit together one in christ.

column7: Yea, there is also assygned a cause why they shuld beware of hurtyng them.
column8: Yea, there is also assigned a cause why they should beware of hurting them.

column7: <NOTE> For their Angels (sayth Christ) in heauen alway see the face of my father whiche is in heauen.
column8: For their Angels (say christ) in heaven always see the face of my father which is in heaven.

column7: Surely without doubt if God be so mercyful to his seruauntes, that he hath appointed Angels vnto this ministery to kepe and defende them, doubtles then this wyll please him but a lytle, if they be dispised, persecuted, troubled & troden vnder foote.
column8: Surely without doubt if God be so merciful to his Servants, that he hath appointed Angels unto this Ministry to keep and defend them, doubtless then this will please him but a little, if they be despised, persecuted, troubled & trodden under foot.

column7: For surely the Lord is as careful for them, as if these thinges were done vnto himselfe.
column8: For surely the Lord is as careful for them, as if these things were done unto himself.

column7: And furthermore, he must nedes be discotented to se them euil entreated, for whose sake he came into this worlde and shedde his precious bloud.
column8: And furthermore, he must needs be discotented to see them evil entreated, for whose sake he Come into this world and shed his precious blood.

column7: I pray you who can thynke otherwyse in this behalfe?
column8: I pray you who can think otherwise in this behalf?

column7: Shall it not prouoke his anger, that wee dispyse those who he hath redemed wt his death and precious bloud shed?
column8: Shall it not provoke his anger, that we despise those who he hath redeemed with his death and precious blood shed?

column7: For if that lost shepe be so deare to him, and he so entyrely loued it, that he left nyntye and nyne in the wyldernes, and ceassed not seekyng tyll he had founde it, why should wee then either persecute or trouble that sheepe?
column8: For if that lost sheep be so deer to him, and he so entirely loved it, that he left nyntye and nyne in the Wilderness, and ceased not seeking till he had found it, why should we then either persecute or trouble that sheep?

column7: Surely he may suffre it, but without doubt he wyl not leaue it vnpunished.
column8: Surely he may suffer it, but without doubt he will not leave it unpunished.

column7: Furthermore he sayth: It is not his fathers wyll that one of these lytleones should peryshe.
column8: Furthermore he say: It is not his Father's will that one of these lytleones should perish.

column7: Are not these strong reasons that might well refrayne vs from persecutyng of our christian brethren?
column8: are not these strong Reasons that might well refrain us from persecuting of our christian brothers?

column7: Theyr angels (sayth Christe) whiche must 1 page duplicate 1 page duplicate serue them, euer see the face of my father.
column8: Their Angels (say Christ) which must 1 page duplicate 1 page duplicate serve them, ever see the face of my father.

column7: Trueth it is that I wyll be their sauior, and my fathers wyll is yt they should not perishe.
column8: Truth it is that I will be their Saviour, and my Father's will is that they should not perish.

column7: Nowe if these wordes wyll not moue vs, surely I knowe not what should moue vs to learne to loue christian men, and not to despyse theim.
column8: Now if these words will not move us, surely I know not what should move us to Learn to love christian men, and not to despise them.

column7: But commonly it so chaunseth, that these poore lytle ones of Christ haue euermore persecucion then fauour in this worlde.
column8: But commonly it so chaunseth, that these poor little ones of christ have evermore persecution then favour in this world.

column7: Wherfore I beseche God graunt vs grace to perseuer in his fayth and paciently for his names sake to suffre persecucion vnto thende, through Christ our Lord. Amen.
column8: Wherefore I beseech God grant us grace to persever in his faith and patiently for his names sake to suffer persecution unto The end, through christ our Lord. Amen.

column7: The gospel on sainct Lukes day the Euagelist, ye shall fynde after Alhalowen day.
column8: The gospel on saint Lukes day the Evangelist, you shall find After All hallows day.

column7: The gospel on sainct Symon and Iudes day. Ihon. 15.
column8: The gospel on saint Symon and Jude's day. John 15.

column8: Woodcut illustration of the apostle Saint

column7: Jude holding a club. Woodcut illustration of the apostle St.
column8: U^de holding a club. Woodcut illustration of the apostle Saint

column7: Simon carrying a bucksaw. T His is my commaun, demet:
column8: Simon carrying a bucksaw. THis THis is my command, Demet:

column7: that ye loue together, as I haue loued you.
column8: that you love together, as I have loved you.

column7: Greater loue hath no ma, then this:
column8: Greater love hath no ma, then this:

column7: that a man bestow his life for his frendes.
column8: that a man bestow his life for his Friends.

column7: Ye are my frendes, if ye do whatsoeuer I comaunde you.
column8: You Are my Friends, if you do whatsoever I command you.

column7: Hencefurth call I you not seruauntes, for the seruaunt knoweth not what his lorde doth.
column8: Henceforth call I you not Servants, for the servant Knoweth not what his lord does.

column7: But you haue I called frendes:
column8: But you have I called Friends:

column7: For all thynges that I haue heard of my father haue I opened to you.
column8: For all things that I have herd of my father have I opened to you.

column7: Ye haue not chosen me, but I haue chosen you, and ordayned you, to go and bryng furth fruite, and that your fruite should remayne, that whatsoeuer ye aske of ye father in my name, he may geue it you. THE EXPOSITION.
column8: You have not chosen me, but I have chosen you, and ordained you, to go and bring forth fruit, and that your fruit should remain, that whatsoever you ask of you father in my name, he may give it you. THE EXPOSITION.

column7: C Hrist gaue his disciples this comaundemet of brotherly loue, after that last supper when he now knewe the tyme of his passion at hand,
column8: christ christ gave his Disciples this comaundemet of brotherly love, After that last supper when he now knew the time of his passion At hand,

column7: & that immediatly he shuld be taken away fro them.
column8: & that immediately he should be taken away from them.

column7: Surely this is an vndoubted truth, that there is besydes fayth no woorke in the worlde, nor none can be, that shalbe acceptable vnto God, saue onely charitee and loue of my neighbour, of the whiche Christ speaketh in this Gospel.
column8: Surely this is an undoubted truth, that there is besides faith no work in the world, nor none can be, that shall acceptable unto God, save only charity and love of my neighbour, of the which christ speaks in this Gospel.

column7: Or els why should Christ with so great seueritee and earnest admonicion in that his last sermon that euer he made,
column8: Or Else why should christ with so great severity and earnest admonition in that his last sermon that ever he made,

column7: <NOTE> haue geuen and inculcate this precepte of charitee?
column8: have given and inculcate this precept of charity?

column7: And here note two thynges.
column8: And Here note two things.

column7: Fyrst that Christ gaue this precept and not Moses.
column8: Fyrst that christ gave this precept and not Moses.

column7: For if it were Moses precept, it shuld be a precept as the other preceptes were in the lawe, whiche in dede taught & comaunded what should be done, and what should bee lefte vndone, but thei gaue not ye spirit, wherby it might be done with free heart and courage.
column8: For if it were Moses precept, it should be a precept as the other Precepts were in the law, which in deed taught & commanded what should be done, and what should be left undone, but they gave not you Spirit, whereby it might be done with free heart and courage.

column7: But Christ doth not here so, but as he sheweth what is necessary to be done, euen so he also geueth the spirit, that we may be able to do those thinges that he hath comaunded.
column8: But christ does not Here so, but as he shows what is necessary to be done, even so he also Giveth the Spirit, that we may be able to do those things that he hath commanded.

column7: And this is the onely cause, why he him selfe sayth of his preceptes:
column8: And this is the only cause, why he him self say of his Precepts:

column7: My yoke is swete, & my burthen light.
column8: My yoke is sweet, & my burden Light.

column7: And sainct Ihon in his Epistle Canonical saith:
column8: And saint John in his Epistle Canonical Says:

column7: His comaundementes are not heauy.
column8: His Commandments Are not heavy.

column7: Wherefore these woorkes of loue are not hypocrites workes, like as the workes of the lawe were, whiche ye Iewes did without spirit, but whatsoeuer a Christian doth in this behalfe, he doth it with an whole heart, <NOTE> euen as sainct Paule sayth:
column8: Wherefore these works of love Are not Hypocrites works, like as the works of the law were, which the Jews did without Spirit, but whatsoever a Christian does in this behalf, he does it with an Whole heart, even as saint Paul say:

column7: Charitee seketh not the thyng that is her owne.
column8: Charity seeketh not the thing that is her own.

column7: For why. A christian knoweth, that Christe requireth not onely true fayth, that worshippeth the father in spirit and truth, but also he requireth an vnfayned loue.
column8: For why. A christian Knoweth, that Christ requires not only true faith, that Worshippeth the father in Spirit and truth, but also he requires an unfeigned love.

column7: Further note, that this loue spryngeth not of her selfe, but it spryngeth furth of fayth, so that whersoeuer there is no fayth, there can neuer bee any true loue.
column8: Further note, that this love springeth not of her self, but it springeth forth of faith, so that wheresoever there is no faith, there can never be any true love.

column7: <NOTE> Fayth heareth the woorde of God,
column8: Faith hears the word of God,

column7: & taketh holde vpon those thynges, that the same worde promyseth in the merytes of Christe, and so obtayneth without any merites of workes, only of mere grace and mercy, remission of synnes, righteousnes & eternal life.
column8: & Takes hold upon those things, that the same word promiseth in the merits of Christ, and so obtaineth without any merits of works, only of mere grace and mercy, remission of Sins, righteousness & Eternal life.

column7: Nowe if any ma wyl in this cause of iustifycacion, admyxt ye myre of his owne workes, he goth cleane out of the way, and shoteth beside the marke brustyng his head against this stony rocke of saint Paules wordes,
column8: Now if any ma will in this cause of justification, admyxt you mire of his own works, he Goes clean out of the Way, and shooteth beside the mark bursting his head against this stony rock of saint Paul's words,

column7: <NOTE> where he sayth:
column8: where he say:

column7: If then righteousnes be of the woorkes of the lawe,
column8: If then righteousness be of the works of the law,

column7: Christ is dead in vayne.
column8: christ is dead in vain.

column7: Of this fayth I say spryngeth loue,
column8: Of this faith I say springeth love,

column7: <NOTE> which in this gospel Christ so earnestly comaundeth vnto vs. <NOTE> But what doth this loue?
column8: which in this gospel christ so earnestly comaundeth unto us But what does this love?

column7: She forbeareth log, she is gentle, she enuyeth not, she is not froward, she is not proude, she is not ambicious, she seeketh not her owne, she is not angry, she imagyneth not euil, she reioyseth not vpo iniquitee,
column8: She forbeareth log, she is gentle, she enuyeth not, she is not froward, she is not proud, she is not ambitious, she seeks not her own, she is not angry, she imagyneth not evil, she Rejoiceth not upon iniquity,

column7: & she ioyeth wholly in the truth &c. <NOTE> Therfore sayth sainct Paule in an other place also:
column8: & she Joyeth wholly in the truth etc. Therefore say saint Paul in an other place also:

column7: The ende & summe of the comaundement is loue, that commeth of a pure heart and a good conscience, and an vnfayned fayth.
column8: The end & sum of the Commandment is love, that comes of a pure heart and a good conscience, and an unfeigned faith.

column7: Further, forasmuch as Christ knoweth, that there cosisteth a great wayghty matter in true loue, that spryngeth of fayth, therfore in this his last sermon, he taught not many preceptes of good workes, but only commaundeth this, that they should loue one another.
column8: Further, forasmuch as christ Knoweth, that there cosisteth a great wayghty matter in true love, that springeth of faith, Therefore in this his last sermon, he taught not many Precepts of good works, but only commandeth this, that they should love one Another.

column7: As he would say: If ye haue fayth and loue, ye shal also right easely performe all other thynges, what soeuer I haue commaunded you to do.
column8: As he would say: If you have faith and love, you shall also right Easily perform all other things, what soever I have commanded you to do.

column7: Secondarily, <NOTE> forasmuche as Christe had before shewed his disciples, that the crosse shuld come vpo theim, and had before tolde theim, that they should suffre muche aduersitee in this worlde, nowe here Christ repeteth the same, and also sheweth the cause wherfore:
column8: Secondarily, forasmuch as Christ had before showed his Disciples, that the cross should come upon them, and had before told them, that they should suffer much adversity in this world, now Here christ repeateth the same, and also shows the cause Wherefore:

column7: If the worlde (sayd he) hate you, knowe you that it hated me fyrst.
column8: If the world (said he) hate you, know you that it hated me fyrst.

column7: <NOTE> Christe here calleth all them the worlde, that haue not receyued his worde, haue not obayed the gospel, nor knowen the father in him, nor him in ye father:
column8: Christ Here calls all them the world, that have not received his word, have not obeyed the gospel, nor known the father in him, nor him in you father:

column7: And breifely, whosoeuer they be that want fayth,
column8: And briefly, whosoever they be that want faith,

column7: & acknowlege not the righteousnes of fayth, seme thei neuer so vertuous, righteous, holy & wyse in their owne eyes,
column8: & acknowledge not the righteousness of faith, seem they never so virtuous, righteous, holy & wise in their own eyes,

column7: Christ calleth them all by this one name The worlde,
column8: christ calls them all by this one name The world,

column7: & declareth them to be his enemyes.
column8: & Declareth them to be his enemies.

column7: After this sort doth sainct Ihon vse this worde, saiyng:
column8: After this sort does saint John use this word, saying:

column7: <NOTE> He was in the worlde and the worlde is made by him, and the worlde knewe him not.
column8: He was in the world and the world is made by him, and the world knew him not.

column7: Then when Christ sayth: If the worlde hate you, knowe you that it fyrst hated me.
column8: Then when christ say: If the world hate you, know you that it fyrst hated me.

column7: Wherwith he semeth to say:
column8: Wherewith he Seemeth to say:

column7: Wondre not, if ye wyse and righteous in the worldes estimacion, and also the mightie menne in this worlde do resyst you, and 1 page duplicate 1 page duplicate persecute you, for suerly there is no litle cause, why they so will do.
column8: Wonder not, if you wise and righteous in the world's estimation, and also the mighty men in this world do resist you, and 1 page duplicate 1 page duplicate persecute you, for surely there is no little cause, why they so will do.

column7: The worlde holdeth and defendeth with to the and nayle, the righteousnes of workes, but your doctrine shall be cleane repugnant & contrary, for if ye will purely and sincerely preach my worde, ye shall maintayne and defende the righteousnes of faith.
column8: The world holds and defendeth with to thee and nail, the righteousness of works, but your Doctrine shall be clean repugnant & contrary, for if you will purely and sincerely preach my word, you shall maintain and defend the righteousness of faith.

column7: And if ye wyll do so earnestly as it shall be your duety, nedes must ye cast of all that is in the worlde, that is, all carnall wisedome, vertu, righteousnes, strength, freewill. as ye knowe that I haue doone.
column8: And if you will do so earnestly as it shall be your duty, needs must you cast of all that is in the world, that is, all carnal Wisdom, virtue, righteousness, strength, freewill. as you know that I have done.

column7: How shall ye in so doyng be at vnity with them?
column8: How shall you in so doing be At unity with them?

column7: <NOTE> Now is the iudgement of this worlde.
column8: Now is the judgement of this world.

column7: And furthermore, the holye ghoste shalbe sente for the same purpose, to rebuke the worlde as I haue done.
column8: And furthermore, the holy ghost shall sent for the same purpose, to rebuke the world as I have done.

column7: Now if for this gentle rebukinge the worlde shall hate you, and take all thynges to the worste, and imagyne all manner of myschiefe against you, knowe you that euen so did the worlde by me.
column8: Now if for this gentle rebuking the world shall hate you, and take all things to the worst, and imagine all manner of mischief against you, know you that even so did the world by me.

column7: If I had approued and alowed their workes, as I dyd reproue & disalow them,
column8: If I had approved and aloud their works, as I did reprove & disallow them,

column7: I had hadde the high Priestes myne especiall good friendes, with the Phariseis and all the Iewes:
column8: I had had the high Priests mine especial good Friends, with the Pharisees and all the Jews:

column7: but when I would needes do myne office truly, and fully accomplyshe my duty, needes must I lose all their frendeshippes, and also for that cause suffre so many of their false accusacyons, checkes and rebukes.
column8: but when I would needs do mine office truly, and Fully accomplish my duty, needs must I loose all their frendeshippes, and also for that cause suffer so many of their false accusations, Checks and rebukes.

column7: Nowe, woulde you speede better than I?
column8: Now, would you speed better than I?

column7: There is also and other cause why the worlde can not loue you:
column8: There is also and other cause why the world can not love you:

column7: For you are not of this worlde.
column8: For you Are not of this world.

column7: If you were of this world, the world woulde loue that whiche is his owne, but bicause you are not of the world, but I haue chosen you out of the worlde, therfore the worlde hateth you.
column8: If you were of this world, the world would love that which is his own, but Because you Are not of the world, but I have chosen you out of the world, Therefore the world hates you.

column7: You heare in this place, that if the world hate you, it ys an euident argument, that you ar not of the world.
column8: You hear in this place, that if the world hate you, it is an evident argument, that you Are not of the world.

column7: And euen so saith S Paule:
column8: And even so Says S Paul:

column7: <NOTE> Yf I shuld please men I shuld not be Christes seruant.
column8: If I should please men I should not be Christ's servant.

column7: And a lyke testimony doth Christ giue his apostels, that thei ar not of this world.
column8: And a like testimony does christ give his Apostles, that they Are not of this world.

column7: Why so? For thei shal rebuke the world reproue and damn the carnal iustice of the world,
column8: Why so? For they shall rebuke the world reprove and damn the carnal Justice of the world,

column7: & earnestly affirm & preach the righteousnes of faith, for they ar not of this world. that is, thei seek not a carnall iustice as the world dothe, their confidence is not in their good workes as ye worlds is, but thei earnestly preach ye merits of Christ, as ye only cause of our righteousnes & saluacion.
column8: & earnestly affirm & preach the righteousness of faith, for they Are not of this world. that is, they seek not a carnal Justice as the world doth, their confidence is not in their good works as you world's is, but they earnestly preach you merits of christ, as you only cause of our righteousness & salvation.

column7: Now bycause the world can not bere this, ther is mortall warre and contynuall hatred betwene theym and the worlde, euen as Christe saithe here agayne in this gospell:
column8: Now Because the world can not bear this, there is Mortal war and continual hatred between them and the world, even as Christ Saith Here again in this gospel:

column7: But all these thinges shall they doo to you, for my names sake, bicause they knowe not him that hath sente me.
column8: But all these things shall they do to you, for my names sake, Because they know not him that hath sent me.

column7: Fynallye. Bycause the worlde knoweth not the father, therfore knoweth it not the son.
column8: Finally. Because the world Knoweth not the father, Therefore Knoweth it not the son.

column7: And because it knoweth not the son, neither knoweth it them whom the sonne hath sent.
column8: And Because it Knoweth not the son, neither Knoweth it them whom the son hath sent.

column7: Wherfore, seing yt the world neither knoweth the father, nor the son, nor yet the apostels whom the sonne hath sent, needes must it then persecute, hate and condemn, both the truth and also those that preach it.
column8: Wherefore, sing that the world neither Knoweth the father, nor the son, nor yet the Apostles whom the son hath sent, needs must it then persecute, hate and condemn, both the truth and also those that preach it.

column7: Thirdly, Christ in this persecutio,
column8: Thirdly, christ in this Persecution,

column7: <NOTE> which surely is euer annexed to the gospel in this world, comandeth vs to take sure holde of his woorde, as that only comfort, whereby Christians in all tribulacions solace them selues.
column8: which surely is ever annexed to the gospel in this world, commandeth us to take sure hold of his word, as that only Comfort, whereby Christians in all tribulations solace them selves.

column7: Remembre (saithe hee) my woorde, which I haue saide vnto you.
column8: remember (Saith he) my word, which I have said unto you.

column7: This text teacheth vs (as it semeth) that there shal be no nother comfort vpon yearth, especially in persecucions, except only that worde, and doubtlesse it is euen so in dede.
column8: This text Teaches us (as it Seemeth) that there shall be no neither Comfort upon earth, especially in persecutions, except only that word, and doubtless it is even so in deed.

column7: For what consolacion may bee in that mannes heart, which hath refused and put fro his sight the worde of God?
column8: For what consolation may be in that Man's heart, which hath refused and put from his sighed the word of God?

column7: Cotrarily what I pray you shal hynder or hurt him, that taketh holde vpo the worde, and by fayth printeth it in his heart?
column8: Contrarily what I pray you shall hinder or hurt him, that Takes hold upon the word, and by faith printeth it in his heart?

column7: For he doubtles knoweth very well, that he must nedes suffre pesecutions and tribulacions, that is a very true tale:
column8: For he doubtless Knoweth very well, that he must needs suffer pesecutions and tribulations, that is a very true tale:

column7: but yet he knoweth also this, that persecucion shall shortely haue an ende, and at the tyme ordayned of God, it shall be chaunged into perpetual ioy,
column8: but yet he Knoweth also this, that persecution shall shortly have an end, and At the time ordained of God, it shall be changed into perpetual joy,

column7: <NOTE> as sainct Paule sayth:
column8: as saint Paul say:

column7: Surely I thynke, that ye passions of this tyme, are not worthy to bee iudged equal to the glory that shalbe reueled among vs.
column8: Surely I think, that you passion of this time, Are not worthy to be judged equal to the glory that shall revealed among us

column7: <NOTE> And of this speaketh Christ, saiyng:
column8: And of this speaks christ, saying:

column7: A woman when she trauaileth, hath sorowe, for her houre is come.
column8: A woman when she Travaileth, hath sorrow, for her hour is come.

column7: But when she hath brought furthe her manchylde, she nowe remembreth not the pangues, for ioy that a man is borne into the worlde.
column8: But when she hath brought forth her manchylde, she now Remember not the pangs, for joy that a man is born into the world.

column7: And euen so you nowe haue sorowe, but I wyll see you agayne, and your heart shall ioye, and no man shall take awaye your ioy from you.
column8: And even so you now have sorrow, but I will see you again, and your heart shall joy, and no man shall take away your joy from you.

column7: These and suche lyke woordes doth the christian man set hand vpo in persecucion. so that he may stand stedfast in them, and syng with the Prophete:
column8: These and such like words does the christian man Set hand upon in persecution. so that he may stand steadfast in them, and sing with the Prophet:

column7: <NOTE> My soule stayeth her in his woorde, my soule hath trusted in the Lorde.
column8: My soul stays her in his word, my soul hath trusted in the Lord.

column7: And therefore sayth Christe here to his disciples:
column8: And Therefore say Christ Here to his Disciples:

column7: <NOTE> Remembre my worde, that I haue spoken to you,
column8: remember my word, that I have spoken to you,

column7: But what worde is it?
column8: But what word is it?

column7: The seruaunt is not greater then his Lorde.
column8: The servant is not greater then his Lord.

column7: Nowe if they haue persecuted the Lorde in this worlde, let the seruaunt holde him cotented, though all thynges procede not accordyng to his purpose, and thoughe some tyme he speade as his mayster speade afore him:
column8: Now if they have persecuted the Lord in this world, let the servant hold him cotented, though all things proceed not according to his purpose, and though Some time he speed as his master speed afore him:

column7: For doubtles it can be none other wyse.
column8: For doubtless it can be none other wise.

column7: If they (sayth Christe) haue persecuted me, they shall also persecute you.
column8: If they (say Christ) have persecuted me, they shall also persecute you.

column7: If they haue kept my worde, they wyll also kepe yours.
column8: If they have kept my word, they will also keep yours.

column7: In these wordes Christ sheweth very plainely, that there should bee perpetual dissencion betwene his disciples and the worlde, for his disciples wyll cleaue to his woorde, the whiche in deede the worlde can not abyde.
column8: In these words christ shows very plainly, that there should be perpetual dissension between his Disciples and the world, for his Disciples will cleave to his word, the which in deed the world can not abide.

column7: And therfore Christ geueth his disciples this counsaile, that they shall looke to the worde, and steadfastly stand in that, yea though the worlde neuer so madly and furiously rage & raue against it.
column8: And Therefore christ Giveth his Disciples this counsel, that they shall look to the word, and steadfastly stand in that, yea though the world never so madly and furiously rage & rave against it.

column7: Whiche God graunt that all wee may apprehende and persyst in it, to his honour and oure soules health, throughe Christ our Lord.
column8: Which God grant that all we may apprehend and persyst in it, to his honour and our Souls health, through christ our Lord.

column7: Amen. The Gospel on all Sainctes day. Math. 5.
column8: Amen. The Gospel on all Saints day. Math. 5.

column7: Woodcut illustration depicting the feast of All Saints with the blessed in heaven, above the damned in hell.
column8: Woodcut illustration depicting the feast of All Saints with the blessed in heaven, above the damned in hell.

column7: W Hen he saw the people, he wet vp into a mountayn, and when he was sette, his disciples came to him:
column8: WHen WHen he saw the people, he wet up into a mountain, and when he was Set, his Disciples Come to him:

column7: and after that he had opened his mouth, he taught them, saying:
column8: and After that he had opened his Mouth, he taught them, saying:

column7: <NOTE> Blessed are the poore in spirit, for theirs is the kyngdom of heauen.
column8: Blessed Are the poor in Spirit, for theirs is the Kingdom of heaven.

column7: <NOTE> Blessed are they that mourne, for they shall receiue comfort.
column8: Blessed Are they that mourn, for they shall receive Comfort.

column7: Blessed are the meeke: for they shall receiue the inheritaunce of the yearth.
column8: Blessed Are the meek: for they shall receive the inheritance of the earth.

column7: Blessed are they whiche <NOTE> hunger and thyrst after righteousnes:
column8: Blessed Are they which hunger and thirst After righteousness:

column7: for thei shalbe satisfied. Blessed are the mercyful:
column8: for they shall satisfied. Blessed Are the merciful:

column7: for they shal obtayne mercy.
column8: for they shall obtain mercy.

column7: Blessed are the pure in hearte:
column8: Blessed Are the pure in heart:

column7: for they shall se God.
column8: for they shall see God.

column7: Blessed are the peace makers, for they shalbe called the chyldren of god.
column8: Blessed Are the peace makers, for they shall called the children of god.

column7: Blessed are they which suffre persecution for righteousnes sake, for theyrs is the kingdome of heauen. <NOTE> Blessed are ye when men reuile you and persecute you, and shal falsely say all maner of euel sayinges agaynst you for my sake.
column8: Blessed Are they which suffer persecution for righteousness sake, for theirs is the Kingdom of heaven. Blessed Are you when men revile you and persecute you, and shall falsely say all manner of evil sayings against you for my sake.

column7: <NOTE> Reioyce and be glad, for greate is your rewarde in heauen. THE EXPOSITION.
column8: Rejoice and be glad, for great is your reward in heaven. THE EXPOSITION.

column7: WE muste verye diligently (deere christians) obserue and note in this gospell,
column8: WE must very diligently (deer Christians) observe and note in this gospel,

column7: <NOTE> that when Christe saw the people and his disciples were come vp to him, he maketh vnto them a godly and, fruteful sermon, whiche comprehendeth in a maner all thinges that are necessary for a christian man to do spiritually before god.
column8: that when Christ saw the people and his Disciples were come up to him, he makes unto them a godly and, fruitful sermon, which comprehendeth in a manner all things that Are necessary for a christian man to do spiritually before god.

column7: For by this sermon we may see how diligent Christ was in administrynge his office, and feeding his shepe.
column8: For by this sermon we may see how diligent christ was in administering his office, and feeding his sheep.

column7: Furthermore we muste needes confesse, that as al that Christ taughte and preached, was bothe good and helthsome, so no sermon that euer he made, is more diligenlye and perfectlye written, then this in the mounte, and that which he made after his last supper.
column8: Furthermore we must needs confess, that as all that christ taught and preached, was both good and healthsome, so no sermon that ever he made, is more diligenlye and perfectly written, then this in the mount, and that which he made After his last supper.

column7: Surely by this his example Christ would not only teache the ministers of his worde with all diligence faithfull to attende their office, but also that all that they teache, they shuld teache it faithfullye & driue it into ye peoples eares, as we se that Christ dyd here in this gospell.
column8: Surely by this his Exampl christ would not only teach the Ministers of his word with all diligence faithful to attend their office, but also that all that they teach, they should teach it faithfully & driven it into the peoples ears, as we see that christ did Here in this gospel.

column7: Let vs then see what was the beginning of Christes doctrin, in this his most excellent and noble sermon.
column8: Let us then see what was the beginning of Christ's Doctrine, in this his most excellent and noble sermon.

column7: Fyrst, <NOTE> Christ promiseth the kingdome of heauen and saluacion to the poore in spirite.
column8: Fyrst, christ promises the Kingdom of heaven and salvation to the poor in Spirit.

column7: But what signifieth it to be poore in spirite?
column8: But what signifies it to be poor in Spirit?

column7: The poore in spirit are those, that cleaue to no transitory thing of thys worlde, that set their confidence in no creature, that are deade vnto the worlde, and leaue and whollye put their faith in Christ and his worde.
column8: The poor in Spirit Are those, that cleave to no transitory thing of this world, that Set their confidence in no creature, that Are dead unto the world, and leave and wholly put their faith in christ and his word.

column7: Vpon such poore shall the spiryte of the lorde reste, as the prophete Esaias saith.
column8: Upon such poor shall the Spirit of the lord rest, as the Prophet Isaiah Says.

column7: These poore receiue the gospel,
column8: These poor receive the gospel,

column7: <NOTE> as our Sauiour said to the disciples of Iohn.
column8: as our Saviour said to the Disciples of John.
