column7: And furthermore suche pore men are so deerely beloued of god, that he promiseth peculier gyftes and synguler graces to such as do them ony benefite, as ye maye reade in the 40 Psal.
column8: And furthermore such poor men Are so dearly Beloved of god, that he promises peculiar Gifts and singular graces to such as do them only benefit, as you may read in the 40 Psalm

column7: And suche pore are not proud in the ymaginacio of their own hartes.
column8: And such poor Are not proud in the ymaginacio of their own hearts.

column7: Thei contemn no man, thei dispise no man, but are lowly and meeke, euen frome the hearte.
column8: They contemn no man, they despise no man, but Are lowly and meek, even from the heart.

column7: Wherefore they shal haue as Christ promiseth here, the kyngdome of heuen, wher as all hypocrites that swell by their outward righteousnes,
column8: Wherefore they shall have as christ promises Here, the Kingdom of heaven, where as all Hypocrites that swell by their outward righteousness,

column7: & for the same preferre them selues before al other, shal haue perpetual fire and euerlasting damnacion.
column8: & for the same prefer them selves before all other, shall have perpetual fire and everlasting damnation.

column7: Secondly, Christ promiseth to those that morne, comforte, heere by the spirite, and in the worlde to come eternal life and the kingdome of heauen.
column8: Secondly, christ promises to those that morn, Comfort, Here by the Spirit, and in the world to come Eternal life and the Kingdom of heaven.

column7: But what signifieth here this word.
column8: But what signifies Here this word.

column7: To mourn? Doubtles the same, yt Christ speaketh on in another place,
column8: To mourn? Doubtless the same, that christ speaks on in Another place,

column7: <NOTE> saying: You shal morne & wepe, but the worlde shal be gladde.
column8: saying: You shall morn & weep, but the world shall be glad.

column7: Nowe is this as cleare as mydde daye, neyther can any manne denaye yt, that suche as confesse Christe and beleue his woorde,
column8: Now is this as clear as mid day, neither can any man denay that, that such as confess Christ and believe his word,

column7: <NOTE> the crosse hangeth euer vppon them, and they are diuers and many wayes tempted, sometyme on the one syde, sometyme on the other, that euer they fynde Chrystes worde trewe,
column8: the cross hangs ever upon them, and they Are diverse and many ways tempted, sometime on the one side, sometime on the other, that ever they find Christ's word true,

column7: <NOTE> whiche sayd: Ye shall haue tribulacion in the worlde.
column8: which said: You shall have tribulation in the world.

column7: Wherefore, excepte in these so greate troubles and vexacions as christian man had some comforte and these great and excellent promises, howe could he abyde all these thinges?
column8: Wherefore, except in these so great Troubles and vexations as christian man had Some Comfort and these great and excellent promises, how could he abide all these things?

column7: Howe coulde he contynew stedfast?
column8: Howe could he continue steadfast?

column7: For suerlye the crosse is not so sweet and pleasaunte to the fleshe, that it will freerely and with a glad mynde come vnder it and suffre it. <NOTE> Needes must the spirite come, whiche therefore is called of Christ, the Comforter, bicause that in tribulacion he comforteth the sorowful.
column8: For surly the cross is not so sweet and pleasant to the Flesh, that it will freerely and with a glad mind come under it and suffer it. Needs must the Spirit come, which Therefore is called of christ, the Comforter, Because that in tribulation he comforts the sorrowful.

column7: And also though we haue the spirite, yet must the word be applied and diligently put in our myndes, least we waxe slothfull sluggardes, and liuers in a careles securitee.
column8: And also though we have the Spirit, yet must the word be applied and diligently put in our minds, lest we wax slothful sluggards, and livers in a careless security.

column7: And to this purpose serueth this sentence of Christe, which promiseth eternall consolacion to those that mourne.
column8: And to this purpose serveth this sentence of Christ, which promises Eternal consolation to those that mourn.

column7: Here in this lyfe they shal be comforted by his worde, and in the worlde to come, by his blesse and eternall lyfe.
column8: Here in this life they shall be comforted by his word, and in the world to come, by his bless and Eternal life.

column7: Nowe thys promise, so ful of comforte maketh a man glad minded, so that he is more ready to suffre and abide, eue with a glad heart, the crosse that god shal please to laye vpon him.
column8: Now this promise, so full of Comfort makes a man glad minded, so that he is more ready to suffer and abide, eve with a glad heart, the cross that god shall please to say upon him.

column7: <NOTE> Thirdly, Christ promiseth to those that ar meke the possession of the lande, and blessednes.
column8: Thirdly, christ promises to those that Are meek the possession of the land, and blessedness.

column7: Nowe to be meke is not only when a man is not angrye, but also when hee canne represse and refrayne hys wrathe, hadde he neuer so iust a cause to bee discontented and angrye.
column8: Now to be meek is not only when a man is not angry, but also when he can repress and refrain his wrath, had he never so just a cause to be discontented and angry.

column7: Of suche angre the prophete Dauid saithe:
column8: Of such anger the Prophet David Saith:

column7: <NOTE> Be yee angrye, but synne not.
column8: Be ye angry, but sin not.

column7: For to be neuer angry at all, it is impossible for suche as lyue heere in this bodye.
column8: For to be never angry At all, it is impossible for such as live Here in this body.

column7: For why? wrathe is euen borne in vs, as are also all other vices:
column8: For why? wrath is even born in us, as Are also all other vices:

column7: so that wee canne not vtterly laye it from vs.
column8: so that we can not utterly say it from us

column7: <NOTE> Suerlye it were our duety and very right, that we shulde contynue euer in meekenes and gentlenes, and neuer be angrye. (I speake of suche angre, as hathe adioyned enuy with it) But I praye you, where are thei that so can moderate themselues?
column8: Surly it were our duty and very right, that we should continue ever in meekness and gentleness, and never be angry. (I speak of such anger, as hath adjoined envy with it) But I pray you, where Are they that so can moderate themselves?

column7: <NOTE> Therefore S. Paule saith:
column8: Therefore S. Paul Says:

column7: Let not the sonne go down vpon your wrath.
column8: Let not the son go down upon your wrath.

column7: A father is angry with his sonne, but yet commonly the fatherly loue continueth in his harte.
column8: A father is angry with his son, but yet commonly the fatherly love Continueth in his heart.

column7: A master is angrye with his seruaunte and scholer, but it commeth of a good affection.
column8: A master is angry with his servant and scholar, but it comes of a good affection.

column7: Euen so maye one christian man be angry wyth an other, and rebuke, correct, and shewe him his faulte, but with this angre muste charity be admyxed.
column8: Eve so may one christian man be angry with an other, and rebuke, correct, and show him his fault, but with this anger must charity be admyxed.

column7: Bryefely, CHRIST requyreth this meekenes of his disciples, sayinge:
column8: Briefly, CHRIST requireth this meekness of his Disciples, saying:

column7: Learne of me, for I am meeke and lowely in heart.
column8: Learn of me, for I am meek and lowly in heart.

column7: <NOTE> And here he promyseth to the meeke, saluacion and possession of the lande.
column8: And Here he promiseth to the meek, salvation and possession of the land.

column7: Who wyll not nowe with all dilygence laboure for faythe, whereoute springeth this vertue? <NOTE>
column8: Who will not now with all diligence labour for faith, whereout springs this virtue?

column7: Manye interprete spirituallye the possession of the lande, as when the Prophete Dauyd saythe:
column8: Many interpret spiritually the possession of the land, as when the Prophet David say:

column7: I beeleue to see the Lorde, in the lande of the lyuynge.
column8: I beeleue to see the Lord, in the land of the living.

column7: Other vnderstande it corporallye, sygnyfiynge that the gentle and meeke menne keepeth better his goodes and possessiones, then hee that wyll lawe for euerye trifle, and wyll not loose so muche as the parynge of hys nayle.
column8: Other understand it corporally, sygnyfiynge that the gentle and meek men Keepeth better his goods and Possessions, then he that will law for every trifle, and will not lose so much as the paring of his nail.

column7: Truthe it is that Moyses beynge a moste lowelye and gentle person,
column8: Truth it is that Moses being a most lowly and gentle person,

column7: <NOTE> accomplished excellent affaires, yea thoughe hee were the meekest man that dwelleth vpon earth.
column8: accomplished excellent affairs, yea though he were the Meekest man that dwells upon earth.

column7: And also either of these vnderstandinges is good and profitable.
column8: And also either of these understandings is good and profitable.

column7: <NOTE> Fourthly,
column8: Fourthly,

column7: Christ pronounceth them blessed that hungre and thirste for righteousnes, addyng thys promise:
column8: christ pronounceth them blessed that hunger and thirst for righteousness, adding this promise:

column7: That they shall be satisfied.
column8: That they shall be satisfied.

column7: Nowe standeth thys hungre and thyrst in thys pointe, that I dyspayre of my selfe and all my strengthes, shall knoweledge my corrupte nature, myne inabilitee, syckenes, synne and infirmitie, and allonly desyre that righteousnes that is of valewe before god.
column8: Now Stands this hunger and thirst in this point, that I despair of my self and all my strength's, shall knowledge my corrupt nature, mine inabilitee, sickness, sin and infirmity, and allonly desire that righteousness that is of valve before god.

column7: Surely this acknowledgyng of our selues, dothe highly please god, yea & for to bringe vs vnto this knowledg hath he giuen the lawe, and willeth that the preaching of penance shuld procede & go before the preaching of forgiuenes of sinnes, as it is plain in the gospel of S.
column8: Surely this acknowledging of our selves, doth highly please god, yea & for to bring us unto this knowledge hath he given the law, and wills that the preaching of penance should proceed & go before the preaching of forgiveness of Sins, as it is plain in the gospel of S.

column7: Luc. that we might so much the soner attaine vnto this hunger & thirste of righteousnes.
column8: Luke that we might so much the sooner attain unto this hunger & thirst of righteousness.

column7: <NOTE> And doubtles needes must we be thus hungry and thyrsty for righteousnes, or els we shall euer want it, that is, we shall neuer be made righteousnes.
column8: And doubtless needs must we be thus hungry and thirsty for righteousness, or Else we shall ever want it, that is, we shall never be made righteousness.

column7: But to be briefe. When thorow preachinge of penaunce we are vtterly ouerthrowen, so that al togither wee dyspayre of oure selues, and begynne to seeke our righteousnes in CHRIST, thys promise standeth stedfast, that wee shall bee satysfyed.
column8: But to be brief. When thorough preaching of penance we Are utterly overthrown, so that all together we despair of our selves, and begin to seek our righteousness in CHRIST, this promise Stands steadfast, that we shall be satisfied.

column7: Contraryly yf we haue not thys hungre, thyrst, knowlege & desire, behold the vyrgin Mary saith thus:
column8: Contrarily if we have not this hunger, thirst, knowledge & desire, behold the Virgin Marry Says thus:

column7: He hath sent away the ryche emptye.
column8: He hath sent away the rich empty.

column7: <NOTE> Fiftely, Christe also in the gospell pronounceth that the mercifull men are blessed.
column8: Fifty, Christ also in the gospel pronounceth that the merciful men Are blessed.

column7: To bee merciful, is asmuch, as to be ready to forgiue & remit, as often as our neighbour doth vs iniurye or angreth vs, or prouoketh vs vnto displeasure.
column8: To be merciful, is as, as to be ready to forgive & remit, as often as our neighbour does us injury or angereth us, or provoketh us unto displeasure.

column7: And thys mercifulnes is so necessary for a christen man, that he ca not obtain forgiuenes of his sins, except he also first forgiue his neighbour such trespasses as he hath comitted against him:
column8: And this mercifulness is so necessary for a christian man, that he circa not obtain forgiveness of his Sins, except he also First forgive his neighbour such Trespasses as he hath committed against him:

column7: yet not by this mercy & merite of the same do we obtaine, get or deserue forgiuenes of of our sins, for yt haue we by only fayth, but God wolde, that I shulde by this forgiuenes testify my faith.
column8: yet not by this mercy & merit of the same do we obtain, get or deserve forgiveness of of our Sins, for that have we by only faith, but God would, that I should by this forgiveness testify my faith.

column7: Now whe I declare my faith by so forgiuig my neighbour, what wil Christ do toward me?
column8: Now when I declare my faith by so forgiuig my neighbour, what will christ do towards me?

column7: I shall also haue mercy as Christ saith in this gospel.
column8: I shall also have mercy as christ Says in this gospel.

column7: And as he saith in another place:
column8: And as he Says in Another place:

column7: <NOTE> Forgiue & it shalbe forgiuen you.
column8: Forgive & it shall forgiven you.

column7: But now whe I wil not for giue, no more shal I obtain mercy,
column8: But now when I will not for give, no more shall I obtain mercy,

column7: & therfore vtterly fall out of all the fauour of god the father.
column8: & Therefore utterly fallen out of all the favour of god the father.

column7: Sixtly, the clean & pure in heart are blessed.
column8: Sixty, the clean & pure in heart Are blessed.

column7: <NOTE> But who is cleane in hert, seyng that the scripture saith:
column8: But who is clean in heart, sing that the scripture Says:

column7: There is none that doth good, no there is none at al?
column8: There is none that does good, no there is none At all?

column7: Also none is good (that is) clean, but alone god Doutles it is truth, that by nature we are sinners, neither can we do any thyng that is good, ye and also after yt we haue receaued ye holy ghost, yet remained in vs concupiscens or vnlawful lust,
column8: Also none is good (that is) clean, but alone god Doubtless it is truth, that by nature we Are Sinners, neither can we do any thing that is good, you and also After that we have received you holy ghost, yet remained in us concupiscens or unlawful lust,

column7: <NOTE> with who wee muste euer wrestle and fighte against it.
column8: with who we must ever wrestle and fight against it.

column7: Yet thys comforte haue we when wee ones come to the knowledge of Christe, and haue by faith set hande vppon hys promyse, by partakinge with hym wee be very christians, and also pure in hearte.
column8: Yet this Comfort have we when we ones come to the knowledge of Christ, and have by faith Set hand upon his promise, by partaking with him we be very Christians, and also pure in heart.

column7: <NOTE> For as Sainct Peter saithe:
column8: For as Saint Peter Saith:

column7: By faith are purified our hearts.
column8: By faith Are purified our hearts.

column7: Furthermore, although the hart by faith be purified, yet there remaineth in vs the remnant of synne and concupiscens, which daylye sore trouble vs, but for faith, they are not imputed vnto vs.
column8: Furthermore, although the heart by faith be purified, yet there remains in us the remnant of sin and concupiscens, which daily soar trouble us, but for faith, they Are not imputed unto us

column7: As S. Paule testifieth, <NOTE> saying:
column8: As S. Paul Testifieth, saying:

column7: Then now there is no condemnacion to suche as are in Christ Iesu.
column8: Then now there is no condemnation to such as Are in christ Jesu.

column7: Therfore we are fully assured, if we haue faith, that wee shall se god in this worlde by faith in his word, and in the world to come face vnto face. Seuenthly, Christe calleth those blessed, that ar the makers of peace.
column8: Therefore we Are Fully assured, if we have faith, that we shall see god in this world by faith in his word, and in the world to come face unto face. Seuenthly, Christ calls those blessed, that Are the makers of peace.

column7: <NOTE> Those are makers of peace, that euer counsayl peace, that reconcyle men that be fallen out, and set them againe at one, and studiouslye take heede to kepe and conserue peace.
column8: Those Are makers of peace, that ever counsel peace, that reconcile men that be fallen out, and Set them again At one, and studiously take heed to keep and conserve peace.

column7: Suche are called peacemakers. And suche men do especially please god, chiefly bycause this vertu cometh of faithe, and hathe his roote and springinge out of faith, and therfore bycause that in this thing they folowe the example of his beloued sonne oure lorde Iesu Christe.
column8: Such Are called peacemakers. And such men do especially please god, chiefly Because this virtue comes of faith, and hath his root and springing out of faith, and Therefore Because that in this thing they follow the Exampl of his Beloved son our lord Jesu Christ.

column7: What did he? When wee were yet enemyes (saith S.
column8: What did he? When we were yet enemies (Says S.

column7: Paul) he reconcyled vs vnto his father, opened to vs the heauens, and by the effusion of his bloude, of mere and free grace, hee washed away all our sinnes, that we apprehending this by faithe, myght obtaine righteousnes, and so euer more folowe the same example in our deedes.
column8: Paul) he reconciled us unto his father, opened to us the heavens, and by the effusion of his blood, of mere and free grace, he washed away all our Sins, that we apprehending this by faith, might obtain righteousness, and so ever more follow the same Exampl in our Deeds.

column7: Nowe when do we this?
column8: Now when do we this?

column7: When with al harty study we endeuour our selues to conserue peace, and that amonge all men brotherly loue may be continued.
column8: When with all hearty study we endeavour our selves to conserve peace, and that among all men brotherly love may be continued.

column7: But what shall be the rewarde of this vertu?
column8: But what shall be the reward of this virtue?

column7: what gyfte shall bee gyuen for it?
column8: what gift shall be given for it?

column7: Wee shall be called the sonnes of god, and wee shall possesse eternall lyfe.
column8: we shall be called the Sons of god, and we shall possess Eternal life.

column7: Eightly, Christ also calleth those blessed that suffre persecution, and are despised for his sake, which in deede oughte to giue greate comfort to christian men putte vnder the crosse and tribulation. <NOTE>
column8: Eighth, christ also calls those blessed that suffer persecution, and Are despised for his sake, which in deed ought to give great Comfort to christian men put under the cross and tribulation.

column7: Whye are we so vexed and full of sorowe in temporall afflyctions, seynge that Christe wyll by theim bring vs into heauen, where wee shal perpetually raigne with hym?
column8: Why Are we so vexed and full of sorrow in temporal afflictions, sing that Christ will by them bring us into heaven, where we shall perpetually Reign with him?

column7: Trulye this temporall crosse canne in no meanes bee compared vnto the euerlastinge ioye.
column8: Truly this temporal cross can in no means be compared unto the everlasting joy.

column7: Marke wel that he saith:
column8: Mark well that he Says:

column7: For my names sake. Also When men speake all euell against you, belyinge you.
column8: For my names sake. Also When men speak all evil against you, belying you.

column7: For he that is an euell dooer, and according to hys deseruyng suffereth for it, although he loke to this promyse, it shall lytle profyte hym.
column8: For he that is an evil doer, and according to his deserving suffers for it, although he look to this promise, it shall little profit him.

column7: Thou muste needes suffre in a good quarrell, that thou mayest be sure, that all that shall chaunce to thee, happeneth for the truthes sake.
column8: Thou must needs suffer in a good quarrel, that thou Mayest be sure, that all that shall chance to thee, Happeneth for the truths sake.

column7: Euen as Sainct Peter also saith:
column8: Eve as Saint Peter also Says:

column7: Let none of you suffre as a murtherer or a thefe, or as an euell dooer, or as a busye body in other mens maters.
column8: Let none of you suffer as a murderer or a thief, or as an evil doer, or as a busy body in other men's maters.

column7: Wherfore if thy cause bee good, thou mayest assuredly haue this hope, that this trouble and sufferynge shall be rewarded and recompensed with euerlastynge ioye.
column8: Wherefore if thy cause be good, thou Mayest assuredly have this hope, that this trouble and suffering shall be rewarded and recompensed with everlasting joy.

column7: Which almyghty God graunt vs through Iesus Christ.
column8: Which almighty God grant us through jesus christ.

column7: AMEN. The gospel vpon S.
column8: AMEN. The gospel upon S.

column7: Markes day. Iohn. 15.
column8: Marks day. John. 15.

column7: I Am the true vyne, and my father is the husband man.
column8: I Am the true vine, and my father is the husband man.

column7: Euery branche that beareth not frute in me, hee wyll take away And euery braunche that beareth fruyt, wyll he pourg, that it may bryng forth more frute.
column8: Every branch that bears not fruit in me, he will take away And every branch that bears fruit, will he pourg, that it may bring forth more fruit.

column7: <NOTE> Now are ye cleane thorow the words which I haue spoken vnto you.
column8: Now Are you clean thorough the words which I have spoken unto you.

column7: Byde in me, and I in you.
column8: Bide in me, and I in you.

column7: As the branch can not beare frute of it selfe, excepte it byde in the vyne, no more can ye, except ye abide in me.
column8: As the branch can not bear fruit of it self, except it bide in the vine, no more can you, except you abide in me.

column7: I am the vine, ye are the branches.
column8: I am the vine, you Are the branches.

column7: He that abydeth in me, and I in him, the same bringeth forthe muche frute.
column8: He that Abideth in me, and I in him, the same brings forth much fruit.

column7: For without me ye can do nothyng:
column8: For without me you can do nothing:

column7: if a man byde not in me, he is caste furth as a branche and is wythered:
column8: if a man bide not in me, he is cast forth as a branch and is withered:

column7: and men gather them, and caste them into the fyer, and they burne.
column8: and men gather them, and cast them into the fire, and they burn.

column7: <NOTE> If ye byde in me, and my wordes abyde in you, aske what ye wyll, and it shall be doone for you. THE EXPOSITION.
column8: If you bide in me, and my words abide in you, ask what you will, and it shall be done for you. THE EXPOSITION.

column7: WE haue in this gospel a very comfortable lesso for all them that ar true & faithfull christen people, wherin Christ exhorted al his vniuersal church to remain in him comparing him self vnto a vyne tre,
column8: WE have in this gospel a very comfortable Lesson for all them that Are true & faithful christian people, wherein christ exhorted all his universal Church to remain in him comparing him self unto a vine Tree,

column7: & his louers vnto branches.
column8: & his lovers unto branches.

column7: Which similitude hath bin vsed in ye old testament also, wher god called the house of Israel, that is the church of god a vineyard,
column8: Which similitude hath been used in you old Testament also, where god called the house of Israel, that is the Church of god a vineyard,

column7: <NOTE> as euidetly may be seene in ye prophets.
column8: as euidetly may be seen in you Prophets.

column7: And as Christ in the gospel of Mat. doth declare a vineyard to be his church, so in this place he called it a vineyard also,
column8: And as christ in the gospel of Mathew does declare a vineyard to be his Church, so in this place he called it a vineyard also,

column7: & god ye father, an husbandma,
column8: & god you father, an husbandma,

column7: & him self he called ye vinetre, his Apostels & euery membre of his church, braches.
column8: & him self he called you vinetre, his Apostles & every member of his Church, branches.

column7: Let vs therfore apply & compare one wt the other,
column8: Let us Therefore apply & compare one with the other,

column7: & se how thei do agree.
column8: & see how they do agree.

column7: For as the vineyard is not ordained for to beare thornes and thystels, but that the vine trees should be planted in it for to beare fruites, so the church is ordained, not to florishe with ye riches of this worlde (whiche verely are thornes) but for to plante Christ in it.
column8: For as the vineyard is not ordained for to bear thorns and thystels, but that the vine trees should be planted in it for to bear fruits, so the Church is ordained, not to flourish with you riches of this world (which verily Are thorns) but for to plant christ in it.

column7: For as the husband man doth make cleane the ground of the vyneyard, and doth plante in it vyne trees, and doth hedge it round aboute, maketh a presse, and buyldeth a tower in it, purgeth & maketh cleane the braunches, that they may brynge furth fruite plentifullye, so likewyse God the father hath chosen to him selfe fro among men a church, in the whiche he hath planted Christ his sonne, whiche garden he also hath strengthned with an inuincible stone, namely Christ, against whiche stone or tower eue the gates of hell can not preuaile.
column8: For as the husband man does make clean the ground of the Vineyard, and does plant in it vine trees, and does hedge it round about, makes a press, and buildeth a tower in it, Purgeth & makes clean the branches, that they may bring forth fruit plentifully, so likewise God the father hath chosen to him self from among men a Church, in the which he hath planted christ his son, which garden he also hath strengthened with an invincible stone, namely christ, against which stone or tower eve the gates of hell can not prevail.

column7: For eue as when the godly be regenerate in Christ, so he dothe purge and make cleane their heartes that they may bryng furth fruite.
column8: For eve as when the godly be regenerate in christ, so he doth purge and make clean their hearts that they may bring forth fruit.

column7: In this vyne tree there be ii. kyndes of braunches or sortes of men, for some haue a shape of godlines & seme to beleue in Christ, and to be special in Christes churche, hearyng sermons, receiuyng the sacraments,
column8: In this vine tree there be ii. Kinds of branches or sorts of men, for Some have a shape of godliness & seem to believe in christ, and to be special in Christ's Church, hearing Sermons, receiving the Sacraments,

column7: & do many good woorkes, and yet they do not truely beleue in Christ, nor yet their woorkes do not procede out of a true fayth.
column8: & do many good works, and yet they do not truly believe in christ, nor yet their works do not proceed out of a true faith.

column7: These be hypocritical & vnfruitful braches, which shal at ye length be cast into euerlastyng fyre.
column8: These be hypocritical & unfruitful branches, which shall At you length be cast into everlasting fire.

column7: There be some also without repetance, whiche beare the name of christian men,
column8: There be Some also without Repentance, which bear the name of christian men,

column7: & yet do most abound & are indued with moste horrible & shameful crymes.
column8: & yet do most abound & Are endued with most horrible & shameful crimes.

column7: Some there be that are godly,
column8: some there be that Are godly,

column7: & euen as they verely beleue in Christ, so verely they worke by faythe,
column8: & even as they verily believe in christ, so verily they work by faith,

column7: & brynge furthe fruit, that alway doth remayne.
column8: & bring forth fruit, that always does remain.

column7: And this difference ought chiefly to be marked.
column8: And this difference ought chiefly to be marked.

column7: The vngodly & wicked speaketh moste pestiferously of Christes churche, for because yt they se in it many impure & wicked men, for whose sakes they thinke that the churche of Christ is not ye true church, nor that it hath not the true Gospel.
column8: The ungodly & wicked speaks most pestiferously of Christ's Church, for Because that they see in it many impure & wicked men, for whose sakes they think that the Church of christ is not the true Church, nor that it hath not the true Gospel.

column7: But they that so do condempne the true churche, forbecause it is admixed with euil persons, are here againe condempned with this sermon of Christ.
column8: But they that so do condemn the true Church, forbecause it is admixed with evil Persons, Are Here again condemned with this sermon of christ.

column7: For truely Christ speakyng of the braunches, doth not speake of those, that with their open profession be separated and deuided from the churche, as the Iewes and Turkes, but of those whiche be or seme to be in the vyne tre,
column8: For truly christ speaking of the branches, does not speak of those, that with their open profession be separated and divided from the Church, as the Jews and Turkes, but of those which be or seem to be in the vine Tree,

column7: Christ. And of these he maketh two sortes, <NOTE> some of theim be barraine,
column8: christ. And of these he makes two sorts, Some of them be barren,

column7: & some fruitfull. By the whiche he teacheth very plainly, that the churche here vpon yearth hath comixed with her many euil persons, whiche although they seme to bee the very membres of Christ, yet they bee but braunches to be cutte away, and to be cast into the fyre.
column8: & Some fruitful. By the which he Teaches very plainly, that the Church Here upon earth hath comixed with her many evil Persons, which although they seem to be the very members of christ, yet they be but branches to be Cut away, and to be cast into the fire.

column7: He sayth, that the kyngdom of heauen is likened vnto a manne whiche soweth good seede in his felde.
column8: He say, that the Kingdom of heaven is likened unto a man which Soweth good seed in his field.

column7: But whylest the man was a slepe his enemy came, and did sowe cockle among the wheate.
column8: But whilst the man was a sleep his enemy Come, and did sow cockle among the wheat.

column7: And againe, the kyngdome of heauen is likened vnto a lytle nette that is cast into the sea, whiche did pull vp all kynde of fyshes.
column8: And again, the Kingdom of heaven is likened unto a little net that is cast into the sea, which did pull up all kind of fishes.

column7: And in another place. A certayne man went into the mariage, whiche had not his mariage garment.
column8: And in Another place. A certain man went into the marriage, which had not his marriage garment.

column7: And sainct Iho sayd. They went out from vs, but they were not of vs.
column8: And saint Who said. They went out from us, but they were not of us

column7: But I pray you what becommeth of these braunches that bryngeth furth fruite?
column8: But I pray you what becomes of these branches that bringeth forth fruit?

column7: He sayth: He purgeth it and maketh it cleane, to bryng furth fruite more plenteously.
column8: He say: He Purgeth it and makes it clean, to bring forth fruit more plenteously.

column7: <NOTE> Braunches whiche be fruitfull and profitable in the church, be all those that truely beleue in Christe, and of a true fayth doth obay vnto the true callyng of God.
column8: Branches which be fruitful and profitable in the Church, be all those that truly believe in Christ, and of a true faith does obey unto the true calling of God.

column7: This braunche is not cast away, is not taken away, as the fyrst was, but is cut with a hoke, and is made cleane.
column8: This branch is not cast away, is not taken away, as the fyrst was, but is Cut with a hoke, and is made clean.

column7: Secodarily, Nowe are ye cleane (sayth Christe) because of the worde that I haue spoken vnto you.
column8: Secondarily, Now Are you clean (say Christ) Because of the word that I have spoken unto you.

column7: I beseche the, what meaneth these wordes?
column8: I beseech thee, what means these words?

column7: Be the Apostles pure and cleane braunches, when as yet they were synners, and ready immediatly to leaue their mayster Christ, and to deny him?
column8: Be the Apostles pure and clean branches, when as yet they were Sinners, and ready immediately to leave their master christ, and to deny him?

column7: I say ye are cleane, not forbecause of your owne fleshe, whiche is yet synfull, nor for the puritie & cleanesse of your righteousnes, whiche is myngled with muche impuritne and vncleanes, but for the worde which I haue spoken vnto you (sayth Christ,) That is, for my gospel, whiche I haue shewed vnto you, that is to say, that I am the very true Messias, and satisfaction for synne, whiche with my death hath kepte you from death, whiche hath taken vpon me the horriblenes of hell, that I might deliuer you from hell, yea, and I haue purchased for you of God my father, that he shall take you for his children, sones and heyres of the heauenly kyngdome.
column8: I say you Are clean, not forbecause of your own Flesh, which is yet sinful, nor for the purity & cleanesse of your righteousness, which is mingled with much impuritne and uncleans, but for the word which I have spoken unto you (say christ,) That is, for my gospel, which I have showed unto you, that is to say, that I am the very true Messias, and satisfaction for sin, which with my death hath kept you from death, which hath taken upon me the horribleness of hell, that I might deliver you from hell, yea, and I have purchased for you of God my father, that he shall take you for his children, Sons and Heirs of the heavenly Kingdom.

column7: And this is the worde, by the whiche man is verely purifyed & made cleane, if it be receyued by fayth.
column8: And this is the word, by the which man is verily purified & made clean, if it be received by faith.

column7: Fyrst who soeuer doth receiue this woorde of the Gospell by fayth, he is accopted before God for very iust, pure, and holy, and that not for the workes of righteousnes whiche wee doo, but onely for Iesus Christ the sonne of God, receyued by fayth.
column8: Fyrst who soever does receive this word of the Gospel by faith, he is accopted before God for very just, pure, and holy, and that not for the works of righteousness which we do, but only for jesus christ the son of God, received by faith.

column7: S. Paule sayth, they be made righteous, frely by his grace, by the redempcion whiche is in Christ Iesu, whiche God hath put as attonement maker by f^yth, his bloud beyng a meane.
column8: S. Paul say, they be made righteous, freely by his grace, by the redemption which is in christ Jesu, which God hath put as atonement maker by f^yth, his blood being a mean.

column7: Therfore, whosoeuer doth beleue ye worde of the gospel of Christ, although that synne doth styll remayne in his fleshe, yet sinne is not imputed vnto him, so that he nowe may be iust before God, not with his owne righteousnes, but with an others righteousnes, that is, the righteousnes of Iesu Christe, whiche is geuen vnto him by fayth.
column8: Therefore, whosoever does believe you word of the gospel of christ, although that sin does still remain in his Flesh, yet sin is not imputed unto him, so that he now may be just before God, not with his own righteousness, but with an Others righteousness, that is, the righteousness of Jesu Christ, which is given unto him by faith.

column7: For blessed is that man, to whom God doth not impute synne.
column8: For blessed is that man, to whom God does not impute sin.

column7: Furthermore, whosoeuer receiueth the woorde of the Gospell by faythe (whiche is geuen by ye holy ghost) whiche shal mortifie the remnates of the fleshe, <NOTE> & shal so rule synne, yt it shal not reigne in our mortal bodyes.
column8: Furthermore, whosoever receiveth the word of the Gospel by faith (which is given by you holy ghost) which shall mortify the remnates of the Flesh, & shall so Rule sin, that it shall not Reign in our Mortal bodies.

column7: Therfore the holy ghost is ye very true houke, with the whiche the braunches be purged, and that by the woordes of the Gospell.
column8: Therefore the holy ghost is the very true houke, with the which the branches be purged, and that by the words of the Gospel.

column7: Fyrst that by fayth wee may bee accompted before God, iust for Christes sake:
column8: Fyrst that by faith we may be accounted before God, just for Christ's sake:

column7: Secondly, yt the deedes of the fleshe may be mortified,
column8: Secondly, that the Deeds of the Flesh may be mortified,

column7: & the lustes of synne be quenched.
column8: & the lusts of sin be quenched.

column7: And although it can not be done in this life, that synne wholly might be pulled vp out of the fleshe, yet it may bee done through the holy ghost, that synne shal be paired away, and the fruit of it destroyed, so that we shall not walke after the fleshe, but after the spirite.
column8: And although it can not be done in this life, that sin wholly might be pulled up out of the Flesh, yet it may be done through the holy ghost, that sin shall be paired away, and the fruit of it destroyed, so that we shall not walk After the Flesh, but After the Spirit.

column7: In conclusion, whosoeuer doth receiue the worde of the gospel by fayth, he shalbe troubled with many afflictions and persecusions in this worlde.
column8: In conclusion, whosoever does receive the word of the gospel by faith, he shall troubled with many afflictions and persecusions in this world.

column7: Christ sayth: If they haue persecuted me, they shall persecute you.
column8: christ say: If they have persecuted me, they shall persecute you.

column7: And in an other place:
column8: And in an other place:

column7: We must by many tribulacions (sayth he) entre into the kyngdome of God. <NOTE> Wherfore, afflictions are to be accopted among those houkes with the whiche the heauenlye father dothe purge his braunches.
column8: We must by many tribulations (say he) enter into the Kingdom of God. Wherefore, afflictions Are to be accopted among those houkes with the which the heavenly father doth purge his branches.

column7: The keper of the vyneyard cutteth away the braunches with an houke, not for to hurte theim and so to perishe, but that they might bryng plenteously furth fruite.
column8: The keeper of the Vineyard cutteth away the branches with an houke, not for to hurt them and so to perish, but that they might bring plenteously forth fruit.

column7: <NOTE>
So God the father sendeth to the godly the crosse and afflictions, not that they should perish, but that they should be preseuerued.
column8: So God the father sends to the godly the cross and afflictions, not that they should perish, but that they should be preseuerued.

column7: To this man is sent a crosse, that he should bee admonished of the synne yet remainyng in his fleshe:
column8: To this man is sent a cross, that he should be admonished of the sin yet remaining in his Flesh:

column7: to that man, because he should walke in his vocacion, least synne should reigne in his fleshe:
column8: to that man, Because he should walk in his vocation, lest sin should Reign in his Flesh:

column7: to another, that he should be an example for the amendement of other men, and so to other for other causes, not for this cause, that they should vtterly perishe, but that they should bee deliuered from perishyng, and to attayne eternall health.
column8: to Another, that he should be an Exampl for the amendment of other men, and so to other for other Causes, not for this cause, that they should utterly perish, but that they should be Delivered from perishing, and to attain Eternal health.

column7: When we bee punished with the crosse and misery, wee must go to the vyneyarde, wee must call to remembraunce the cuttyng knyfe or houke of the keper of the vineyarde, and wee must knowe, to what ende they cutte in the vyneyarde, and that ende is thende of affliction, which is accustomed to chance to the godly, that is to say, that they should not bee cast into the fyer, and so to peryshe in the flame, but that they should bee purged, and that as well they might bryng furthe more plentyfully fruite, as to bryng furth and increase.
column8: When we be punished with the cross and misery, we must go to the vineyard, we must call to remembrance the cutting knife or houke of the keeper of the vineyard, and we must know, to what end they Cut in the vineyard, and that end is The end of affliction, which is accustomed to chance to the godly, that is to say, that they should not be cast into the fire, and so to perish in the flame, but that they should be purged, and that as well they might bring forth more plentifully fruit, as to bring forth and increase.

column7: And that it is euen so, that they whiche remayne in the true vynetree, whiche is Christe, might bee purged or made cleane, and bryng furth muche fruite,
column8: And that it is even so, that they which remain in the true vynetree, which is Christ, might be purged or made clean, and bring forth much fruit,

column7: Christe addeth vnto it and sayth:
column8: Christ adds unto it and say:

column7: Tarrye in me, and I in you:
column8: Tarry in me, and I in you:

column7: As the braunche can not beare fruite of him selfe, except he tarry in the vynetree. &c.
column8: As the branch can not bear fruit of him self, except he tarry in the vynetree. etc.

column7: This is as it were an handsonme conclusion of the fyrst exhortacion.
column8: This is as it were an handsonme conclusion of the fyrst exhortation.

column7: I haue sayd that I am the verye true vyne tree.
column8: I have said that I am the very true vine tree.

column7: I haue sayd, that the braunche that taryeth in me shall bryng furth fruite plentifully,
column8: I have said, that the branch that tarrieth in me shall bring forth fruit plentifully,

column7: Therfore I besech you, that you would tary in me, forasmuche as I do tarye in you, and ye shal bryng furth muche fruite.
column8: Therefore I beseech you, that you would tarry in me, forasmuch as I do tarry in you, and you shall bring forth much fruit.

column7: But tell me, howe shall wee tarye in Christe?
column8: But tell me, how shall we tarry in Christ?

column7: Do wee tary in him, when wee do tary in tradicions and commaundementes of men?
column8: Do we tarry in him, when we do tarry in traditions and Commandments of men?

column7: No truly. Christ sayth:
column8: No truly. christ say:

column7: They worship me in vayne with the commaundementes of men.
column8: They worship me in vain with the Commandments of men.

column7: But we tarye in Christ, when we tarry in the woorde of Christ by fayth.
column8: But we tarry in christ, when we tarry in the word of christ by faith.

column7: Whosoeuer beleueth in me (sayth he) kepeth my worde, and my father shall loue him,
column8: Whosoever Believeth in me (say he) Keepeth my word, and my father shall love him,

column7: & we shall come vnto him, and make our dwellyng place with him.
column8: & we shall come unto him, and make our Dwelling place with him.

column7: What benefite dothe chaunce to him that taryeth in Christ?
column8: What benefit doth chance to him that tarrieth in christ?

column7: Fyrst Christ taryeth in him, for he sayth:
column8: Fyrst christ tarrieth in him, for he say:

column7: Tarye in me, & I in you.
column8: Tarry in me, & I in you.

column7: What thyng better or more greatter doest thou seke?
column8: What thing better or more greater dost thou seek?

column7: Whosoeuer hath Christ, hath all the treasure of heauenly goodnesse.
column8: Whosoever hath christ, hath all the treasure of heavenly Goodness.

column7: Sainct Paule sayth: Iesus Christe is made vnto vs from God, wisedome, righteousnes, holynes,
column8: Saint Paul say: jesus Christ is made unto us from God, Wisdom, righteousness, holiness,

column7: & redemption. Therfore whosoeuer hath Christ, is made before God, iust, holy and righteous, and is deliuered from all trouble.
column8: & redemption. Therefore whosoever hath christ, is made before God, just, holy and righteous, and is Delivered from all trouble.

column7: Thyrdly, let vs cosider what fruite the Apostles brought, whiche taryed in Christ.
column8: Thirdly, let us Consider what fruit the Apostles brought, which tarried in christ.

column7: Although the Apostles a lytle whyle after did forsake Christ, by fliyng away from him, and deniyng of him, yet for all that by and by they dyd repent, and they were so ioyneth in couple with Christ, that they did alway continue in him.
column8: Although the Apostles a little while After did forsake christ, by flying away from him, and denying of him, yet for all that by and by they did Repent, and they were so Joineth in couple with christ, that they did always continue in him.

column7: Wherfore they brought furth at the fyrst beginnyng muche fruite, by preachyng of the gospell of Christ.
column8: Wherefore they brought forth At the fyrst beginning much fruit, by preaching of the gospel of christ.

column7: After that they had receyued the gyftes of the holy ghost on Whytsonday, they did sprede abrode the Gospell throughout all the worlde,
column8: After that they had received the Gifts of the holy ghost on Whitsunday, they did spread abroad the Gospel throughout all the world,

column7: & gathered together the churche of Christ, not onely of the Iewes, but also of the Gentiles.
column8: & gathered together the Church of christ, not only of the Jews, but also of the Gentiles.

column7: Sainct Paule sayth, that the gospel was preached among all creatures, which were vnder heaue.
column8: Saint Paul say, that the gospel was preached among all creatures, which were under heave.

column7: And againe: The gospel hath increased euen through the whole worlde.
column8: And again: The gospel hath increased even through the Whole world.

column7: Furthermore, besydes many other godlines and good workes, they brough furth plentyful fruite, in doyng of great miracles, which they did in the name of Christ, whereby Christ did florishe, and the authoritee & truth of Gods worde was highly commended.
column8: Furthermore, besides many other godliness and good works, they borough forth plentyful fruit, in doing of great Miracles, which they did in the name of christ, whereby christ did flourish, and the Authority & truth of God's word was highly commended.

column7: They shewed themselues towardes the Magistrates, as they ought to doo.
column8: They showed themselves towards the Magistrates, as they ought to do.

column7: They loued their neighbours accordyng to the order of charitee.
column8: They loved their neighbours according to the order of charity.

column7: Thei gaue not them selues to gluttony and riotous bankettynges, or to vncleanes & wantonnes.
column8: They gave not them selves to gluttony and riotous banquetings, or to uncleans & wantonness.

column7: Fynally, they did aswell priuately as openly leade a godly life, and suffereth very muche trouble & persecucion for the woorde of God.
column8: Finally, they did aswell privately as openly lead a godly life, and suffers very much trouble & persecution for the word of God.

column7: They were tryed by many mockes and stripes.
column8: They were tried by many mocks and stripes.

column7: They wer cast into prisons and chaynes.
column8: They were cast into prisons and chains.

column7: They suffered much hunger & penury, at the last, they suffered all kynd of persecution and death, and yet they forsoke not their vocation, but the more they were persecuted, the more stronger did they confesse Christ.
column8: They suffered much hunger & penury, At the last, they suffered all kind of persecution and death, and yet they forsook not their vocation, but the more they were persecuted, the more Stronger did they confess christ.

column7: Wherfore they did the rather optayne with Christ his heauenly kyngdom.
column8: Wherefore they did the rather obtain with christ his heavenly Kingdom.

column7: And this is the fruites which the Apostles brought furth, when they did tarye in Christ.
column8: And this is the fruits which the Apostles brought forth, when they did tarry in christ.

column7: Euery man hath his owne fruites tariyng in Christ.
column8: Every man hath his own fruits tarrying in christ.

column7: For he that tarryeth in Christ, he euen at the fyrst beginnyng bryngeth furth fruite by the callyng and confessyng the name of Christ, both by his honest behauiour and with al kindes of godlynes and vertue, by obediece, chastitee, temperance, sobrietie, by true biyng and sellyng,
column8: For he that tarryeth in christ, he even At the fyrst beginning bringeth forth fruit by the calling and confessing the name of christ, both by his honest behaviour and with all Kinds of godliness and virtue, by Obedience, chastity, temperance, sobriety, by true biyng and selling,

column7: & by other such kyndes of vertues.
column8: & by other such Kinds of Virtues.

column7: And these be ye miracles whiche bee nowe required of the godly.
column8: And these be you Miracles which be now required of the godly.

column7: And vndoubtedly whosoeuer doth folow these vertues in this world, bryngeth furth great miracles.
column8: And undoubtedly whosoever does follow these Virtues in this world, bringeth forth great Miracles.

column7: There is so great a multitude of vnshamefast menne, of gluttons and deceyuers in this corruptible worlde, that it is no lesse a miracle to liue among theim, iustly, chastly, shamefastly, and soberly, then it was in tymes past to make a blynd man to see, or els to raise vp a dead man.
column8: There is so great a multitude of unshamefast men, of gluttons and deceivers in this corruptible world, that it is no less a miracle to live among them, justly, chastely, shamefastly, and soberly, then it was in times past to make a blind man to see, or Else to raise up a dead man.

column7: To conclude, whosoeuer remayneth in Christ bryngeth furth fruite, by sufferaunce and pacience in the crosse, in aduersitee and afflictions.
column8: To conclude, whosoever remaineth in christ bringeth forth fruit, by sufferance and patience in the cross, in adversity and afflictions.

column7: Let him not forsake his vocacion, although he be persecuted, but let him rather be encouraged by affliction to maintayne his vocacion, that he may openly declare that he knoweth Iesus Christ to be his righteousnes and health.
column8: Let him not forsake his vocation, although he be persecuted, but let him rather be encouraged by affliction to maintain his vocation, that he may openly declare that he Knoweth jesus christ to be his righteousness and health.

column7: What should bee the let, but he that remayneth in Christ, shal bryng furth much fruite?
column8: What should be the let, but he that remaineth in christ, shall bring forth much fruit?

column7: He that doth not tarrye in Christe, doth not bryng furth fruite.
column8: He that does not tarry in Christ, does not bring forth fruit.

column7: Fourthly, let vs well vnderstand that he sayth:
column8: Fourthly, let us well understand that he say:

column7: Without me ye can do nothyng, that is, ye can not bryng furth any profitable or healthful fruite, nor ye can do no good worke that is acceptable to God, except ye beleue in me,
column8: Without me you can do nothing, that is, you can not bring forth any profitable or healthful fruit, nor you can do no good work that is acceptable to God, except you believe in me,

column7: & tary by fayth in me.
column8: & tarry by faith in me.

column7: What is it to be and to tarrye in Christe?
column8: What is it to be and to tarry in Christ?

column7: Surely it is to beleue Iesus Christ to be borne of ye virgin Mary, to be very Christ,
column8: Surely it is to believe jesus christ to be born of you Virgae Marry, to be very christ,

column7: & this Christ to be the only propiciatorye and sacrifice for our sinnes, whiche hathe made reconciliacion for thee to the father, and for whose sake thou art made his son by adoption, and heire of the heauenly and celestiall kingedome.
column8: & this christ to be the only propitiatory and sacrifice for our Sins, which hath made reconciliation for thee to the father, and for whose sake thou art made his son by adoption, and heir of the heavenly and celestial Kingdom.

column7: By this faith thou art accepted for Christs sake of god:
column8: By this faith thou art accepted for Christ sake of god:

column7: by this faith thou art accompted afore god as iust:
column8: by this faith thou art accounted afore god as just:

column7: by this faith, what workes so euer they be that thou doest, whether they be of publicke or priuate vocations (here we do not speake of sinne, which canne not be doone by faithe) they be accepted of god, not as the honest doynges of Ethnikes, but as the true godly workes vnto euerlasting lyfe.
column8: by this faith, what works so ever they be that thou dost, whither they be of public or private vocations (Here we do not speak of sin, which can not be done by faith) they be accepted of god, not as the honest doings of Ethnics, but as the true godly works unto everlasting life.

column7: And here wee muste not thynke that god dothe giue eternall lyfe to the godlye for their merytes sakes, but that the godly taketh the righte of etrrnall lyfe by faith, for Christes sake.
column8: And Here we must not think that god doth give Eternal life to the godly for their merits sakes, but that the godly Takes the right of etrrnall life by faith, for Christ's sake.

column7: Therfore those workes that be done by this faith, bee called the fruites of eternall lyfe, partely, bicause they be done to declare our thankfulnes, for that yt we haue receiued the right of the kyngdome of heauen and eternall lyfe, and partely that they be rewarded with rewardes in the lyfe euerlastynge.
column8: Therefore those works that be done by this faith, be called the fruits of Eternal life, partly, Because they be done to declare our thankfulness, for that that we have received the right of the Kingdom of heaven and Eternal life, and partly that they be rewarded with rewards in the life everlasting.

column7: Who so euer shall bide in Christe that is. shall beleue that hee is accepted of God, and to be his sonne adoptiue for CHRISTES sake, hee what so euer he dothe, althoughe it seeme neuer so excellent and pleasaunt, pure and holy, it profiteth nothinge before god.
column8: Who so ever shall bide in Christ that is. shall believe that he is accepted of God, and to be his son adoptive for CHRIST'S sake, he what so ever he doth, although it seem never so excellent and pleasant, pure and holy, it profiteth nothing before god.

column7: To be short, they that do not remaine in Christe are those, which know the name of Christ, leadeth a wicked lyfe, walketh after the fleshe, and obeyeth to sinne.
column8: To be short, they that do not remain in Christ Are those, which know the name of christ, leads a wicked life, walks After the Flesh, and Obeyeth to sin.

column7: If Christe doth not tary in him, how shall he tary in Christ?
column8: If Christ does not tarry in him, how shall he tarry in christ?

column7: S. Iohn sayth: Hee that saieth I knowe him, and doth not keepe his commaundementes, is a lyer, and there is no truthe in hym.
column8: S. John say: He that Saith I know him, and does not keep his Commandments, is a liar, and there is no truth in him.

column7: And againe: Whosoeuer shal say:
column8: And again: Whosoever shall say:

column7: I loue god, and shal hate his brother, is a lyer.
column8: I love god, and shall hate his brother, is a liar.

column7: And S. Paul saith: If there be any man that shall not prouide for his, and especiall for his housholde, he is worse then an Infidele.
column8: And S. Paul Says: If there be any man that shall not provide for his, and especial for his household, he is Worse then an Infidel.

column7: It is very plaine, that those whych leade a wycked lyfe, althoughe they boaste themselues of the name of a christian, yet for all that they tarye not in Christe.
column8: It is very plain, that those which lead a wicked life, although they boast themselves of the name of a christian, yet for all that they tarry not in Christ.

column7: What shal be come of those that remain not in Christ?
column8: What shall be come of those that remain not in christ?

column7: Euen verely that thing, that belongeth to the vnfrutefull braunches, which are in the vine tree.
column8: Eve verily that thing, that belongeth to the unfruitful branches, which Are in the vine tree.

column7: <NOTE> These beynge cut away frome the vine tree, are profitable to no buyldinge as other woode and tymbre is, but beynge cast out a dores, they wyther, and the be gathered togither, and cast into the fier, and there be burned.
column8: These being Cut away from the vine tree, Are profitable to no building as other wood and timber is, but being cast out a doors, they wyther, and the be gathered together, and cast into the fire, and there be burned.

column7: And thei are profitable for nothynge els, but for to feede the fyer.
column8: And they Are profitable for nothing Else, but for to feed the fire.

column7: The selfe same thing is to be said of those, whyche do not tarry in Christe.
column8: The self same thing is to be said of those, which do not tarry in Christ.

column7: These serue for none other purpose, but euen for to be meate not for temporall fier that consumeth the braunches,
column8: These serve for none other purpose, but even for to be meat not for temporal fire that consumeth the branches,

column7: <NOTE> but they shalbe punished with perpetuall and inextinquible fire. and as Esay saith, where their worme doth not dye and the fyer goeth neuer out.
column8: but they shall punished with perpetual and inextinquible fire. and as Isaiah Says, where their worm does not die and the fire Goes never out.

column7: &c. Therefore good christian people let vs tarry in Christe, and let hys worde abide in vs, acknowledging him oure onlye satisfier for our sinnes, sauiour, and the pacifier of goddes wrathe.
column8: etc. Therefore good christian people let us tarry in Christ, and let his word abide in us, acknowledging him our only satisfier for our Sins, Saviour, and the pacifier of God's wrath.

column7: Fiftly, let vs consider and learne out of this gospel,
column8: Fifty, let us Consider and Learn out of this gospel,

column7: that if this his worde dothe tarrye in vs, if wee haue a sure and a stronge faith vnto it, declaringe our selfe thankfull towarde so worthy a benefactor with our obedience to kepe his commaundementes thus (I say) if we tary in him & his word tary in vs, then this promise,
column8: that if this his word doth tarry in us, if we have a sure and a strong faith unto it, declaring our self thankful toward so worthy a benefactor with our Obedience to keep his Commandments thus (I say) if we tarry in him & his word tarry in us, then this promise,

column7: Ye shall aske what ye will, and it shal be done vnto you. shal be perfourmed vnto vs Here is nothing excepted, either corporal, spiritual, or heauenly goodes.
column8: You shall ask what you will, and it shall be done unto you. shall be performed unto us Here is nothing excepted, either corporal, spiritual, or heavenly goods.

column7: What can a christen ma lacke, hauinge this firme and sure promise?
column8: What can a christian ma lack, having this firm and sure promise?

column7: for he sayeth: What so euer ye shal aske.
column8: for he Saith: What so ever you shall ask.

column7: Is ther any kind of people vpon earth, that hathe so rich and so excellent a promise, as a true christian hathe?
column8: Is there any kind of people upon earth, that hath so rich and so excellent a promise, as a true christian hath?

column7: No trewly. But let vs not swarue, the wordes of Christ are dligently to be consydered, and rightly to be vnderstand.
column8: No truly. But let us not swerve, the words of christ Are dligently to be considered, and rightly to be understand.

column7: Christe dothe not simpely saye:
column8: Christ doth not simpely say:

column7: What so euer yee wyll aske, it shall bee doone vnto you.
column8: What so ever ye will ask, it shall be done unto you.

column7: But thys sayinge hath hee putte before these woordes:
column8: But this saying hath he put before these words:

column7: If yee abyde in me, and my woordes abyde in you. wyth the whyche woordes is to bee vnderstande, that then shall bee vnto vs, what so euer wee wyll and shall aske.
column8: If ye abide in me, and my words abide in you. with the which words is to be understand, that then shall be unto us, what so ever we will and shall ask.

column7: Therefore, hee that wyll and aske those thynges whyche bee contrary vnto Christes wordes, and the whych be prohybited by the words of the Lorde, he tarieth not in Christ, nor the words of Christ abide not in him, wherefore this promise pertaineth not to him.
column8: Therefore, he that will and ask those things which be contrary unto Christ's words, and the which be prohybited by the words of the Lord, he tarrieth not in christ, nor the words of christ abide not in him, Wherefore this promise pertaineth not to him.

column7: Iohn in an other place saith This is the truste, the whiche we haue in him, that if we aske anye thinge after his wyl, he heareth vs.
column8: John in an other place Says This is the trust, the which we have in him, that if we ask any thing After his will, he hears us

column7: God hathe made manifest hys wyll by hys promises and Gospell.
column8: God hath made manifest his will by his promises and Gospel.

column7: Therefore those that shall call vppon God, and shall aske annye benefytes of him either corporal or spiritual, wee ought to looke into his gospel and promises, that we may know of theym, what thinges hee wylleth vs to wyll and to aske.
column8: Therefore those that shall call upon God, and shall ask any benefits of him either corporal or spiritual, we ought to look into his gospel and promises, that we may know of them, what things he willeth us to will and to ask.

column7: Of corporall thinges Christ sayth:
column8: Of corporal things christ say:

column7: Your heauely father knoweth, what nede ye haue of all those things.
column8: Your heavily father Knoweth, what need you have of all those things.

column7: Seke therfore first the kingdome of god,
column8: Seek Therefore First the Kingdom of god,

column7: & his righteousnes, and al these things shalbe cast vnto you.
column8: & his righteousness, and all these things shall cast unto you.

column7: Of spiritual things and heauenly goodnes the gospel of Christ is ful of them.
column8: Of spiritual things and heavenly Goodness the gospel of christ is full of them.

column7: As for this thing came Christ, specially, that al which beleueth in him shuld not perish, but haue euerlastig life.
column8: As for this thing Come christ, specially, that all which Believeth in him should not perish, but have euerlastig life.

column7: Therfore thou hast here put vnto thee, the treasure of al good things, which thou doest not wyll onely & aske, but also thou maist claim, if thou doest tarry in Christe;
column8: Therefore thou hast Here put unto thee, the treasure of all good things, which thou dost not will only & ask, but also thou Mayest claim, if thou dost tarry in Christ;

column7: and his wordes tarry in the.
column8: and his words tarry in thee.

column7: In conclusion. Let vs pray vnto the heauenly father for his grace, that he wil graunt vs through his holy spirit, that we may acknowledge Christ our sauiour and abide in him.
column8: In conclusion. Let us pray unto the heavenly father for his grace, that he will grant us through his holy Spirit, that we may acknowledge christ our Saviour and abide in him.

column7: Amen The gospell on S. Lukes daye. Luce. 10
column8: Amen The gospel on S. Lukes day. Luce. 10

column7: Woodcut illustration of St. Luke the Evangelist with a book and an ox.
column8: Woodcut illustration of Saint Lycia the Evangelist with a book and an ox.

column7: A Fter these thinges the lord apointed other seuenty and two also, and sent them twoo & two before hym into euery city & place whether he him selfe would come.
column8: After After these things the lord appointed other seuenty and two also, and sent them twoo & two before him into every City & place whither he him self would come.

column7: Therfore said he vnto them:
column8: Therefore said he unto them:

column7: <NOTE> the haruest is great, stut the labourers ar fewe.
column8: the harvest is great, stut the labourers Are few.

column7: Pray ye therefore the lorde of the haruest, to send forth laborers into his haruest,
column8: prey you Therefore the lord of the harvest, to send forth laborers into his harvest,

column7: Go your wayes: Beholde,
column8: Go your ways: Behold,

column7: I sende you forthe as sheepe amonge wolues.
column8: I send you forth as sheep among wolves.

column7: Beare no wallet, neither scrippe, nor shoes, and <NOTE> salute no man by the waye. <NOTE>
column8: Bear no wallet, neither scrip, nor shoes, and salute no man by the Way.

column7: Into what house so euer yee enter, fyrst saye:
column8: Into what house so ever ye enter, fyrst say:

column7: Peace be to this house.
column8: Peace be to this house.

column7: And if the sonne of peace be there your peace shal reste vpon him, if not, it shal turne to you again.
column8: And if the son of peace be there your peace shall rest upon him, if not, it shall turn to you again.

column7: And in the same house tarry styll, eatyng and drynkyng suche as they geue.
column8: And in the same house tarry still, eating and drinking such as they give.

column7: For the labourer is worthy his rewarde. THE EXPOSITION.
column8: For the labourer is worthy his reward. THE EXPOSITION.

column7: H Ere in this Gospel is fyrst to bee noted the earnest and diligent fauor of Christ towardes makynd.
column8: Here Here in this Gospel is fyrst to be noted the earnest and diligent favour of christ towards makynd.

column7: That where as he had sent into Galilee (as it appeareth in the chapter which goth before this) twelue ambassadours or messingers, whom he did call Apostles, to preache the kyngdome of God, and to confirme thesame preachyng with miracles, so when he perceiued the great desyre of the people to heare this his Gospel of the kyngdome of God,
column8: That where as he had sent into Galilee (as it appears in the chapter which Goes before this) twelue Ambassadors or messengers, whom he did call Apostles, to preach the Kingdom of God, and to confirm The same preaching with Miracles, so when he perceived the great desire of the people to hear this his Gospel of the Kingdom of God,

column7: & was goyng from Galile vnto Iury, he did chose out of his disciples other.lxxii. to go before him & preache, two and two together.
column8: & was going from Galilee unto Jury, he did chosen out of his Disciples other lxxii to go before him & preach, two and two together.

column7: Now therfore let vs heare with what commaundement and prerogatiues they wer set to preach.
column8: Now Therefore let us hear with what Commandment and prerogatives they were Set to preach.

column7: The occasio why he sent the, he shewed saiyng:
column8: The Occasion why he sent thee, he showed saying:

column7: The haruest is great, but the labourers are fewe.
column8: The harvest is great, but the labourers Are few.

column7: Here are fewe wordes, but waightie thinges are to be noted in theim.
column8: Here Are few words, but weighty things Are to be noted in them.

column7: Fyrst, that those whiche desyre to heare the gospel of Christ, are likened vnto the haruest.
column8: Fyrst, that those which desire to hear the gospel of christ, Are likened unto the harvest.

column7: For in husbandry euery thyng hath his tyme and grothe, vntil the sedes are rype and ready to be reaped.
column8: For in Husbandry every thing hath his time and grothe, until the sedes Are ripe and ready to be reaped.

column7: Fyrst the ground is plowed, then sowen, after the sedes spryng vp into grasse,
column8: Fyrst the ground is plowed, then sown, After the sedes spring up into grass,

column7: & groweth vp vnto stalkes, at length ye sedes increase and are reaped and caryed into the barnes. <NOTE> In lyke maner doth it chance with the husbandry in Gods felde.
column8: & grows up unto stalks, At length the sedes increase and Are reaped and carried into the Barns. In like manner does it chance with the Husbandry in God's field.

column7: First Moses with his law did tyl the ground, afterwarde the Prophetes didde sowe in the tyme of Iohn the baptist, the ayres did apeare:
column8: First Moses with his law did till the ground, afterward the prophets did sow in the time of John the baptist, the airs did appear:

column7: last of al, when Christ was come and had sent forth hys Apostels, came the haruest, and the corne was caried into Goddes barne.
column8: last of all, when christ was come and had sent forth his Apostles, Come the harvest, and the corn was carried into Goddess bairn.

column7: Now for asmuche as the tyme of preachinge of the gospell of Christe is the haruest time, let vs see what the corne is that is caried into this barne. <NOTE> The corne is partly the people whiche thoroughe the preachinge of the gospell are gathered into the barne of Christes churche, and partely also those good thinges, which men doo gather out of the gospell through faith.
column8: Now for asmuch as the time of preaching of the gospel of Christ is the harvest time, let us see what the corn is that is carried into this bairn. The corn is partly the people which thorough the preaching of the gospel Are gathered into the bairn of Christ's Church, and partly also those good things, which men do gather out of the gospel through faith.

column7: But what be those? is it not suche wheat and barly as the bely is fed with all?
column8: But what be those? is it not such wheat and Barley as the belly is fed with all?

column7: No suerly, but the thinge whiche the faithfull do gather in the haurest of the gospell, are spiritual:
column8: No surely, but the thing which the faithful do gather in the haurest of the gospel, Are spiritual:

column7: namelye, righteousnes before god and men, wherof the fyrste is by faith through Christ (for the iust lyutth by his owne faith) the seconde through obediens and the frutes of faith, and laste of all, the life euerlasting and heauenly ioye.
column8: namely, righteousness before god and men, whereof the First is by faith through christ (for the just lyutth by his own faith) the seconde through Obedient and the fruits of faith, and laste of all, the life everlasting and heavenly joy.

column7: This is that corne whiche is gathered in the haruest of the gospell.
column8: This is that corn which is gathered in the harvest of the gospel.

column7: <NOTE> Secondarilye it is to be noted, that as in this temporal haruest nothing is gathered into the barnes without greate sweat and labour, for ther must be diligent watch bothe daye and nighte, and the heate of the daye muste be tolerated and borne, and the handes must be hardened, so likewise, when ye shall gather the spiritual corne, much aduersitie is to be suffered.
column8: Secondarily it is to be noted, that as in this temporal harvest nothing is gathered into the Barns without great sweat and labour, for there must be diligent watch both day and night, and the heat of the day must be tolerated and born, and the hands must be hardened, so likewise, when you shall gather the spiritual corn, much adversity is to be suffered.

column7: For the more you do labour & suffre, the more corne yee shall gather into your barnes.
column8: For the more you do labour & suffer, the more corn ye shall gather into your Barns.

column7: Wherfore, seynge that nowe is the time of our haruest,
column8: Wherefore, sing that now is the time of our harvest,

column7: let vs not be idle and slothful, but cherefullye let vs take in hand the paines of the haruest, for he that doth gather in the heruest, (saith Salomon) is a wise child, but he that is slothful in the sommer, is a childe of confusion.
column8: let us not be idle and slothful, but cheerfully let us take in hand the pains of the harvest, for he that does gather in the heruest, (Says Solomon) is a wise child, but he that is slothful in the summer, is a child of confusion.

column7: And, O thou sluggard go to the Emmet, considre her waies,
column8: And, Oh thou sluggard go to the Emmet, Consider her ways,

column7: & learne to be wise.
column8: & Learn to be wise.

column7: She hath no guyde, nor ouerseer nor ruler:
column8: She hath no guide, nor overseer nor ruler:

column7: yet in the sommer she prouideth her meate, and gathereth her fode togither in the haruest.
column8: yet in the summer she Provideth her meat, and gathereth her food together in the harvest.

column7: Thirdely, Christ saith: <NOTE> Pray the lorde of the haruest, to send forth laborers into his haruest.
column8: Thirdly, christ Says: Pray the lord of the harvest, to send forth laborers into his harvest.

column7: Wher with is vndoubtedlye signified, that the trewe preachers are not shaken (as the prouerbe is) from the trees, but that it is needefull for vs to get them fro heaue with our praiers.
column8: Where with is undoubtedly signified, that the true Preachers Are not shaken (as the proverb is) from the trees, but that it is needful for us to get them from heave with our Prayers.

column7: You wil say peraduenture: Shall not we then study, and cause our children to be taught in holy scripture?
column8: You will say Peradventure: Shall not we then study, and cause our children to be taught in holy scripture?

column7: shal we only make a comon prayer, and haue a preacher suddely sent doune from heauen?
column8: shall we only make a Common prayer, and have a preacher suddely sent down from heaven?

column7: Verely Christe wold haue vs to be diligent in the educatio of our youth & in the study of his holye scripture.
column8: Verily Christ would have us to be diligent in the educatio of our youth & in the study of his holy scripture.

column7: For it is the duety both of the Magistrats,
column8: For it is the duty both of the Magistrates,

column7: & also of the parents, to help & prouid that youthe, yea that all menne (if it bee possible) be brought vppe in the study of goddes holye scripture, that euerye one maye bee readye to the ministration of the gospell.
column8: & also of the Parents, to help & provide that youth, yea that all men (if it be possible) be brought up in the study of God's holy scripture, that every one may be ready to the ministration of the gospel.

column7: But in so dooynge, we muste remembre, that it is not oure industrye, laboure and studye, that prouydeth the true preacher of the Gospell, but it is oure heauenly fathers gyfte, frome whome commeth euerye good and perfete gyfte.
column8: But in so doing, we must Remember, that it is not our industry, labour and study, that prouydeth the true preacher of the Gospel, but it is our heavenly Father's gift, from whom comes every good and perfete gift.

column7: And therefore we muste adde vnto our dylygent laboure, prayers, that god will vouchesafe to geue the increase,
column8: And Therefore we must add unto our diligent labour, Prayers, that god will vouchsafe to give the increase,

column7: & that he wyll illuminate those that we haue brought vp in learnyng and now haue called to the ministery of the church, with his holy ghost, that they may sincerely preach the woorde, and faythfully minister in the Churche of God.
column8: & that he will illuminate those that we have brought up in learning and now have called to the Ministry of the Church, with his holy ghost, that they may sincerely preach the word, and faithfully minister in the Church of God.

column7: I (sayth sainct Paule) haue plated,
column8: I (say saint Paul) have plated,

column7: Apollo hath watered, but God hath geue the increase.
column8: Apollo hath watered, but God hath give the increase.

column7: So than, nother is he that planteth any thyng, nother he that watereth, but God, whiche geueth the increase.
column8: So than, neither is he that plants any thing, neither he that Waters, but God, which Giveth the increase.

column7: Therfore shall not we plant, nor water?
column8: Therefore shall not we plant, nor water?

column7: Let vs not thynke so, for it foloweth:
column8: Let us not think so, for it Followeth:

column7: Euery one shall receiue his reward, accordyng to his labor.
column8: Every one shall receive his reward, according to his labour.

column7: For we are Gods laborers, ye are Gods husbandrye, ye are Gods buildyng.
column8: For we Are God's laborers, you Are God's Husbandry, you Are God's building.

column7: Wherfore, in callyng & receiuyng of ministers of the church we ought so to pray, that we do not neglect our duetie in the meane whyle,
column8: Wherefore, in calling & receiving of Ministers of the Church we ought so to pray, that we do not neglect our duty in the mean while,

column7: & so we ought to do our dueties, that we forgette not to praye also, that God wyll geue the increase, and his benediction vnto our worke.
column8: & so we ought to do our duties, that we forget not to pray also, that God will give the increase, and his benediction unto our work.

column7: Fourthly, wee lerne here the great daunger and persecucion that Christ hath called & seth his preachers in.
column8: Fourthly, we Learn Here the great danger and persecution that christ hath called & seth his Preachers in.

column7: For he sayth: Go your way, behold,
column8: For he say: Go your Way, behold,

column7: I send you furth as Lambes among the Wolues.
column8: I send you forth as Lambs among the Wolves.

column7: It is not vnknowen howe fearce, cruel, and rauenyng a beast a Wolfe is of nature against the vnarmed Lambes.
column8: It is not unknown how fierce, cruel, and ravening a beast a Wolf is of nature against the unarmed Lambs.

column7: This saiyng of Christ what is it els, but as he would say:
